really enjoyable . t : sweet malts and slight hop bitterness .  the mouthfeel of this beer is great . they do an excellent job with the carbonation and creating the perfect body for a beer .
the smell was sweet , malty , and smokey , which i really liked .  ( m ) - this is ridiculously smooth despite its hop dryness and woody bite . great carbonation level and balance .

the aroma is amazing . major chocolate aroma with a dose of roasted malts , vanilla , toffee and cocoa . sort of a letdown on the taste .  m : full body , and shockingly creamy . this brew is extremely smooth of the mouth .

the smell is nicely hopped .  very smooth and rich taste though and perfectly balanced . wonderfull to drink though think it should be drank as i do n't think that more age makes this one any better .

one of the best smelling beers i 've ever tried . good amount of pumpkin . clean and delicious . lighter side of medium in body . not sure if this is a drastic improvement from regular pumking , but this is surely tasty .  m : one of the most silky smooth beers i have had in quite a while . i would love it on cask , although the low carbonation is nearly perfect .

great hop bouquet -- sweet and juicy , with citrus highlights laid over a smooth backbone of stonefruit ( mostly red ; think cherries , plums , grapes ) , and a little oak . i really like the aroma this beer puts out . the body of the beer is a lovely dark amber color that tinges toward straw around the edges of the glass .  the mouthfeel is very smooth , with minimal aftertaste .
the aroma is very deep -- anise , fennel , mocha , coffee and a burning alcohol nose -- awesome . really a marvel . strange .  mouthfeel is thick and creamy , very nice .

do n't be turned off by the little green specks floating around as they are chucks of hops leftover from fermentation and help accentuate the huge hoppy aromas . pours a nice creamy golden color with slight greenish hue to foamy head . aromas of malts and hops give way to dried fruit .  excellent medium mouthfeel , that is slick yet dry - i could drink many of these but i am confident that time will lend complexity -- - please !

smell : great aromas of licorice and chocolate . overall , the beer is a bit rough around the edges , perhaps from importation , but that is certainly part of its charm .  the mouthfeel is exceptional and that is all i am going to say about this .

smell : varies as it warms : bacon , chocolate , hickory , raisin , wood and more ... taste : dope .  the mouthfeel is great , for the bittersweetness from the roasted malts provide the ideal amount of oomph to an otherwise creamy body .

2010 bottle had a ton of suspended sediment in a burnt orange body . wow , aroma is the big winner here . pumpkin pie with crust as it warms ; some clove came thru as well , and even somewhat herbal . pretty authentic pumpkin flavor - vegetable/squash quality , and good amount of spices , incl cinnamon , nutmeg , and clove - but not overpowering . decent volume of malty sweetness / richness ... touch of campfire as it warms . outstanding drinkability - this is the most aromatic and flavorful pumpkin ale you can buy at this level of abv .  m : super creamy as it should be .

an impressive nose . t : mouth puckering bitterness is the first thing i noticed . d , notes : this is very good . the type of beer that bas help move to the best of list .  finshes warming , hoppy & bready , very balanced approach mf : chewy with low carbonation & great balance dangerously drinkable , this would put you on your butt after a couple of pints but a really nice dipa

2008 vintage , into tulip . the nose is utterly complex with interplay of sour , sweet , fruity and sherry aromas . the sourness takes after balsamic vinegar which is quite intense denoting an aged example , as do the obvious sherry-notes . the malt is quite rich with caramel and slight chocolaty character while fruity esters are reminiscent of raisins , plum and black cherries . a very faint mushroom-like bitterness indicates that brettanomyces has been used to add sourness to this one .  mouthfeel was virtually perfect .

the nose ? wow ! intense citrus and definite grape fruit aroma is almost overwhelming , but in a very , very good way . never had anything like it taste : as i go for the 1st sip , i 'm almost squinting my eyes , expecting to drink a form of carbonated grapefruit juice .  i love the mouthfeel on this beer , probably my favorite part of it .

( s ) - a ridiculously rich aroma . awesome whiffs of oaky bourbon with sweet toffee and caramel with an even more glorious smell of cocoa covered dark cherries behind it . its strong , but smells really stinking good .  mouthfeel is heavy bodied and velvety smooth .

the aroma of this beer is really something -- it 's powerfully strawberry , like sticking your nose into a jar of jam . very appealing , assuming you 're really into the idea of strawberry beer . but i was disappointed with the taste -- it 's less strawberry lambic than just strawberry juice , a powerfully sweet , syrupy brew with no real malt or hop presence .  its very smooth and velvety , very nice .

if you are going to have a flavored beer , apricot is a good one . it 's all about the smell and the flavor . apricots and other fruits .  m - so so smooth , much more than expected , carbonation in perfect and maintains a light body . perfect .

aroma is as good as it gets ; fruits , flowers , grass and everything in the yard makes this smell like a spring day ; impressive . medium to light bodied , its taste is interestingly hoppy with a lot of fruits , but the bitterness is not prominent , and it is well balanced by an underlying sweet maltiness which increases its drinkability a lot . for the sake of comparison , this was on a small tasting with alpha king and arrogant bastard ; the taste is better on the other two ; but drinkability and aroma are better here .  the mouthfeel was buttery smooth as silk with full body and low carbonation .
a : distinctly black with a fluffy , pillowy 2 finger khaki head that resides to a one finger head . very impressive lacing .  thick lushious body and moderate carbonation .

stunning rich and assertive peach and banana nose . unfortunately , flavor , character and body do not follow . however , nothing in body , flavors or character could lead one to conclude that aging will help this dull , simple and short flavored beer with a fantastic nose . smell it ; do n't drink it .  m : medium body with a fantastic carbonation balance ! amazing here !
aroma is brilliant and vibrant , full of citrus hops and apricot . nice .  mouthfeel is what always gets me on these beers , i love the chewy creamy coats your throat feeling here .

attractive appearance , color was a high clarity reddish copper in the dim light , topped with creamy tan foam that left lots of lasting lace behind .  the mouthful is creamy with perfect carbonation .

it smells great t-comes in with grassy belgian malts and then belgian sugars that are fairly boozy and have a bitterness to them . i 'm not getting too many good hops in this .  smooth as hell , perfect weight and carbonation .

s : very , very nice . belgian yeast and sweet breads hit first , closely followed by pine and citrus hops . nice complexity and balance here .  mouthfeel - heavy body with mild carbonation . it 's perfect to me .

pours with a fat thumb head , with decent stout lacing ... smell is amazing , lots of sweet bourbon and chocolate plum ... lots of bourbon upfront but it really is remarkable how enjoyable it is , despite the fact that its like sipping straight bourbon ... this beer would age soooo beautifully ! a wonderful beer that i was honored to have tried at a really fun event , but that open bar kicked my butt in the end ! !  a nice smoothness develops into a wonderful creaminess .

aroma is very inviting with apple , pear , and an awesome yeastiness . the taste is n't as fruity and glorious as the incredible aroma but it is nice and earthy . there is a great toastiness to it and great caramel , bread and diacetyl butter flavor .  very creamy feel with a smooth molasses aftertaste .
pours very golden , pretty clear looking . great head that sticks around and some nice lacing .  mouthfeel is quite exceptional .

very nice , enticing aroma . smells great , but looks a mess : odd looking is the best that can be said for it . i guess it 's a lot like a really fun ugly chick ... maybe she do n't look so hot , but if you get to know her you might really enjoy the experience .  mouthfeel is outstanding , slick and effervescent .

5.0 s : this is my absolute favorite type of dipa , i can tell already . it has a malt bill that can stand up to the hops in flavor and complexity . hops are citrusy with emphasis on orange and grapefruit . malts are full of caramel flavor and dark fruitiness like a barleywine . i did n't know what the hell i was tasting . the malts were a big disappointment as it was n't as complex as i would have liked . mainly just has the caramel flavor . 4.5 d : i would definitely like to have this been again , but not too often since it 's quite expensive .  sweet malts are offset by crisp hops together producing a wonderful balance and mouthfeel . sooo smooth !
this beer was very jeckyll and hyde for me . the smell is also terrific : citrusy , apricot , peach ( as others have noted ) .  mouthfeel : low carbonation leads to thirsty gulps .
heaps of coco in the nose . roasted malt on the tongue , but the taste is surprising fleeting .  perfect mouthfeel .

huge fruity aroma , kind of a grapefruit/lemon hybrid . extremely bitter , even for a west coast ipa . this makes for a tasty , although not particularly well balanced , ipa .  very nice full bodied mouthfeel . easily drinkable .

really good . t : milder than the smell , with a taste of mostly apples and cider , creamy caramel , and a mild woody gin finish .  pours a rich copper with a creamy one finger head that that settles nicely leaving some light lace , deep intese fruity aromas with some underlying but very noticeable pine.wow a big flavorful barleywine very pacific coast piney and resiny upfront with a big fruity alcolholic finish the alcohol really hits.just a sublime creamy mouthfeel and pretty slick going down the hatch and it warms the insides.wow truley and awesome big brew a night cap that cant be beat .
aroma is nice , flavor is a bit less balanced though .  thick creamy mouthfeel and mild carbonation . smooth silky mouthfeel is lucious .

this beer smells amazing . t : very roasty , lots of coffee , lots of chocolate , some sweetness in the background .  mouthfeel is exceptional . it feels good in the mouth but leaves no lasting memories on the taste buds .

i thought is was a hefe at first , but upon tasting , i was corrected . smells of a crisp hop dryness and mandarin orange . the hops carry over in to the taste but it is backed by an odd cheerios like grain .  m : medium body with the perfect amount of smooth , yet lively , carbonation . truly excellent .

aquired through a trade with xpimptasticx , thanks wanted to try for a while a- well , it looks harmless , it looks like a regular dipa except it had hardly any head and no lacing but ... that 's where the similarities stopped s- incredible smell : blood orange , booze , hops on performance enhancing drugs and a faint mango in there t- sweet booze , like a orange hop liqueur or triple sec .  m - perfect carbonation .

very complex the joys of the smell were almost problems with the taste .  where this brew really stands out is the creamy mouthfeel . that smoothness works to perfection with sweetness , but does n't work quite as well with bitterness .

s - sweet malt , candy , prune , marmalade t - sweet malt that very quickly becomes medicinal ( cough syrup ) and spicy m - low carbonation and syrupy with a neutral finish d - enjoyable flavors , but the medicinal taste is overbearing  m- great body , great carbonation . feels good .

smell is superior . a robust but citrusy smell that you get a hint of straight out of the bottle .  mouthfeel : true german feeling on this beer . medium viscosity , rolls across the palate smoothly and is perfectly carbonated . great overall feel and authenticity .
smells and looks like a hefeweizen . tastes banana , tropical . citric . extremely refreshing , great summer beer .  m - smooth and creamy ! d - surprisingly good for an american porter .

pours with a red-brown body topped by a medium thick to thick foamy lasting head with good lace .  mouthfeel : oh wow , this is super-good . very , very creamy on the palate , with moderate ( but focused ) carbonation .

smell : wow . butter cream , pecan , caramel , custard . butter rum lifesaver , anyone ? awesome . taste : bready and nutty . not as complex as the aroma but still very nice . lingering alcohol finish .  fantastic mouthfeel .

aroma is very pleasant and soft sweetish malt with mild floral hops , hints of pine , slight citrus , it is a wonderful combination , i spent some time just enjoying the aroma . taste is a bit harsh grassy and sligthly lemony hops ; unfortunately the taste is soon gone and just pleasant and rather long lasting bittery aftertaste remains .  mouthfeel knocks this thing out of the park .

stunning and promising . t : a let down given the performance of the nose .  tastes great with a full creamy feel as it slides down . bitterness follows in the wake , lightly lingering , lapping leisurely .

beautiful fresh dry-hop aroma . the malt is not hidden , though , with a pale malt aroma blending in with the floral hop resins .  mouthfeel is medium bodied with low to medium carbonation , fantastically smooth beer , very very nice .
the nose is creme creme creme . the taste to too strong for the brule , which takes away from the nose of the beer .  really great mouthfeel of this one has won me over .
fruity and floral , very nice . t - slight malt at first taste , but the bitterness of the hops kicks in and lingers .  mouthfeel is perfection . perfectly carbonated and very refreshing .

smell is pure hops , limes , lemons ... .lemon marange pie ! great brew . memorable !  feels amazingly clean and fresh while keeping the flavor of charred wood and grains . smooth , creamy , full bodied , and almost a velvet nature . the carbonation is played on in the background as an overcoat . the simplicity of it overwhelms me .
nose is surprisingly funky . a very pleasant surprise .  perfectly carbonated , with a thick chewy body and a strong alcohol burn .
smell : smells fantastic . sticky , sweet , grapefruity , piney , lemony with a touch of pepper on the back end . i will try again , just because it was so delicious .  mouthfeel is fantastic .

exceptional aroma , not alot of ipas can match this , very floral and unique , with grapefruit and mango front , notes of apricot , lemons and lychee streaking through at times . brilliant nose , could smell it all day . turned out to be a rather balanced ipa , the nose was so great it would be hard to match on the flavor as well . if you can get this one fresh it 's absolutely worth it and the nose is unique even amongst the ever growing masses of ipas .  m - this is by far the smoothest ipa i 've ever had . the pour from a hand pump straight from the cask creates the perfect texture for this beer .

this is good , but it 's a little overrated here . it 's tasty and it smells fantastic . i know real porters have sour ale , but usually that sour ale adds creaminess , here it almost has a coors light sourness ( acrid-overdrive ) to it thats off-putting .  m - extremely smooth .

caramel and prune or fig in the aroma . lots of malty sweetness in the flavor , along with sticky fruit , but there is a graininess that is a bit astringent in there as well , though very minute . this is a pretty good beer , excepting the tiny bit of astringency .  m : the mouthfeel is dense and creamy and frothy ... and almost stout-like . excellent .

a - pours a clear gold with a small head that lingers throughout s - pineapple is the main nose with some biscuit and some other tropical fruits t - spicier and less tropical fruit than the nose portends . hops dominate with a little bit of malt .  mouthfeel - very smooth with a rich body and muted carbonation .

this is a really great nose . tastes not quite as good as it smells , but still solid . smells great and is solid all around - worth a shot .  mouthfeel is silky smooth , really nice . body fairly full and the beer leaves an impression all the way over the tongue .

aroma : it has that rare smell that is as full and alluring as you 'd hope it would taste : banana bread , roasted chestnuts , cloves , hints of chocolate , estery and phenolic notes . the finish is very clean , with lingering bits of pepper and chalky dark chocolate . mouthfeel : it has a very smooth feel even though the carbonation is quite prickly . the dark malts give it a fuller and more flavorful character than most saisons , although incorporating them also reduces the peppiness and refreshment of a traditional saison . would i get it again ? : yes . it 's a solid beer , and though not the pinacle of its style , a welcome alternative to traditional saisons . bottled : february 25 , 2011 served : may 6 , 2011 price = $ 8.99 at whole foods ( nyc ) additional notes : - international bitterness units : 30 - malt : pilsner , rye , crystal rye , black malt - hops : pilgrim , saaz  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is absolutely incredible for a milk stout .
s - mostly raspberry , which i found quite appealing . some caramel and roasted malt .  full bodied with creamy carbonation and a lingering sweet licorice finish .

the closest thing to bourbon county stout ive ever smelled . a wonderful nose of raisins , oak , vanilla , bourbon , chewy chocolate , cocoa , rum , and god knows what else . it seems there are citrus hops that are mixing without dropping a beer with the malt and creating this rather sweet fruity start . finishing with bourbon and a touch of alcohol bite . overall im pretty happy with this beer . huge thanks to crushedvol for this extra .  mouthfeel : perfect , just like champagne .
a real nice sniffer .  m : lovely . sort of creamy , without being too heavy .

s : caramel malt with a nice sweet spiced aroma . smells like brown sugar . t : tastes like a cola at first , then the hops hit you squarely .  the mouth feel is the richest and thickest i have ever tasted in a beer !

that settles into a nice thick lace covering most of the glass yes it 's a chocolate stout and the aromas defiantly back it up lots of sweet chocolate aromas some earthiness to it along with some hint of roasted malts flavor 's of dark chocolate are dominate not overly sweet with a coffee backbone it 's got this mocha thing going on the mouthfeel is medium to thin would have liked it a little thicker this is really one of the great chocolate stout 's especially for under $ 5 a bomber well worth the experience  mouthfeel is the star here . it 's plush , velvety ... is nice .

smells good . biscuits , the ginger is noticable in the aroma , tea leafs and toffee .  the taste starts with a slight carbonation . the carbonation builds to reveal a sweet velvet feel . a milk chocolate flavor with a roasted finisht showcases a great mouth on this beer .

the beer is a dark dirty orange , tons of bits of fruit float throughout the glass ... .the aroma is really nice , great notes of mango not at all overwhelming or too sweet , light pine resin on the back balances out ... the taste is a huge let down , most the sweetness is gone , light mango but a lot of medicinal/metallic/pine flavors are not great .  mouthfeel ; very tight and lively carbonation , slick and creamy in the finish , pretty complex and admirable .

very vibrant fruity/floral aroma with a hint of peat , grain and sweet caramel malt . all these blend perfectly together to make a fantastic aroma . certainly the best aspect of this beer . it tastes very much like the aroma - fruity berry , white grape flavors with a little herbal spiciness . the flavors are n't as rich as the aroma would suggest . a really nice beer overall . i genuinely enjoyed it , but i only with the flavors were richer .  fairly crisp in the mouth , with an exceptional smoothness going down .

an interesting double ipa with a very malty edge and bitter finish . smells of floral hops , much caramel and honey and autumn mornings . honestly it smells a lot better than the taste .  outstanding mouthfeel ! very drinkable .

there 's something indescribably beautiful about a stout in a pint glass s - a wallop of chocolate and dark roasted coffee , some malt and alcohol notes , but the smell of fermented hot chocolate rules the day t - same as the smell .  mouthfeel : fantastic . great carbonation , no real aftertaste and washes easily over the palate .
s. tons of beautiful hop aroma - a spring day in a can .  mouthfeel is outstanding . super thick and syrupy , that flavor coats the palate forever .
the aroma is a lovely `` double '' chocolate with lots of heavy roasted malts muted amongst the rich chocolate aroma .  mouthfeel is creamy smooth , thick body , low carbonation .
smell was deep with plenty of sweet chocolate aromas and bitter grains .  mouthfeel is thick and chewy , as it should be fir a beer of this strength .

appearance : the body is a deep black color . the head is a velvety light tan color , small bubbles , two or three inches tall , excellent retention as well and lacing .  the rich , smooth , roasted chocolate flavor works well with the silky body . this is definitely highly recommended , as the beers tend to be from great lakes brewing company .

aroma of spruce and tiger lillies . supremely floral . this is not the aroma of your average triple . this beer could be marketed as liquid potpourri , and i 'd be proud to buy a lame plug-in air freshener that smelled like this . certainly , all the qualities are there .  m : really a standout porter . carbonation is perfectly dialed in and gives a very subtle tingle on the tongue .

very sweet , but extremely complex . awesome . taste is intense sourness and bitterness , which tapers off to not much else .  it 's wonderful . alcohol tingles a little in the mouth and it 's certainly present in the aroma but buried 'neath the fruity yeast . expertly woven into the beery fabric of this brew .

amazing , both the most unique and best smell i have in a beer in a good long time . taste- a strong and front malt body .  mouthfeel- damn , this sh*t is creamy ! smooth , medium carbonation , but goes down super smooth . nice light bitterness in the aftertaste .

the smell was overpowering , with orange , banana and sour apple fruit like smells coming through on top of the bitter hop smell mixed with caramel to complement a golden/orange hue .  m. just perfect for what it is . very smooth and thick .
fantastic nose of bananas and wheat . i love it . very malty on the palate .  slick mouthfeel with perfect level of carbonation .

the brett funk really comes through . i wanted to like this beer after smelling it , but it just has an off bitterness and some tannins that make it less than desirable .  mouthfeel/overall : this beer is every bit of full bodied ; thick , chewy and creamy . everything an imperial stout should be . overall , a very good imperial stout that i 'd love to have full time access to .

big aroma for such a little head ; bright fruits , dried fruits , plum , cherry , red grapes , slight caramel and a smooth yeasty character . fruity malt character also displays some earthy , hearty grain notes and much of the same fruits as in the nose . nice medium yeasty twang marries well with the fruit notes .  not the stunner i was hoping for m- beautiful mouth feel . i sure hope this is not the `` great sculpin '' i 've been waiting for for that past few years .
the beer looks very nice . shows great retention and lacing .  mouthfeel : very thick and very very smooth , wonderful mouthfeel .

the smell is amazing -- like a nice plate of blueberries .  a faint bit of tannins in the middle of the tongue starts the finish , which is incredibly long with trailing , vineous notes of chocolate and spiced orange peel . ya it 's a bit like those warheads candies , but it 's tucked in such an incredible silky richness .

reminded me of candied yams on thanksgiving . almost no hops were detectable and the alcohol was hidden nicely . t : first sip was scrumptious , showcasing much of what i just smelled . unfortunately , as the drinks went by , so did the complexity .  it is exceptionally smooth and drinks perfectly for the style .

excellent so far . i suspect this might be what us pale ales would smell like if we got them fresh . taste is hop heaven , with serious bittering going on on my palate . good experience , but , at 12 bucks a 500ml , compared to local brews , it 's marked down 1 point , it just does n't compete  mouth-feel was velvety smooth and creamy .

bottle - a - 2 finger head w/ great retention , cative carb . and a golden-amber color s/t fruit/spice/funk .  mouthfeel : thick and chewy , yet not syrupy . carbonation is low and appropriate . in other words , spot on .
a - dark as night with a tall creamy dark tan head .  m : medium in body with a really smooth and creamy feel on the tongue .

has a mashed ripe banana smell with sprucey / piney notes .  however , the mouthfeel of this beer is phenomenal , on the tim of your tongue it tingles , in the middle it is smooth as silk , on on the edges it is a touch syrupy ( amazing ) a good beer , but not worth the price they charge for it .

s- very delicate yet strong lemony aroma . t- great yeast character elevates the otherwise bland hop/malt balance to something very enjoyable . m- very smooth yet light .  still i thought the aroma was alittle weak , but once it hits your mouth it is amazing .

very nice . taste : malty and strong with coffee .  super thick dark chocolate flavor , light coffee flavors , good coffee bitterness near the finish super creamy , heavier in body , extremely smooth and hopefully i 've mentioned the creaminess overall , i love this stout , give me more

the smell is very good , nice and spicy in a way that is concentrated without being overly intense .  the mouthfeel is super creamy and smooth . this beer coats the entire mouth in an almost velvety way .
a- a brown amber with a light brown head . good lacing .  it is a full bodied beer with perfect carbonation .

the smell is very fresh , crisp and clean ; truly wonderful . lots of citrus and pine aroma coming off immediately , mostly grapefruit with some floral grassiness as well , with some biscuity malt in the background . i could smell this a mile away and loved it . t : taste follows nose for the most part , leading off with citrus-pine hops with a sweet biscuity background . it 's fairly bitter , but the malt sweetness balances it just enough to keep it extremely pleasant and crisp . the taste was very fresh and very clean , ending as it began with a gentle , bitter , floral hop bite . the smell is exquisite , and the taste is juicy and not as dry as many similarly citrusy-bitter ipas , making it a bit more drinkable . with all the smaller breweries popping up in boston , and many focusing on more boutique styles , it 's great to see a new , local ipa that seems to be doing everything right without reinventing the wheel .  typical stone excellent mouthfeel .

smell : the highlight of this beer ... beautiful clean aroma of light fruits with a backbone of belgian yeast and a moderate citrus hint .  the mouth feel was excellent and one could tell the cask was being maintained properly .
smell was incredible . the usual stout aromas of coffee and chocolate and alcohol are balanced by an incredibly sweet blueberry aroma .  full bodied , super creamy and smooth . very nice .
poured out of a bottle to a beautiful dark color . really a beautiful beer .  mouthfeel is fabulous with an amazing carbonation . it 's perfect .

huge nose consisting of bourbon aromas with licorice , chilies and chinese herbs . smells exotic , like walking into some strange shop in chinatown . rich and oily with tons of spice and bitterness .  mouthfeel is quite amazing , therefore the 5 .

it looks similar to a darker version of a rose champagne . the nose has cherries and some pear .  visibly effervescent , the mouth feel is perfect ... classic rich micro bubbles lend a smooth creamy texture .

probably one of the more amazing lager aromas , it 's truly crisp and fresh , i could smell it all day . the flavours are light , but the aromas quite amazing . indeed overall this beer is much better than even most european lagers .  the hop particles make it sticky as hell , the rim of my glass is sticky , my lips are sticky , and the mouthfeel is outstanding ! as far as double ipas go ( which let 's face it this is really comparable to an ipa ) , i still prefer either pliny or any of the alpine ipas , but this is a nice change of pace .

the aroma is strong thick sweet and syrupy . including pine , alcohol , vanilla and oak . overall it 's very nice , i 'd like to see how it would do with another year or two to tame the hops down .  m- the first thing i notice with this is how smooth and creamy it is . d- a very enjoyable english barleywine . tasty .

smelled fantastic ! citrus fruits dominate - grapefruit , lemon , orange . taste was disappointing after the wonderful smell . the smell was very sweet , but it tasted bitter and sour . actually , the taste is pretty appropriate , since it tasted like unripened fruit . this is the the first of the vertical epics i 've tried and i was n't very impressed .  m : thick , full-bodied , and very creamy . low to moderate carbonation .

aroma is a sweet malt-candy smell , bready , with a note of ginger and sourness . this beer tastes almost as good as it smells .  mouthfeel was full , thick , and creamy with a rich sweetness on the tongue .

overall , this beer looked and smelled great , but has too much bite to really enjoy .  mouthfeel was phenomenal - silky smooth and with a slight hops bite on the tongue , giving 'way on the finish to a great caramel sweetness .

very sweet aroma as if a tripel plus fauna , citrus and a spiciness i ca n't define .  this is a big , complex , full bodied beer . the huge amounts of malts in this thing are chewy and even feel like they stick to the teeth some .

really , this is an outstanding looking beer .  m - this is one of my favorite parts so far about this brew . moderate amounts of carbonation that whirls around your tounge and warms it in the process .

it is cool watching the carbonation rise from the bottom to the top as the beer becomes less hazy as it settles .  the mouthfeel was silky smooth , and i think it was the best feeling oatmeal stout i have ever had . the low carbonation perfectly complemented the medium body , and the smoothness from the oatmeal made it a joy to drink .

aroma is highlight of the beer , a rich , unique blend of dark fruit , bourbon , chocolate syrup and light roast . one of the better heavy seas treatments and they 've somehow managed to salvage a base beer i typically deplore with a passion .  mouthfeel is thick as hell and creamy , perfect for a big ris this is smooth as hell , much smoother than beers with this much ash flavor usually are .
smells nearly exactly like pumpkin pie . this was my first pumpkin beer , and it 's not a style i 'm particularly enamored with .  smooth creamy mouthfeel that keeps you wanting another drink .

i noticed a nice hop bouquet on the nose which suggests it was dry-hopped . maybe it was n't , perhaps just really fresh as the beer had a born on date suggesting the beer was less than two weeks old .  f : wonderfully thick .
aroma : very sweet and pleasant smelling . a little fruity with banana 's the predominant smell ( in terms of its fruitiness ) .  super thick mouthfeel .

smell- this smelled like pure chocolate and coffee , my mouth was watering upon the smell .  the best part of the rwanda gatsinga coffee stout is in my opinion the mouthfeel which is extremely smooth and leaves a pleasant malty coffee-dominated aftertaste and a smile on your face .
smell is amazing . has a spicy fruity smell .  huge bodied and full ( again , suggesting iipa classification ) . this is a beauty on cask .
head is enormous and really nicely laces . retention is amazing .  however , it tastes great and feels great in the mouth .

super fragrant with aromas of citrus ( grapefruit ) and , actually , agave nectar . there 's a quality about several victory beers i 've had of late ( well , just this and the helios ) that i 'm not that into . that is , a somewhat caustic bitter end .  the taste is initially of a very light porter and with a clean aftertaste that becomes a fruit sensation on the palate . the hop/malt balance is the real achievement here and it really contributes to the supreme drinkability . the smell upon opening the bottle is not an effective contrival of the taste that this beer is hiding as it only gives you an idea of the rooted flavor that is to be unleashed , the supreme balance and sublime flavor . great bier .

aromas of lots of different berries ( strawberies , blueberries , blackberries , and raspberries ) . i would get a different berry every time i sniffed . the berries were done nice ! good thing i like all the types of berries in this one .  the mouthfeel was amazing . nearly full-bodied .

very nice and original beer - more body would have been better but still a great treat from a great brewery .  awesome . drinkability : the mouthfeel is the star here , and not detecting most of the alcohol only helps .

a : beautiful head about 2 fingers thick that never goes below a half finger thick , ever . golden/amber in color , looks like honey . honestly , one of the best looking ipas ever .  great full and luxurious mouthfeel , witha soft , albeit intense carbonation that really lifts the brew .

s - sweet complex dark stone fruits . cinnamon apple fig . with a bit of pimento . mild oaky hickory hop smells . although not as complex as the smells it is yummy .  perfect example for a ris , and probably my favorite mouthfeel amongst them all .
short 's nailed this one . spicy tomatoes , peppercorns , alcohol , tabasco , peppers .  m/d : a full , silky smooth brew with low ( perfect ) carbonation .
smells very floral , earthy , cedar wood .  in my mind , this is the perfect feel for an imperial stout .

it could stand to have a little less heat , but it was otherwise pretty delicious . again , it 's slightly hot , and seems a little less rich than the smell , but it 's still quite good . m - pretty much flat , syrupy aftertaste , thinner than i 'd expect for a 10 % brew .  taste again where do i start ... sweet , spicy dark fruits soaked in alcohol ( raisins , currents , dates ) , toasted caramel notes , bready , some brandy / rum traces , biscuity , warming alcohol , spicy hop bitterness forces itself through the sweet maltiness , light madeira wine hints ... feel - so silky smooth ... rich and creamy ... light viscousness.. low drinkablilty for this one - a beer for savouring and sipping slowly ... overall - a phenomenal beer ... highly recommended .
very ripe strawberries and a bit of peach . not complaining , though ... one of the best aromas i 've ever encountered .  m- feel is exceptionally clean and smooth .

nose is simply stunning . soaring sour limeade with an intense barnyard element , a good smack of leather , and just a hint of very sweet malt .  nice caramel aftertaste held on the tongue by the thick mouthfeel . creamy thick mouthfeel and modest carbonation .

the smell is exceptional . tons of different scents .  m - absolutely creamy and delectable ! the amazing , tiny bubbled froth envelopes and contains any alcohol sharpness that would otherwise make this 8.0 % beer a bit fiery in the swallow . superb . d - the mouthfeel makes this otherwise straight-up scotch ale an incredibly drinkable beverage . but be careful ! at 8 % , this beer is like getting a two-for-one special in each pint !

sweet tropical notes , mainly mango accompany a major amount of hops in the scent . there was a lot i liked but overall very good .  considering the abv , the mouthfeel is perfect . d - at 12 % , you obviously ca n't have that many .

nose : chocolate and caramel , some fruit notes like plums , brown sugar . quite sweet smelling , marshmallow and milk chocolate . nice roasted malt character as well , a bit of burnt toast , a bit coffee .  m : outstanding mouthfeel , is very smoothe and refreshing .

aroma is powerful , though not overbearing . piney/resiny hops are dominant , yet there is also a good helping of pineapple , tropical fruit and caramel .  mouthfeel is intensely smooth and velvety , creamy and luscious . lactic milk sugar contributes a boatload of palate-smudging heft . although it 's not one for sessioning , it has a sublime quality that makes you savor every sip .
has a nice aroma of sweet carmely malt and spicey hops .  the texture is just flat-out perfect and this is about as easy to drink as you can want .

the smell is extremely vibrant and spicy reminding me immediately of egg-nog . despite being very interesting and flavorful it becomes difficult to drink about halfway through .  the mouth feel is perfect - not watery , not syrupy , well carbonated , and very refreshing .
really complex nose . smoke , bourbon , dark cherry sour notes . the taste was excellent . really nice with the bourbon not over powering .  mouthfeel is full and round .

a : peppery spice with citrusy fruit , somewhat leathery . a : clear golden yellow with a tight white head f : dry , with fruit ( apple/citrus ) and spice up front . o : good interpretation of saison . nice and dry with plenty of character . there 's something tangy tht decreases my overall enjoyment .  the alcohol burns just a bit in the back of my throat , but overall the mouthfeel on this is amazing . d- wow !

the bouqet is powerful , with bubble gum , circus peanuts ( the candy ) , bananas , caramel , toffee , honey , flowers , and a hint of the big alcohol that awaits . drinkability suffers due to the huge abv . this went well with a salty , deep blue cabrales from spain .  the mouthfeel is right on and this one is immensely drinkable .

aroma is hugely redolent of skunky , sticky bud if you ask me . hugely hoppy , very fresh , quite similar to rubbing a fresh hop cone in your hands and sniffing . not unenjoyable , but very bitter , so much that i did n't really notice much else .  very light carbonation and a perfect body for a porter , combined with what i have already mentioned , makes this a very drinkable proposition .

perfect . not as great as the nose but still excellent . m : prickly hops , of course , some mild warmth from the alcohol , and some light carbonation .  the mouthfeel was spot on and the taste was close behind .

the smell is the best part of this beer . it ' sweet and refreshing , almost like woodchips or taking a walk in the woods on a brisk fall afternoon . upon first drink , the extreme hops and alcohol content are apparent . the alcohol is not yet well incorporated into the beer and combined with the hops makes this very difficult to drink .  m - big bodied , thick , and viscous as hell . middling carbonation fades to a really dry and herbal finish like green tea . wicks all moisture from my mouth !
the smell is wonderful , definitely loved the smell of this one . very balanced beer .  m- full body in the mouth and sticky on the lips .

s : quite good . vinous , and i 'll assume chardonnay-like , notes are at the forefront , with brett and lemongrass also inserting themselves into the mix .  the mouth-feel was what was remarkable to me , very thick and creamy , i would liken it to a stout milkshake , really satisfying and enjoyable to drink .

s - strong citrus and pine/juniper nose on it . very fragrant making you expect a delicious taste to follow . m - lots of bitter tangy sensation at the back of the tongue following a few sips , but strangely lite and unsatisfying . d - decent drinkability , but not exceptional . it 's a strange beer : starts off great with an impressive hops-laden nose , but then does n't really delivery .  sweet flavor that i ca n't put my mind on ... m - excellent presentation , really enjoyable to the senses .

break out the smoked sausage , the perfect beer to accompany it is here . alaskan smoked porter is beautifully smokey . one whiff makes you think you 're in a great deli , loaded w/ good smoked sausage .  a - opaque for sure ; not quite black , but very dark brown ; 1/2 '' tan/light brown , creamy head that diminishes to a thin layer pretty quickly ; lacing here and there , around the glass s - very nice aroma going on here ; notes of roasty malts , dark chocolate , hints of milky sweetness , and nice qualities of gingerbread too t - dark chocolate , vanilla , cinnamon , and ginger come first ; milky sweetness lasts from start to finish that is reminiscent of espresso ; slight bitter finish with roasted coffee beans and ginger as well m - medium to full bodied ; slight dry finish ; some carbonation that feels nice on the tongue ; can feel some warmth from the 9.2 % abv ; texture is very milky , creamy , velvety smooth o - i just ca n't get over how exceptionally smooth this beer really is .

very nice . t : sugar sweet ( touch of brown sugar ) along with some malt sweetness .  the mouthfeel is luxurious , thick , and chewy . amazing . i am impressed with this brew . flavors are great and the mouthfeel is unearthly .

aroma is , simply put , magnificent : very sweet with dark caramely sweetness and fruity banana sweetness . brilliant . although not as strong as aroma , the taste is equally complex : dominated by banana-caramel flavor , with slightly tannic and slightly bitter finish . some alcohol helps , but still , the overly sweet aftertaste kills almost all the pleasure derived from drinking this one .  taste & mouthfeel : smoothness is impeccable within the moderate body , big doughy biscuity malt flavour is the showcase of this brew .

it poured caramel brown in color with a big , fluffy and frothy off-white head to it . a thin , frothy layer remained covering the beer well into drinking it and left some great lacing as well . exceptional looking barleywine overall .  m : very creamy feeling , small bubbles , not too sticky .

it smelled of hops and dark fruit and i was very much ready to try it .  i keep tasting chocolate ice cream ... dry chocolate ice cream ... not cloy at all ... very fantastic finish and mouthfeel ... german beer ftw will buy again !

it has the wonderful spicy aroma that the style should always have . slight phenols , cloves , a sweet bready malt and a beautiful underlying fruitiness are all there . it finishes very very clean and does n't linger at all .  mouthfeel : delightfully creamy and full-bodied . very pleasant .

outstanding complexity . tastes like various coffee creamers ( amaretto , irish cream ) poured over pumpkin pie .  appearance : amber , clear carbonated , medium head smell : alcohol , grapefruit , and citrus taste : alcohol , grapefruit , malts , hops , and slight caramel mouthfeel : smooth , slightly hard finish , can feel the carbonation ... it is amazing how smooth and unbitter this beer is for a beer with its abv drinkability : i will have this again , but may be one of the few that prefer the 60 minute ipa .
a big floral hop aroma -- smells great . taste is bitter hopiness , floral and citrus .  the mouth feel is amazing on this beer .

looks find s- awesome citrus hop aroma , much more aggressive than i expected from a tiny , 4 % bitter . insane ! lovely m- body is overall pretty thin , nothing to see here o- awesome sessionable beer .  mouth is extremely crisp , clean with tremendous carbonation and a nice light body .
smells delicious and this scent would be a great air freshener .  mouthfeel the best part of this beer , really smooth with just a little bit of carbonation .
nice aromas do n't match the taste anymore .  lush , creamy mouthfeel , that really could n't improve at all .

sour cherries , fresh-pressed apple cider , mild marble rye , yeasty esters and a faint touch of alcohol . complex and rewarding . effervecent and envigorating without overwhelming the tongue . much lighter than the appearance would lead you to believe and it resembles many other belgian-style ales in this regard . maybe not everyone 's cup of tea but i find it to be immensely drinkable and the alcohol is hardly noticable . quite good .  taste : excellent entry on the tongue & palate , beautiful , yeasty , rich and fruity . soft , yet earthy , hoppy , full-bodies , and delicious . an excellent tripel , for the sugary aspect was much more subdued than other offerings which misinterpreted , perhaps , the portions of the sweetness in the style . seemed nothing more , or less , than perfect , without being mindblowing .

really fantastic nose , the raspberries shine through . good interesting beer that is cool to try to reach both the girls and the boys beer drinkers or not .  interesting effervescent mouthfeel makes it a pleasure to savor .

appearance : deep , rich , amber red . poured semi-aggressively to yield 2 fingers of nice , tan , creamy head which started to reveal some interesting pitting after a bit . moderate lacing .  a - bright golden orange color with some chill haze present , two fingers of white frothy head that leaves thick froth-lace s - not too much rye here , just hints ... hops and bready malt t - hop bitterness up front , sweet bready malts in the back , only a hint of rye in the middle ... the malt backing is about as significant as it gets ... taste 's more like a straight up ipa than most rye beers i 've had m - hops tingle the tongue and give way to very thick , chewy malts that slide down nicely ... full-bodied and very enjoyable d - this is a reeeally well-balanced beer , i just wanted more rye flavor .

s - bitter coffee , good coffee smell . this is disappointing . the nose is really good , but you do n't get much of that coffee on the tongue .  mouthfeel is very good , a light bodied beer with excellent carbonation ; it dances on the tongue and finishes smooth .

aroma is big sweet , multitudes of dark fruit , caramel and quiet peat moss . quadish exceptional highly complex flavor , something for everyone . sweetness not equal to the expectation from the nose . the evolution of the taste is significant .  great mouthfeel .

another malt bomb for me . lots of rich malts with dark fruity characteristics . plumbs come to mind with a cranberry aroma layered with cinnamon and a maple kind of sweetness . the taste is not quite as rich as the aroma . slight hints of pine and not quite as much fruit presence as i 'd expected . decent , but the aroma certainly outshines the actual flavors .  mouthfeel- this is an exceptionally smooth saison , with the mouthfeel rivaling that of the saison dupont , my favorite of the style and one of my favorite beers . the tank 7 is definitely a thicker beer , very complimentary to the flavors .
taste is a bit of a let down compared to the amazing aroma . a really good ipa .  perfect . d : great taste , but a bit rich to drink in volume .

it 's a very appealing smell . taste : part belgian wit and part apple cider blended together . the smell is really good , but the taste is a bit disappointing in comparison . the good aromas in the smell do n't show up in the taste .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , like an expensive champagne and it finishes very dry .

pours bright orange , with a nice soapy head incredible hop aroma , tangerine , grapefruit , malt biscuit and some caramel sweet upfront with a bitter pine , citrus hop bite and a hint of booze very creamy , delicious and pretty well balanced for a double ipa overall it was a very enjoyable beer .  mouthfeel- light palate with great carbonation that tickles the senses nicely .
smells sweet and inviting . very light caramel malt in the nose .  it has a wonderfully creamy mouthfeel that makes each sip a pleasure .

probably the sweetest ipa i 've run across . aroma of candy and berries . nicely hopped with clear strawberry and other berry notes .  mouthfeel . amazing , thick rich and seems sweet but comes together .
this brew has a delicious smell of peanut brittle and roasted malts .  very nice finish ... it is incredibly smooth for an imperial beer .
powerful hop aroma , lots of citrus . pleasant , but nothing to get too excited about .  wonderful carbonation .

a harmonious aroma of raisins and rosemary , dominating . dates and caramel , intoxicating sugars . wow , taste is right there too . it 's just alluring .  great creamy thick mouthfeel , light carbonation .

i bought it because i thought it was a summer pale ale , as the label says its an ale . aroma of lemon zest , cracked peppercorns , sunflowers , corriander , earthy hops and some gritty grain aroma .  body is velvety , full , round , and waiting to be enjoyed like a dangerous fruit i have in mind heh heh . finish is a fascinating contrast between exquisite and coarse , not too long and proly not a session unless ur into gettin hauled off .

the smell was excellent . i happen to love maple ( though i confess it is n't something i usually have in my beer ) , and the rich malty aroma of nutty maple notes was divine . ah , well this is a toughie for me because i 'm sure that this is the perfect beer for my girlfriends who are n't so crazy about things that resemble hops , barley , malt ... or hmmm.. beer .  the silky smooth mouthfeel was fantastic and carbonation was spot on .
smell- nice nose of hard alcohol , vanilla , deep caramel and barrel flavors .  mouthfeel : truly phenomenal creamy medium body with the slightest touch of syrup likeness .

i smell orange , tangerine , kind buds , papaya , pine , and hints of rock candy . the aroma is lovely ! it smells like someone is peeling an orange next to me . good , but not as amazing as the nose .  the mouthfeel on this is exceptional , so smooth will alcohol masterfully controlled .

it reeks of pumpkin pie without being too aggressive with it . the pumpkin pie aroma does n't dominate the taste and it actually tastes like a beer instead of some kind of pumpkin pie flavored wine cooler .  m- big , full body ... oily , almost syrupy with unattenuated sugars . very chewy , and it coats the mouth so well . just wonderful .
very very nice . very complex .  m - fairly heavy body and solid flavors with moderate carbonation . the flavors are spot , the mouthfeel is amazing and its very drinkable .

smell : this is an outstanding smelling beer . floral , hoppy and piney with a hint of grapefruit and orange . overall : if this beer tasted as good as it smelled and felt as good as it looked it would be one of the best in the world . it is still pretty good , but not what it could have been .  mouthfeel is fantastic ... light , dry , well carbonated , and quite bitter .
very hoppy taste . right away you can smell the cascade hops which it smells like its been dry hopped . hopefully i bought an older six pack  m - perfect . it 's velvet on the tongue .

sm : brilliant mix of cream , coffee , chocolate , and nuts . a light strength aroma . rich and complex . the alcohol does come through unfortunately , which jabs into the otherwise well-executed balance . it 's quite well built , though i do n't think its abv is warranted .  mouthfeel : it is crisp , light , and perfectly carbonated .
i absolutely loved this bottle .  '' love the mouthfeel .
s - bold and beautiful malt and hop aroma . t - mild bitterness follows the bread crusty malt .  mouthfeel is extremely smooth & this is a perfect beer to sip on on a lazy pm with no kids in sight !

smell is very nice .  s - sweet malt , molasses , licorice and red grapes t - sweet dark malt and licorice with a pleasant spice finish m - strong carbonation with a chalky finish that subdues the strong alcohol taste nicely d - very strong licorice and spice flavors combined with a great mouthfeel that balances the alcohol

smell : chocolate , lots of malt , good !  body is the best part of this brew . flavors are all in check , mouthfeel is full and fat , with a straw-like dryness at the finish . this beer is exceptionally drinkable .
250 ml bottle from supermarket in nice pours amber/golden with large and soft head with excellent retention as the head lasts till the end of the glass , patchy lacing .  m : awesomely smooth .
aroma : incredibly aromatic , rich bitter chocolate , fresh roasted coffee beans , smoked oak chips , burnt caramel , woody .  wonderful body .
smell is an excellently projected , and wonderfully layered and clean tangerine , apricot , pear and lemon .  the mouthfeel was awesome with silky smooth liquid and superb carbonation .

very full and nice aroma , probably the beers best quality . the aroma of this beer is what really shines , everything else is just above average .  the texture on this is great . with the silky texture and sweetness , this is a good sipper , but nothing you 'd have more than 2 of in a single sitting .

poured from a growler into my new holland high gravity series glass a - black as can be with a small circle of tan/brown head s - tootsie rolls with a hint of hersheys chocolate . is this really a beer ? t - tootsie rolls with a hint of hersheys chocolate ... seriously though a little more going on in the flavor however .  what got me hooked was how smooth and creamy this beer was . fantastic . this beer is by far one of the richest and creamiest beers i have ever had .

really really strong nose - very sweet with notes of baking spices , vanilla , vanilla cake batter , pumpkin . there is also something about it that i 'm not sure i 've ever smelled before ... and i love it . t : lives up to the smell .  caramel , mocha , strong booze , brown sugar , raisins , figs , chocalate t-malt , mocha , booze , brown sugar , caramel , raisins figs , chocalate m-spicy , creamy , thick , barely carbonated d- pretty thick & filling .

pours a light tan , two-finger head , fades slowly and leaves a good lace . nice clear , deep amber color .  the light bodied liquid is easily gulped down and that jusssttt perfect carbonation tickles the tongue making for an extremely thirst-quenching and refreshing pilsner .
i can also catch a slight nose of peaty scotch if i catch it the right way . fantastic aroma here .  the mouthfeel is absolutely perfect for a porter , so smooth and silky .

s : i found the strong tart raspberry with a faint mandarin-orange nose to be both unique and satisfying . not overpowering , like some over-the-top fruit beers .  mouthfeel : wonderful balance all over the pallets and each taste-bud . the slightly raised abv can give cause to the minor warmth in mouthfeel .

the smell was great , had some cocoa , coffee , caramel , vanilla .  silky smooth thick bodied with a perfect amount of light carbonation and a ridiculously long lasting , balanced tart and sweet aftertaste .
there is a good strong malty and coffee like smell .  m - smooth , silky , full body with the perfect amount of carbonation o - great brew !

very interesting bouqet-smells very much like a moscato d'asti frum the muscat grapes . also floral , sweet honeyed bready malts , and fresh ( not roasted ) nuts in the nose . medium to full-bodied and viscous , this could present a cloying sweetness after a while and as such is not a session beer , but definitely something unique and worth trying .  m- the mouth feel is excellent for this beer .
it smells great but does n't live up to the smell .  the mouth feel is awesome . i let a full gulp roll around from cheek to cheek just to let my tongue play in the surf .

good hold on the head , a number of lace rings left behind as we go .  it 's as smooth as silk - perfectly suited as a dinner and desert sipper and easily the best porter i 've had the pleasure of tasting .

what struck me first was the phenomenally fresh smell . the roasted malt and slightly bitter hops hits your nose and just stays there , begging you to take a sip . while the beer is great , the taste did n't quite live up to the smell . a bit thinner than expected and a bit less complex than i had hoped .  the malt is well back but the beer still has a nice light body . the palate is a great balance of all that and a nice honey quality in the background .
has a solid malt flavor with a huge hop aroma . i could use a tad more bitterness but that is just a personal preference .  it 's exceptionally smooth with little carbonation .

s : great smelling beer . c-hops and american malts . potent nose . d : great beer , absolutely delicious , with the delicate touch of a masterful brewer .  m : an incredibly thick body and big , foamy carbonation . i love the way this feels .
overall : well , the smell is great , one of the best .  mouthfeel : so smooth and creamy . very refreshing .

huge waves of vinegar and tartness on the front followed by a very sweet cocoa character on the finish . very interesting . t : like the nose , the sour character of this beer makes a huge appearance .  wonderful mouthfeel .

crystal clear golden color with the thickest white heading i have ever seen on an ipa . fantastic lacing . a great looking ipa but the taste is just like many .  the texture is amazing . thick and silky , but because of the low abv , drinking this is just too easy .

s - amazing nose ; delicious notes of chocolate , slight coffee , and super smooth oat , with roastiness present but generally transformed into the aforementioned dimensions . it reminds me of the smell of instant caf mocha , prior to the addition of hot water . ) finally , there is an appreciable hop that comes in at the end and lingers , providing herbal and vaguely floral notes on the finish .  the mouthfeel is smooth and nicely done . excellent carbonation drinkability is good as well .

longneck into a cascazilla pint glass purchased at the brewery : ( a very cool glass with some red hops on it ) a - copper/red hue with about a 1/2 inch head that quickly died down to an outer ring and no lacing - maybe it was the glass ' fault s - straight up pine and citrus from the hops , also some malt sweetness in there t - a burst of hops to start with . taste like west coast hops , and not too bitter , probably lots of late mid/late hop additions and dry-hopping , as there is a great hop flavor and aroma to this beer without too much bitterness . good supporting role by the malt to keep the hops in check . awesome job combining the characteristics of a red ale and an ipa .  the mouthfeel is great and smooth as can be .
the nose is nice . very nice . the nose just teases me with anticipation that the flavor never delivers .  great mouthfeel - full yet fluffy , almost leaving my tongue numb .

no lacing was evident as i drank this aromatic ale . speaking of aroma , this ale wreaks of bourbon and vanilla with some burnt wood smokey notes to finish . close your eyes , or keep them open , and waft a smell and you 'd think you were sniffing a high ball . the flavor is bourbon upfront , charred wood , vanilla and brown sugar .  a very heavy body that is infinitely swishable in your mouth and extremely creamy . this beer is truly fascinating .

a : very cloudy amber with a gorgeous fluffy white head that dissipates slowly . the bottle conditioning is excellent , so a vigorous pour is unnecessary unless you want a glass of foam . excellent brussels lace .  the smoothness of the beer is very impressive , exceptional smoothness in what has to be a rather potent brew .

it 's quite clear and straw/amber colored . it has a very strong smell of fresh hops . pine , citrus , and maybe a bit of tropical fruit , but quite spicy . the smell is the only part of this beer to reflect it 's ipa label .  the best thing about this brew is the mouthfeel , which is thick and expands as it moves across the tongue to the back of the mouth . modestly drinkable , but with this great thick mouthfeel , it 's one to be savored slowly .
a : what a gorgeous beer . a good pour yields a 1.5 finger head that fades quickly , and leaves a decent amount of lacing around the glass .  m- incredibly smooth with a nice carbonation .

there is a strong , heavy caramel smell to the beer .  mouthfeel is absurdly rich and creamy , silky smooth and slurpalicious . ) it 's the best feature of this brew . i mean , i like the taste , love the mouthfeel , and would enjoy having two or three of these , but that abv is on the high end .

it is a gorgeous beer- excellent clarity , pale golden hue , and generously sized head .  m : medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation . exceptional in this category . appearance and mouthfeel are certainly worth noting .

there is something hypnotic about watching the beer cascade into a jet black liquid with a wonderful tan thick creamy head . to me , the head on this is the best of almost any beer , and has a unique look .  m : great , chewy and resiny , full-bodied and robust , with a smooth finish , compared to the rest of the sip , just what i 'm looking for in a double ipa .

a- pours a light amber with a quickly dissipating head s- wow , this smells incredible ! it smells like cinnamon , nutmeg , graham cracker , pumpkin , and brown sugar . d- it 's highly drinkable , however the alcohol is not as well-hidden as in some other st imperials .  m : glorious . so creamy and good . reminds me of a cask pour .

aroma is very hoppy . mainly floral hops . taste was not as bitter and flavorful as i was expecting , based on the smell . the floral hops and honey are present as well as some citrus fruits . overall , i was a lot more impressed by the smell of this beer as compared to the taste .  amazing mouthfeel . viscous , rich and creamy without being syrupy .

hints of orange and lemon dance around the intense aged oak notes , giving this beer an amazingly original and interestingly complex nose . wow . flavor is much as would be expected after the nose . sweetness rivals the heftiest of wheatwine honey-sweetness you 've experienced .  m : the best feature of this beer . rich , creamy , and silky as it goes down .
golding hops , great hoppy aroma . some barley initially .  mouthfeel is very crisp and smooth with some thickness from the yeast and bite from the hops .
s- the dry hopping really comes through nicely . it 's quite floral with just a touch of an orange juice aroma .  excellent ! incredible smooth and silky mouthfeel .

looks really good- reddish amber body , nice pock-marked cream-white head , and active carbonation .  extreme balance and smoothness in this beer , its quite good . big full body with a champaign like fizzyness . im impressed .

the nose is very complex , a mix of fruity , spicy , earthy and oaky tones . black licorice or anise also comes to mind . there is also a drying , acrid presence . drinkability of this one is lowered by the fact that i do n't really enjoy this old ale . i was really excited when i opened the bottle and i feel let down .  first sip reveals a soft creamy texture with mild rolling carbonation .

its smell is its best characteristic -- floral hops , malty , a hint of wheat -- really beautiful . the taste is sweety & malty , as well as bitter .  all kinds of malty goodness going on here - silky smooth , slightly pinpoint carbonation .

the smell is amazing . like i stated above , i 'm not big into coffee , but even this is appealing , and impressive to pull off . this porter does nothing but give off an intense and clean cafe au lait aroma , straight to the point . it 's greatest attribute is the aroma however , that is really phenomenal .  entering the mouth , i immediately take notice of the huge mouthfeel on this . this is fluffy , powdery , quaffable , and has this charming soft carbonation that is typical of great beers . palate displays a superb spicy bitterness executed in incredible balance and harmony ( this and the mouthfeel are the 2 attractions imo ) , gentle woodiness .

anywho , nice nose . love the nose . really nice citrusy hops with just a touch of wheaty sourness in there , but barely any . just a nice fresh smell . the beer has quite a bit of flavor for only 4.8 % abv .  full , thick , rich mouth feel .
n : this is a beautiful , mouthwatering nose . smells very close to liquid pumpkin pie .  mouthfeel is where this one shines , smooth as can be and perfectly carbonated , a light yet creamy quality .

the nose is great , with notes of roasted barley , chocolate malt , and a little bit of coffee . has some creaminess as well which is very nice . the beer is medium bodied , but is a bit light on carbonation .  the mouthfeel on this beer is almost perfect . a nice smooth drinkable beer .
s : a very rich banana/clove mix , just about perfect . no hops , no nothing .  this beer feels absolutely perfect in the mouth .
luckily , the aroma of this beer is quite good . a butterscotch maltiness was immediately noticeable and complemented perfectly with floral and spicy hop notes .  smooth and rich on the tongue .
smell : sweet and pungent . horseblanket nose . spicy belgian funk is reminiscent of a gueuze .  thin in the mouth but heavy on the tongue . perfect for the style and the season .

i 've had a few of these and this one plays up the humidor to 11 . incredible . t. the jai alai flavor is played down a bit to the predominate cedar flavor . the grassy and citrus hops are very nice with a good malt .  mouthfeel : exceptionally smooth and silky as can be .

the smell is a big whack of fresh sweet raspberries . damn , the taste does not live up to the pleasant smell . the alcohol burn is way too strong and blurs out the other flavors that hopelessly tries to emerge .  thick with just a little bit of slickness and just enough carbonation . sly fox oatmeal stout is a solid beer with a fantastic mouthfeel ; probably something i would order again .
smell : very , very fruity ! it smells almost as good as a lady .  mouthfeel- medium bodied ale for sure and had small amount of carbonation . very creamy , and left a easy feel on the tongue .

aroma has pleasant vinous overtones , port . superb taste is exactly as expected from the nose . the figs are turning .  the aroma speaks strongly of roasted grains , as you would expect from a stout , while on the tongue the beer has tremendous body .

s : big fresh aromas of earthy grapefruit , and vanilla cookie dough . t : bit of a let down here .  regular boris has the most incredible smooth palate and this follows suit . so silky smooth from the oatmeal . definitely an interest beer for this alone .

very citrusy grassy hoppy aroma . nice tangerines and grapefruit mixed with oily grassy hop . really runs the gambit of all the hop aromas nicely . there 's also a nice residual sweet biscuity aroma from the malt .  m : the feel is exactly how i like my imperial stouts . there is a decent amount of carbonation in there as well .
this is a stunning looking ale : dark-brown with a ruby glaze , bubbles dancing toward the top like a light snowfall in reverse , crowned with a creamy mocha head .  one of the best mouthfuls ever !

brewery states they did pick up some brett recently , popped the cork off ... corked talked about brett to me , more fruit than funk . hops stay modest . mild tartness , infancy of the brett ? it does have a ghost-like funk within . sweet roasted finish , pretty much burnt sugar . not a hair short of being great , the brewery admits to some funk ... wish i had another bottle to see where it goes .  mouthfeel is really impressive . very gradual on the tongue and extraordinarily balanced .
pours a clear amber , and a massive pillow of ivory capped this beauty . plenty of sheet lacing surrounds the volcano of head in the glass .  great bubbly mouthfeel , no aftertaste at all .

big hit of citrus hops right off , mostly grapefruit . pretty complex . orange and cloudy . poured with not much head that fades to not much less but still not much head .  m- really interesting . a dry feeling on the sides of the tongue and a sweet feeling in the back . really well done .

a little swirl allows a bit of malt to show up , which smells simple enough .  finishes dry with nice mocha notes & a touch of charred grain mf : very oily & smooth as all hell with low carbonation & nice stickyness .

s : abundant floral hops , definately some cascade . the perfect combination of floral , bittering , aroma , in a showcasing of hops that is presented beautifully , well balanced and tame but not lame .  moderate body , excellent smoothness .

big piney and resiny hops fill the aroma , backed by a pretty sizeable maltiness . tobacco and bread come to mind . the malts may dominate the hops in this aipa , which almost always results in an iffy beer , that has you questioning the style .  the carbonation is just right here .

aroma was very pleasing . deep and rotund hop nose is neither too flowering , too citrusy , and definitely stops shy of being too grassy . really a unique aroma , something that has become kind of rare these last few years .  the mouthfeel was awesome - very creamy and full bodied .

the beer has massive yeasty bready smells . the beer has a very good combination of fruity ( apples , grapes , pears , plums ) jelly smells . oddly enough the smells of this beer bring back memories of my grandmothers kitchen smell .  mouthfeel - smooth , evenly carbonated , and a perfectly solid body .

it smells distinctly like pineapple cake . i mean you get the sweet pineapple and a really bready smell underneath . probably my favorite smell in a beer ever , different than the norm for an apa . definitely does n't live up to the smell but i enjoy it . the carbonation level is good and there is n't really a harsh aftertaste . there certainly is n't anything off-putting , and i would recommend it to anyone , at least for the sake of smelling it .  super creamy mouthfeel w/o any overcarbed bite .
really great smell on it . can definitely smell the hops coming out . lots of earthy , dirty , grittiness to it .  mouthfeel is medium-thick but amazingly silky . carbonation is moderate .
smell - a really nice roasted malt and bready smell .  m- mouthfeel on this is incredible . medium to full bodied , chewy and creamy , moist , and not a hint of alcoholic bite .
aroma is absolutely perfect . sweet maple and brown sugar mouth-watering goodness with fresh cannabanoid hop perfume .  m/d : a full body that is creamy and velvety smooth .
smell is hops - straight , beautiful hop smell . seriously , smells awesome . okay , taste is lagging behind a ways .  m= perfect dryness and crispness .

the aroma is particularly good on this stout ; there is a lot of fresh blueberry aroma , along with nutty , chocolaty , and yeasty aromas to compliment . the beer pours with a very deep black color and a head that stays around the rim of the glass leaving a swirl on top of the beer . from the smell i expected this to be very fruity , which in it 's own right it is , however not in an alcipop sort of way . flavors that hit the tongue right off the bat are a little overwhelming but very nice to pick through .  m : full-bodied and lightly carbonated with a soft and creamy texture . alcohol noticable in a nice warming effect .

a- pours nice brick red/ very light amber color with 2 fingers worth of off-white head s- mixture pine and citrus hops and small bready malt and some alcohol makes it selft present t- getting a sticky resiny pine limited amounts of the bready malt alcohol and nice slight bitter finish m- medium body , carbonation is low , alcohol hangs around a little in the finsih o- this beer has some hype and for me it doesnt live up to it . that being said , i like my ipa 's more towards the citrus side , and this is piney .  m - creamy and rich . the carbonation is very laidback ... almost feels as if it floats on the tongue . very soft ... puffy , in a way .
the smell is nice and wheaty . definitely smell the 12 percent .  m - amazing . low to moderate carbonation ( expected ) and full bodied .

aroma is smack you in the face hop blast appropriate for a pnw ipa . taking dry-hopping to its logical extreme with several whole hop cones in each bottle .  a very smooth , luxurious malt backbone enhances the mouthfeel , but a bitter smack of hops reminds me that i 'm drinking an ipa . quite enjoyable .

a - translucent , super vibrant golden straw color that could illuminate a room . finger eggshell ( always wanted to work that color into a review ! ) head with a nice bubbly ring and a thin white film of bubbles remains on the surface .  feels wonderful on the tongue , perfect for a summer or spring day .

smell : they put some hops in this , a lot of them . pine , key lime , hop leaf , loads of bitter hop oil , hope there 's a base to catch me ... taste : surprisingly earthy , the hop leaf / european hop profile , was expecting a little more west coast . overall : a very flavorful texas beer , just a little more english than american in taste , like a english double ipa .  loved the residual stickiness . d- it 's remarkable how fff can make such big beers and hide the alcohol so well .

aroma is predominately belgian funk and gambrinus honey malt . flavor is pilsen , honey , and belgian aromatic malt with just enough hop to balance . yeast flavor is a very nice blend of straight belgian and brett .  m : as expected it has a wonderful feel to it that only a belgian can give . thick and creamy with a medium weight that gives way to an extremely crisp finish .

`` hello , my name is coriander and pepper '' says the aroma in a pleasing fashion . a bit heavier and sweeter than i would like hurts its drinkability , but the great aroma and pleasant flavor make this a very nice beer .  medium bodied , excellent mouthfeel .

overall very nice . taste : a little sour up front , but quickly fades to a lingering `` bitterness '' - not of the hop variety .  mouthfeel is where this beer really shines , and makes one understand why some folks are such lager fans . the balance in this beer is amazing , with everything seemingly in the right preportion .

amazingly complex aroma of hand-made chocolates . very mild and easy drinking . definately nothing double powered on the flavor . surprisingly clean . very light body . very drinkable .  m- great mouthfeel .

s - beautiful wet hopped aroma with a citrusy and piney profile that is extremely fresh . there 's also a bit of bread and caramel malt present .  starts with roasted coffee flavor , mouthfeel is incredible smooth .

a - dark brown on the edges black in the center body with a small white head that quickly ran away s - sweet citrus hop flavor with a big malty aroma t - big citrusy hop flavor with a huge sweet malty backbone .  m- very , very thick and chewy . also quite heavy .

huge pepper aroma and a very pronounced and balanced flavor . thanks to the lovely folks at elysian fields today , very gracious hosts .  the mouthfeel is outstanding . substantial , but not quite so thick as to confuse it with a stout .

mmmmm , toasty , husky pale malt and plenty of spicy , floral saaz hops . a slick finish rounds out a flavor that , i have to be honest , was a bit of a let down after the tremendous nose . still tasy though ; i guess i just had some unreasonable expectations .  mouth feel is incredible with some good champagne bubbling going on .

super sweet citrus tingle with a fresh evergreen aroma . a fitting caramel malt finds its way in the nose as well . wonderful exotic hop scents all the way through with this one . scary good drinkability for the style .  mouthfeel very full and smooth .

smell is great - lots of mild coffee and dark malts , burnt bread and sweet caramel .  extremely smooth tasting beer . bodied is so full its nearly chewable . mouthfeel is full and round . finish is clean and very smooth .

odor : rich citric aroma , tangerine , slightly lemony , floral backbone , some red fruit in there as well , pleasant and mellow . consistency : big carbonation , too much for my taste at least , it is straddling the line between gentle and tingly , no doubt that it gets in the way of the flavor a bit .  m- extremely smooth with the right amount of carbonation d- this one goes down too easily .
big aroma full of treacle , vanilla , oak , and hints of raisins and bourbon . an acquired taste , but very good .  matches perfectly with the thickness of the body .
great theatre watching the tall head overtaken by the liquid and the color is near black and near opaque .  super easy going down with a perfect dry finish .

insanely tart notes of lemon zest , white grape rinds , and dry oak barrels . so incredibly tart ; for me , the only comparable wild ale is batch 2 beatification ( in terms of sheer sourness ) . fantastic beer .  in the mouth , the tiny bubbles announce and incredibly smooth and balanced beer , with a roasted , slightly sweet flavor .

s-what comes through first is a perfect balance of sweet caramel malt and a blast of citrus hops . d- this brew is pretty awesome . brews that emphasize the citrus/spicy hop combo are hard to come by and this one does an excellent job with it .  great palate , though . even when it gets warm , great warmth and sliky smooth syrups .

this brew pours a small head of dark brown colored bubbles and an opaque black brown colored body .  the carbonation is spot on and helps bring the subtle notes of roast to the front . this also makes this beer one of the best feeling brews i 've ever had .

from notes a - good dark black body with a medium brown head s - delicious sweet chocolaty bourbon t - dry smoky bourbon and vanilla . o ( d ) - tasty , great smelling . a 6 oz bottle split 4 ways can make it difficult to judge . but very enjoyable  the first thing i noticed actually was the incredible mouthfeel .
perfect fruit scent . clean , pleasant , and wonderful . almost erotic , even - i want this beer to have my abortion .  m - thick , very smooth and very viscous with little carbonation .

the smell is amazing , dense spectrum of aromas floating out of my glass .  perhaps there is similar inconsistency here , and i will be wowed by the bottles i brought home sometime in the future ... mouthfeel is by far the best characteristic , supple , creamy and light .

the dry-hopping gives it a fantastic smell , citrusy and piney .  big , viscous mouthfeel does great things for this beer , transmitting a pretty large package ( 10 % , significant ibu count ) into an easy-to-sip package .
s- banana aromas dominate with subuded peppery yeast notes .  the mouthfeel is light , with excellent particulates that roam the mouth . a most excellent brew that i would n't hesitate to try again .

appearance : wow . gahhh . it settles in the glass with a creamy brownish white head that persists for ages and carbonation swirling around in the most beautiful pattern , as if this beer was alive . once that settles , a deep , dark brown colour takes over that is almost opaque , save for around the sides . head is small but very creamy and stays around forever . mouthfeel : kinda bad ... this beer puts so much effort into looking beautiful that it loses all of its carbonation .  bordering on chewy as you work toward swallowing . carbonation was excellent on tap , just enough to contribute to a dry and clean finish despite the initial sweetness of the beer .
