poured into a 20oz pint glass has a hazy , cloudy straw colored body with a thick , just-off white head that leaves beautiful lacing .  mouthfeel is full but not too heavy .

the nose of this beer is simply amazing . pure fresh cherries , almost like a top notch but soft lambic . some light caramel and hops could be smelled as well , but mostly fresh fresh soft cherries . light caramel tone , but just very clean and malty . the bottle is a little disapointing to be honest , but on tap this beer is simply amazing . fresh cherries and soft clean crisp malt .  m : rich and creamy . very chewy and thick . little carbonation .
the smell is strong pundget and fruity , sweet and tangy . overall , pretty good .  perfect carbonation to it .

s : smells really good . lots of bourbon , vanilla , oak right away , giving a huge barrel presence . the barleywine aromas of caramel , toffee , brown sugar , and dark fruits are evident and impressive as well . o : a really nice nose but the flavor was disappointing .  m - huge , thick , syrupy , creamy , perfect carbonation .

'' -- review from the growler ... .dark brown color with a small tan head ... .awesome aroma of fresh picked and mashed blueberries along with a sweet chocolate aroma ... the nose it top notch ... body is a bit light ... not horribly so but i wish it had a bit more meat to it ... taste is a bit acidic from the blueberries..the cocoa complements nicely but is definitely secondary ... .  perfectly constructed mouthfeel for a schwarzbier .

medium-light yellow with a nice ring of head that leaves pretty decent amount of lacing .  the mouthfeel on this ale was great , and i think the mouthfeel of just about any beer is enhanced by cask conditioning . it had a nice thick feel on the tongue .

i 'm a huge fan of strong , hoppy pilsners , and this is just great . tons of fresh grassy floral hops , a touch of pale malt . definitely enjoyable , regardless .  palate duration is excellent . medium body .

this smell is really on the money and superbly enjoyable . tasted honey sweet with dark malts and dark fruits that fades into a smoky birch bark and a really dirty lime or rhubarb sourness .  mouthfeel is rich and creamy .

nose has a surprising sweetness with tropical fruit esters of subtle pineapple and mango : both were of the dried and sweetened kind of fruit rather than fresh . citrus , earthy , grassy hops balanced with biscuit sweet and bitter malts .  m- great mouth feel . very smooth and not over-carbonated .

s : creme brulee ? the nose on this beer is amazing . loads of vanilla , caramel , cream , butterscotch and a tad bit of roasted malt .  t- the taste is starts out very smooth and creamy from the mouthfeel with some of roasted malts quickly followed by a nice bitter finish . m- the mouthfeel is silky smooth from the oatmeal with a moderate amount of carbonation . d- very good stuff , and not too boozy for a 9 % beer even though you can feel the warmth .

the smell is amazing . coffee dominates , and while i 'm not a coffee drinker , i like the smell of it .  mild-medium carbonation just enough to excite the palate . to me , this is almost the perfect mouthfeel .

strikingly effervescent . s : even before i hold glass to my nose , i can smell whiffs of lactic sourness . yes , lactic acid is sharp . some vinegar , red wine vinaigrette , flowers , and a suggestion of brettanomyces . additional aromas includes oak/barrel and citric acid . i keep picking up a very light buttery note .  the feel is big and thick .

smells awesome . if this tastes anywhere near as good as it smells , i will be happy . the smells are simply fantastic - if i have another bottle , i may just let it sit and inhale the fumes rather than actually drinking it .  smooth , airy , luscious , divine mouthfeel . tremendous ! a wonderful bsda .

the aroma - mango , pineapple , & exotic flowers - is delightful . smells like hawaii in a bottle ! not as grapefruity as i usually like , but i did n't mind the lack at all ; a very pleasant surprise .  mouthfeel is just perfect . the way this thing finishes it has a slight peppery aspect but it is dry and clean .
smells great ! ! !  mouthfeel is heavy and smooth with a small amount of carbonation , very nice .

s - the first thing that hits you is a bourbon alcohol smell , which is quite potent . the aromas are incredibly complex , i 've never smelt anything like it . it is incredibly sweet , it makes your teeth ache just at the thought of it ; maybe this will lessen with cellaring .  mouthfeel is probably the best part of this beer .

nose was wood the wonderful blending of currant . an herbal note of something meaty in the nose . funk like that of brie cheese skin and a bloody fruit . there was some mineral wood interaction with the fruit that gives it a food palatable quality , but it was quite subtle . overall i would only have this if you 're eating some sort of exquisitely cooked fish .  mouthfeel : thick and smooth in every sense of the words -- a very pleasant experience indeed !
smell : very sweet . some booze cuts through the richness . incredibly decadent . taste : one of those beers where you say `` wow , '' after the first sip .  mouthfeel is so big thick and creamy .
very enjoyable . taste is a little harsh , the sweetness takes a vegetable turn .  beautiful .
the pour was impressive as a dark chocolate filled my beer mug , the smell was pretty good with those hints of chocolate coming to bear .  m- awesome thick mouthfeel on this seasonal .
a nice , interesting nose .  the body is just fantastic : full , creamy and smooth .
aroma : smells really good . nice malty aroma of coffee and a hint of chocolate .  mouthfeel is perfect . not too thick and good carbonation .

on tap at strange brew in manchester , nh 2/2/11 a : light yellow , almost hay colored , hazy . 1 1/2 inch fluffy white head , leaves tons of lacing , almost completely covering the glass .  full bodied and silky .
just excellent .  very full body that stretches the cheeks . just such chewy hops .

appearance- fairly standard for an imperial stout . smell- huge malts bombard the nose with notes of chocolate and coffee . the spiciness was really surprising here .  m : the carbonation on this one is perfect . perfect mouthfeel .

s : this smells amazing . raspberry and strawberry jam with bread and peanut butter . unbelievable , the aroma could n't be better . impressive . m : lower medium body with upper moderate carbonation . overall : the flavor is good , but the aroma is unreal . i could n't take my nose out of the glass .  m : very viscous and full . smooth carbonation and a nice stickyness make the mouthfeel very complimenting to the taste .
smell is exceptional , with a peach and plum smell up front with a bit of malt and hops to follow .  m : very soft , finely carbonated medium body .

a-black as hell , 2 1/2 '' incredible light brown cappucino froth head . this beer looks fantastic . s-roasted malt aroma is so subtle it 's barely there .  mouthfeel is perfect -- light but not watery , highly carbonated ... perfect for the style .

it 's a good inviting smell .  the first thing one notices , upon pouring , is the consistency : this beer appears thicker than most , and may or may not have legs , likely a contributing factor to this beers exceptional mouthfeel .

very enjoyable beer . highly quaffable and deliciously decadent .  smells like a smoke beer ... .i get a little chocolate in the nose ... but the roasted smell is overpowering ... taste is sweet on the front end ... and an overall smooth taste ... .with a little bitterness on the back end ... very nice feel ... .creamy and smooth perfect for the style ... .velvet like smoothness ... drinkability is not bad ... although it is a stout and it weighs you down ...
it is very nice however .  solid mouthfeel , smooth and dense with animated carbonation .

22-oz bottle opened at local beer tasting ( underground bluz ) . a beautiful brew . this beer can do some damage because you wo n't want to stop drinking it !  the alcohol is kept well in check allowing the finish to cascade over the palate with a ton of character and wonderful texture . strong , long finish .
it has the aroma of a warm christmas cider . i recommend trying it , because it 's pleasant and unique , but try to get a single bottle or pint .  the mouthfeel is a true hallmark of this beer .

pleasant overall unlike some other fruit beers .  initially the softness of the carbonation and the sweetness of the fruity flavors makes it like a sweet soda ( can anyone remember tahitian treat ? again with the yeast character and the near rancid presence ( the brett i presume ) , yet the overall soft flavors and soft feel are greatly appealing and enjoyable . the light , fine and bubbly carbonation brings an element of childhood fun to the drink ( how about fizzies , anyone remember that ) as it brings a tickle to the nose and tongue . light overall feel and great softness . soft and light and tasty ( again in a soda pop manner ) .

great aroma , flavor and bitterness .  a big sturdy body on this one ... no doubt held up by some quality malts used , gives way to a sublime smooth and velvety mouthfeel that has a slight crispness in the end . about perfect in every sense .

smell was outstanding . malts , and dried fruits , raisins , prunes , etc , very complex and really builds the base for the beer . very , very nice . no bitterness to speak of and a lingering toffee sweetness at the end . overall an excellent doppelbock , right up there in my top 3 .  perfect ris mouthfeel .

i just about busted a nut getting the # $ # cork off in one piece..ahh make that several pieces that did n't fall back into the bottle ... but after a long and arduos process the cork was successfully removed.. poured a dark brown ... relatively clear..absolutely no head ... mouthfeel is very uncarbonated..i love the nose ... molasses ... .brown sugar ... .dark fruits ( plums , dates , even burgandy cherries ) ..a bit of oak ... just an awesome smelling beer.. the flavors are similar to the nose but much more tame ... .dark fruits ... molasses ... oak ... good taste to this ... my biggest complaint is the loose mothfeel ... very uncabonated which gives it almost a watery texture ... seems almost thin ... overall , the nose is great and the taste is very good but the body leaves something to be desired..definitely worth trying ... i wo n't be buying any more though ... .  m - perfect . exactly how a dipa should be .

it feels odd to categorize such a beer as a stout . the aroma is very tame first tiem around , as it warms it become beautiful and fragrant with mocha , coffee , coconut , and lactose together .  solid body , creamy mouthfeel .

s - the nose is vibrant and bursting with citrus hops . a little bit of malt and grass , but this is mostly all hops . rather than getting the fresh , juicy hops of the nose , they are overshadowed by a bitterness that just seems out of place . lots of potential here , especially in the nose , but unfortunately it just has a bit too much bitterness .  mouthfeel : the mouthfeel is outstanding . it sparkles just enough to give the palate a good tickle , but not so much that it scrapes away all of its flavor .
s- malt . candied sweetness . chocolate with a touch of vanilla .  mouthfeel is very syrupy and very rich with a dense body .
medium intensity and a very smooth and mellow character .  so creamy and smooth it 's almost not a beer ...

s- great nose ! pine , citrus , grapefruit , orange , malt , lots of hops yum . start is week middle is weak end is great . m- medium body , nice carbonation , o- this beer has a killer nose , one of the best but its color and flavor are a bit off for me , i would enjoy this fresh as opposed to part of their gabf temporary distribution in denver . good beer , but not world class by any means .  sour , some cherries , but most of all very tart and bone dry ; element of french cheese in it ( brie ) , some cream ; m : lovely alcohol , nice tartness , very drinkable ; o : not too complex but but very good kriek , which i will buy whenever i see it .
very nice and clean aroma , even with the `` funk '' .  mouthfeel is heavy and smooth with a nice small bite of carbonation , wonderful .

smell : wow , mazing ! roasty , dark chocolate , very coffee forward , sweetness . taste : very good , nice and roasty . overall : very good beer , i would certainly want to have this again .  a great take on belgium ale ; apples , pears , lemons , apricot and orange flavors nustle their way thru a carbonated full bodied swig .

this beer smells so good ! sweet with almost a balsamic vinegar quality . great . tart , sour gets me in the back of the mouth .  the texture is rich and creamy and coasts your mouth in deliciousness .
smells heavy of cherries , very good smell . taste is just as heavy with the cherries .  perfect . d- a very unique pumpkin ale .

the aroma begins with alcohol , followed by raisins and prunes , browning apples , black cherries , belgian funk . the mouthfeel is spritzy and explosive on the tongue with a medium-dense body and long semi-dry finish . as a matter of fact , the entire finish is tobacco . somewhat oxidized , dank and musty .  mouthfeel was great , it was very rich and smooth with little carbonation but it fit the stout just right .

three floyds beers have a unique aroma . the hops come across , thick and flowery . ive heard they use amarillo and columbus hops for aroma . many brewers could learn from these folks . milk chocolate , coffee , a little toasted malt with just a mild flowery hop flavor on the finish . slick , smooth and rich mouth feel , very nice , very drinkable .  only lightly effervescent , making the mouthfeel of this beer fantastic . i could n't picture the mouthfeel of this beer being any better . the amazing mouthfeel coupled with the well developed and super tasty character of this beer make it an easy drinker .

the nose is very good and very belgiany . you get the nice coriander and clove smells , the nice sweet malts , the candied sugars , and some yeasty florals too .  the mouthfeel is perfect for the style ; adequately carbonated and finished silky and creamy .

s- wow , loads of scents starting with a spiced apple and spiced pear followed by great light sweet malt scents and of course the belgian bready yeast ... this reminded me of my trips i used to take to julian with my parents and brothers as a child , we would always go up there for some fresh apple pie and hot cider ... t- not as much as the smell , but still great . you pick up on the apple/pear , spices , light sweet malt and loads of bready yeast with a nice crisp finish .  mouthfeel is great . just the right level of thickness here .

s - best feature . aroma of bananas , clove and bubble gum t - caramelized sugar , sour mash , banana m - a bit sour as you drink through the bottle , like an underripe banana , cloying sweetness d - becomes monotonous the more you drink of it .  very full in the mouth , coating , oily bitterness lingering and alcohol warmth continues to expand over my palate , throat , stomach as i enjoy this beer .
one of the best smelling beers i 've tried .  mouthfeel is medium bodied , very smooth and creamy . overall this is pretty damn good .
a toasted head has great retention and lace .  unbelievably smooth . feel is so outstanding for a heavy dark lager .

s - full of fruity aromas : grapefruit , cantaloupe , and oranges . some sweet foral scents as well .  taste- for a double ipa , this beer is not on a mission to wreck the palate ... with so much flavor i 'm surprised that the malts weigh in so heavily . solid . it 's sudsy ( the name of my beloved late parakeet ) and sublime . drinkability- one real attribute about this bruiser of a beer is that the abv ( 10 % ) is completely hidden ... it 's nowhere in any of the above categories . this is more like a nectar , thick and juicy , garnering respect for each sip .
the beer looks good : great looking head with great retention and small carbonation bubbles floating to the top .  the mouthfeel is great , nice and thick and perfectly carbonated .

first off is 2008 alaskan barley wine . no real visible carbonation because the beer is so cloudy . s - the nose is the best feature of this beer . there are lots of sweet dark fruits much like a dropple bock . could be more complex . t - here this beer takes a turn for the worse .  mouthfeel is lucious : creamy and oily , rich in the mouth , but smooth enough to want more and more .

well , not quite , but it is a very nice , very complex blend of sweet malts and almost floral scents . it 's a very subdued sweetness , heavy for a lager but no where near as complex as its smell would lead to expect .  the moutfeel is exceptional - full bodied and thick with appropriate carbonation .

intense hop nose , complex , very piney , leafy with a strong minty/evergreen aromas with a sight sweet malt note . the hops were overpowering hard to smell anything else . would have expected more maltiness with the dark color , really got fooled there .  the carbonation is fantastic -- beer feels creamy and smooth- almost velvety .

a - no pop when i pull the cork , pours a lifeless , soul sucking , pitch black , with a big oily slick on top , no head s - big nose of chocolate , coffee , vanilla , carmel sweetness , booze , smells pretty damn good t - taste is nowhere near as robust as the aroma , huge coffee flavour , basic sweetness , booze , gigantic roasted coffee finish m - no carbonation , heavy mouthfeel , dry finish , big boozy warmth d - another half assed effort from mikkeller no carbonation , ridiculous , over the top coffee flavour , and massive booziness ( even after cellaring for close to 2 years , best before is aug 2011 ) .  mouthfeel : a smooth sugary viscous mouthfeel that is balanced nicely by the carbonation .

smell : sweet citrus hops that smell incredibly fresh . the sweet malt balances things out well , but still lets the hops shine . overall : this beer smells awesome and the taste is a bit of a letdown . that being said , it was still quite good and i would have another .  exceptional mouthfeel and drinkability .

the flavor is not quite as complex as the nose would suggest but it is still quite good . it starts out with some dry oakiness followed by dusty cocoa .  m : a great , great medium body , that grazes you at the tail with sharp carbonation .

s : wow , tons of hops in the nose . a slight sweetness is detectable underneath it , but almost all hops , and in a big way . t : again , up front i 'm getting lots and lots of hop bitterness , with just a tiny bit of sweetness on the end of it . as it warms , i can get more malt and some caramel , too .  m-grand canyon deep and gordian knot complex . amazingly tantalizing on the palate . while it looks still in the glass it bursts with palate stimulating carbonation with each sip . like an amusement park in your mouth ! this is a highly enjoyable and palate stimulating sipper . a mighty fine drinking brew .

aroma is quite nice , very bready and doughy fresh , fresh yet browned banana , deeply soggy , kinda mushy , with a super nice splice of sweet dry nuttyness and butter . incredible aroma , but stops there and goes downhill quickly as it does n't quite have the taste and body to back it up .  like other fine belgian beers the carbonation produces a surreal creamy consistency that serves to deliver maximum taste .

s : wow , this beer smells amazing . whiskey and bourbon dominate the nose . i could literally sit here and smell this beer for the 15 minutes and be perfectly happy .  really coats the mouth for an excellent mouthfeel .
sure smells like the season . the taste does not live up to the wonderful nose . too bad .  mouthfeel is very delicious with some creamy notes but some nice crisps and sharp grassy hop notes .

poured a nice golden color with a dense rocky head pronounced piney and citrusy aroma , along with an earthy spice to it . huge hop bouquet . this beer seemed a little thin and light bodied for an ipa .  the feeling in your mouth , however is gorgeous ! smooth , silky , incredible.. so incredibly good that i actually said 'incredible ' in a french accent because it deserved such smoothness ... i 'm not going to lie , as for drinkability.. i 'm not as into this as anchor 's or even sierra nevada 's , christmas offerings this year , but it is still very drinkable to this lass .

the nose is fantastic , being all floral spicy hop . the flavour is terrific too , delivering a spicy , sappy , resiny , sticky malt and hop elixir .  body is medium-full for style , and this is just about perfect on the way down .

smell : wow ... i was n't expecting this at all . incredibly hoppy , honey , almost strawberry jam sticky hop smell . taste : i found it a little too watery at first , which was a dissapointment . another intriguing brew with an awful label from ray mcneil .  mouthfeel is just perfect - thick , rich , and creamy , with a slightly oily sheen that coats the mouth and throat .
a nice hoppy aroma .  very palatable and no alcohol taste at all m - silky smooth , great carbonation .
s : the best smelling coffee oatmeal stout i 've smelled to date .  it 's thick , creamy , rich , and robust .
smells amazing . the pine and citra form a wave of hoppy goodness .  the mouthfeel is great on this one too , effervescent and full at the same time .
s : very fruity , dark fruits ( raisins , plumbs ) and malts . t : very fruity , specifically raisins .  mouth is rich and sticky yet wonderfully smooth .

appearance is nice , dark but that red cherry goodness shines . smell is the winner here with loads of cherries and chocolate . taste is good , and hits big with cherries , a little dark smoke and chocolate .  this brew is a tremendously creamy medium-body with a tantalizing , light bite about the tongue what can i say !
s - mango , pineapple , yeast , apple , pear all present . yup , this is citra . o/d - aroma was lovely but the booze is a little rough .  m - perfect for a porter .

could not do it , this was too much of a stout for me , just not ym style , i try and try to drink these stouts to be a good advocate , but for me this was not very drinkable . that being said i can see how a stout fan would love this beer , just not for me , not really sure how to review beer that is not to my liking , i am sure some people would love it .  mouthfeel is super creamy and silky smooth .

very interesting . concrete and ginger . refreshing and smooth but a bit more bland than i expected based on the wonderful aroma . nicely mellow and subtle .  ( not a huge coffee stout fan ) ( blasphemous i know ) the greatest thing about this beer is the smooth creamy texture that is present while drinking .

aroma is a big mix of roasted grain , alcohol , malt sweetness , slightly burnt toast , coffee , chocolate , raisin , and cigar tobacco . unfortunately this did n't taste as good as it smelled . my expectations were raised by the aroma and then i felt a little left down as i did n't get the same complexity on my tongue .  while there was no head , the carbonation is just right ; the body is no thinner or heavier than it should be .
a truly profound smell . has all the plums and figs of a dickens novel .  perfect . d- a remarkably smooth beer , although a bit mild .

the beer is wonderful to look at and has a very nice robust and scotch like in complexity nose . the taste is what killed this one for me and the fact that it has almost no carbonation.did i get a bad beer ?  m- the mouthfeel is full bodied with a perfect amount of carbonation .

rings of lacing were left on the glass as the chugging commenced - nice ! the aroma was of a fruit forward chardonnay . citrus and floral scents were immediately detectable , along with a sweeter malt characteristic and alcohol .  mouthfeel is exceptional ! this beer is smooth , silky , creamy .

smell takes a little while to come out but once it starts to warm and the head retention leaves it 's very pleasant . initial blast of earthy hops matched with an almost smokey characteristic and roasted malts w/ fennel seed .  mouthfeel was creamy and exceptional . i was surprised to be able to drink the whole thing since i am not a fan of coffee at all , but this was a pleasant change of pace for me .

s : fragrant yeast character , a lot of banana , sweet malt . t : light caramel hits at first and then melds into a lot of banana , with hints of molasses .  the mouthfeel of this beer might be its most remarkable consistency ; velvety , silken slickness .
the nose had a very fresh floral hop aroma .  m- creamy and full-bodied . what else would you expect from the style ?
the smell of this 2 year old beer is so rich and strong . it smells of sweet fruits and a little bit of alcohol .  mouthfeel is full bodied and smooth that feels pretty creamy on the tongue .

s- smell is awesome . tons of tropical fruits pineapple , apricot , and grapefruit a bit of sweetness coming through from the malts . t- follows the nose really well . a very nice hop forward beer .  m - perfect carbonation . awesome smoothness . dry .

medium amount of carbonation s : i really enjoyed the burnt caramel smell that comes from the roasted malts . there is some maltiness , smokiness , and some slight sweetness in the aroma .  mouthfeel is astonishingly smooth and creamy for such a rich , complex ale .

the second surly can i got from my man joe aka ineedabeerhere . the aroma is quite hoppy , even with all this time in the can . pineapple , grape , carrots ? you can also smell a bit of alcohol in the furious , but only after sniffing the juice . the taste continues with the depth of the aroma , and i 'm loving it . it could use a bit more sweetness to accentuate the fruity hops .  the mouthfeel is oh so smooth and creamy , just perfect !

a - black as can be with what started as a monster tan head that has died down a bit but still lingers s - big roasted aroma 's mingle with notes of vanilla . this is just what i look for .  m : the mouthfeel is what really sold me on this beer .
d : this looked and smelled great , but the flavor just was n't that enjoyable , and the body was only ok .  t- pretty solid all around . very smooth , robust , and thick .

poured worthily into a duvel glass an orange amber with a thick white froth appearing and clinging nicely as a sip smelling of glorious flowery pine , dank indeed , bursts into bitter pine in the front of the mouth before cascading oily bubbles across just enough malt to save the day , without much abv burn , from what is otherwise a seriously bitter villain lacking a bit of nuance .  the mouthfeel is outstanding , substantial and even sticky .
the nose is amazingly sweet .  mouthfeel : perfection . the bead is neither too large nor too small .

( bottle into pint glass - sampled 4/5/10 ) picture perfect pour with a dark brown color and creamy off white head .  mouthfeel is a heavy but perfect . heavy with lots of lactose , light but fizzi carbonation .

really nice . t - red wine grapes , cherries and leather stand out to me , as does the vanilla and wood from the barrels .  this beer 's greatest attrubite is , in fact , its spectacualrly creamy mouthfeel .

big hop aroma -- a bit sugary , citric and piney . lots and lots going on just in the scent , and i can feel the back of my tongue tingling already .  the mouthfeel is , in a word , glorious . smooth on the tip of the tongue , then seeming to evaporate off your tongue leaving a crisp , somewhat spicy finish .
complex and strong aroma of wild flowers , banana , orange and coriander .  so very soft on the palette - really a unique mouthfeel , just velvety smooth .
it smelled wonderful . caramel notes and slightly fruity .  it is very creamy and very smooth . it 's like chocolate silk . very delicious .

s : great honey nose , the hops do n't get in the way , sweet herbal notes , some cinnamon . t : the honey notes are good , sweet malt with an earthy grassy hoppiness . nice flavour , but kind of obliterates the great honey taste .  what i really loved was the mouthfeel . very good for a lager style beer .
it smells great , a little like their nut brown ale , which along with the oatmeal stout are two of my favorite beers .  the mouthfeel is fucking perfect : it 's thick and creamy .

s. plenty going on here in this one . d. a very good porter from left hand . the combination of aromas is brilliant . the taste is lighter than its 5.8 % abv .  my favorite thing about this obviously the sweet rich malt character which adds to a very nice body for a beer of this alcohol content .

d : nice big i.p.a. , best smelling i have had yet , very flavorful and the malt has been kept in check and the hops can come right through .  the mouthfeel on this beer is great , so creamy with just enough bubbles that make it not to syrupy .
the aroma is sweet fruits and some spice including coriander , orange peel is present as well .  full effervescent body , huge amounts of carbonation . an unusual beer that 's quite good .

a : pours a muddy muddy thick black with a little ring of head that sticks around but i was not expecting a head anyways , its just dark and inviting black as night s : smells incredibly sweet , like a sweet port , huge huge nose on this , plums and rum raisins with hints of sweet and dark chocolate . i mean there is not real reason to get more specific it smells pretty much like exactly what is listed here , very luxurious . t/mf : the carbonation is a nice touch here and allows an extremely heavy and creamy body to impart the flavor all across the tongue .  mouthfeel : has a great mouthfeel . it has exceptional smoothness .

extremely fruit-fillled aromatics - pungent apple sauce notes lead the way into a more diverse array of stone-fruit esters . lush oaky notes with a touch of bergamot in the finish - complexity grows as the beer warms . i 'm still impressed that the base beer can be improved upon by soaking up the best characteristics of the barrels it is aged in , but these special editions of harvest ale have certainly `` matured '' more than simply `` aged .  this was the first belgian i ever had . it has a very creamy smoothness that i really love . finishes long and dry with more fruityness .

overall , this beer is very sweet smelling . t : medicinal hops , somewhat acidic and citrusy .  the feeling is very nice , sticky and big , but not viscous and syrupy . really nice in that aspect . the carbonation was lively and enjoyable , made this one easy to drink .
smells of loads of caramel , vanilla , sugar , lactose . basically like dessert . far too sweet .  the mouthfeel is full and warming , in fact , this beer is a huge belly warmer .

the aroma shows some nice complexity of aged bourbon , madeira , charred wood , vanilla & plum with some rich chocolate & caramel touched by just a hint of spicy , floral hops . very nice ! the flavor starts off with some grainy sweetness with a solid caramel character , but gives way to an edgy underlying bitterness that creates a fruity , off-dry , boozy/winey finish .  m - medium body and low carbonation , so incredibly smooth . perfect mouthfeel .

one of the best smelling dipa 's i 've tried . nice dry finish . o a great dipa . enjoyed this beer very much . this is a hop monster with a nice sweet malt complimenting everything .  super creamy mouthfeel , medium body and carbonation level .

poured into a new belgium snifter a - a beautiful clear dusk sunset color , 2 finger head that lingered and lacing through and through and awesome tiny bubbles for days s - pine , citrus , malt , floral , cotton , sweet , grains and maybe a bit toasty t - very nice bitter sweet , pine , orange , melon , pineapple , very hoppy and yet super bitter sweet malty m - coats the mouth a bit with some super bitter sweet lingering .  wonderfully smooth mouthfeel , but not much of anything else that would make this beer standout .

very appealing , sweet malty aroma with caramel and toffee notes .  but what might be the true feats here are , on the one hand , the quality and sock of the flavors given the abv , and the insanely creamy mouthfeel on the other .

a great aroma greets the nose , with soft cherry fruits and lots of toffee sweetness . a hint of floral & piny hops lingers in the background -- -very barleywine-line , which i enjoy . the flavor has the typical wee heavy malt profile boosted by a vinous barrel note . overall , a great special release from real ale , and probably one of their best beers i 've had to date .  t : the taste was about average for a stout , almost identical in flavor to guinness m : amazing mouthfeel , so creamy and so smooth .
smell was big on the roasted barley . very smoky and peaty .  mouthfeel : amazing . creamy and smooth , thick .

i do n't know if the age helped , but this smells fantastic ... deep milk chocolate ... . nice bourbon and vanilla notes ... hints of brown sugar and cinnamon ... really a great nose . flavor loses anything from the nose ... a bit of dark cherry essence rounds out the ris flavors ... fudgy toward the finish.. oak seems a bit musky/tannic.. medium body with good carbonation .  m : wow ! just so damn smooth .

viscous notes , along with minimal head retention & lacing s : orchard fruit , grainyness , & pineapple t : peaches , pineapple , honey , boozey grain & a kiss of estery yeast & mushroom like funk .  rich roasty chocalaty with a fabulous creamy mouthfeel . mouth again is just amazing . another great brew by troegs .

t : hugely ( and distractingly ) sweet . almost medicinal o : a very complex sipper of a beer that i found overly sweet . enjoyed the non-ba version much better .  bitter black chocolate moves into the woodiness and finishes boozy m- creamy , full-bodied , coats the mouth and boozy heat d- really impressed with this one .

a : reddish amber color , clear , no head retention or lacing s : although you get the belgian yeast banana and spicy notes , in the background you can notice the subtle blueberry aroma of real blueberries , not some extract .  mouthfeel is exceptional . very smooth , great carbonation , but not enough to distract from the flavors going on .

this is probably one of the best or at least better wits i 've come across that could rival hoegaarden , but it looks awful ! such a shame coz this smells and tastes just like a wit should .  the mouthfeel , though , was the best part . it fills your mouth with mousse like consistency with very round edges .

smells very sweet , what you 'd expect . perfect for dessert or a nightcap .  complexity is not disturbed by the great thick airy body . thick enough that the high carbonation appears just smooth and creamy . it feels like theyve brewed it with oatmeal .
powerful , fresh hop scent , like being buried in bales of green leafy cones .  great mouthfeel and is smooth on the palate with a hoppy bitterness that lasts forever .

s : smells phenomenal ! booze , oak , and sweet sugars upfront . breadiness on the backend . t : good . not great . has a nice boozy / oakiness to it , not a whole lot else .  wonderful full mouthfeel .

s : smell of yeast and coriander that gives way to banana . t : taste not as complex as the smell , but still pleasing .  the feel is awesome . maybe it is the milk sugar , but something gives it an icy , silky feel that is wonderful . overall good , a beer that i would have one of on occasion .

the aroma was simply fantastic . sweet candy sugar , cherries , white pepper , and leather were present in the smell is quite abundant quantities . citric sourness tang remained however , making it hard to really dislike .  it seemed to just coat my whole mouth on its way down .

i am still basically against fruit in my beer . the smell is the expected apple smell . i have granny smith apples in my house year round so this was evocative of that .  has that totally coating feel like a warm thick cask draught , just almost oily in its feel and velvety ( aside from the alcohol ) . really like this about this beer .

a - black ... cool s - nutty and fresh with some fruits behind but not really much of a scent t - tastes like an oil mixed with dirt .  m : incredibly creamy leaving a nice coating around the mouth that tingles slightly .

the aroma is exceptional ! it has a beautiful array of floral hops which penetrate along with a solid malt scent . the aroma is awesome along with a really good hop and malt flavor .  very full and creamy mouth . damn tasty .

s : earthy tart wheat , lots of honey , sweet toffee , and a nice floral hop/heat combination . bit-o-honey candy comes to mind .  mouthfeel is truly wonderful , with a heavy , syrupy feel mixed in with a light tingle from some hidden carbonation and the alcohol itself .

the aroma is very fruity and hoppy : orange and maybe a hint of apple mixed together . ester 's given off from the yeast is quite detectable too . this is a very fragrant beer . helios tripplebock is crazy for being a german brew , as it is a total hop bomb .  very smooth and full bodied mouthfeel , with medium carbonation .

s- as only a good british beer can smell , luscious . very complex . t/m- ok , the taste lets down a bit after the luscious aroma . a good beer but disappointed that it is n't a great beer .  the mouthfeel as mentioned earlier , is very thick and creamy . very little carbonation .

remains hazy as it warns , unlike the 2010 . among the best sour aromas i 've had the pleasure of experiencing . t : fruits , oak , and brett share the spotlight . great blend of the three flavors . m : body is thin and weak , yet nicely oily . d : sessionable , even at $ 40/bottle .  first gulp of this was outstanding.. nice creamy , mouthfeel to it that just bombards your mouth with sweet , delicious beer flavor .

s : nice big belgian yeast nose . one of the best smelling beers i have ever encountered . t : starts off sweet with some raisins . the worst part of this beer and it was still way above average . d : very drinkable .  the mouthfeel was exquisite . tiny bubbles caress , going a little foamy , opening the flavor as it hits the back of your mouth .

appearance - slightly hazed yellow/straw . puts a good finger and a half of white foam on the glass . a nice ring of lace frosting at the high water mark .  mouthfeel- the texture of this beer in the mouth is stunning and absolutely *perfect* .
smelled really fresh . plenty of floral aroma and sweet citrus aroma present .  m : nice light body on it with mild carbonation , which was perfect for this style of ale .

smell is awesome -- the smoked pork hits you first , followed by hints of raw sugar , honey , apples or pears , and black licorice . first few sips have an element of 'burnt'-ness to them , but once you get used to it , it 's quite pleasant . there 's almost a saltiness to it , with some background flavours of coffee , chocolate , and strong malts .  this is one of the thickest beers i 've had . very heavy and smooth mouthfeel .

aroma - dark fruits with a caramel and sweet malts .  mouth is very crisp and finishes clean , excellent carbonation . leaves a nice tingling on the tongue . drink is very good i usually would n't want an ipa for a session beer but this one i definetly would have a few more for the evening .

the aroma is thoroughly enticing , presenting notes of buttered wheat , bubble gum , orange peel , banana creme , vanilla , and a touch of spicy , organic hops . all in all , a satisfyingly complex and tasty wheatwine from the talented terrapin brewers .  excellent balance and mouthfeel , could be a great session beer .

it is an aromatic potpourri of lighter hop notes . i like getting mint flavors and smells from a beer , it 's a sense that is under appreciated in craft brewing .  exactly how i like my stouts to feel -- heavy and chewy .

smells fucking amazing . this is the best-smelling beer i 've ever had . it smells like exotic , spiced , fresh-roasted coffee , like you 're standing in [ trendy east side coffee shop ] . really good , but not quite on the same transcendent level as the nose .  the mouthfeel is dry with a long and deep finish which is full of blackened malt and char . very very nice .
aroma was an incredible with scents of spicy dark bread .  ideal texture for an ipa .

perfectly balanced , wonderful , and refreshingly innovative . i 'm starting to think rogue bombers might be worth their exhorbitant price out here .  the way this tastes is absolutely nothing like the way it smells ... m - full , pleasing mouthfeel . the best part of this beer .
man this was incredible . citrusy herbal if i had to put some words on it .  the mouthfeel is silky smooth and really rounds the beer out nicely .

this is a powerfully aromatic ale it hits you the moment you open it . there is a strong candied fruit smell here . candy dates , pineapple , cherry , and a raw tobacco scent . about the most aromatic beer i have smelled in at least a year , maybe more . pliny the younger and three floyds dreadnaught are the only two on the same level of complexity . mouthfeel is good . drinkability is ok .  they served it properly too - the temperature was perfect ( not co cold ) . pretty close to perfect .

smell is full of strong c type hops . strong pine and grapefruit with some cinnamon in there . cedar wood and a little hay scent . faint pineapple smell .  the palate is delightfully smooth and creamy . overall , this is an outstanding dipa that is sure to fill anyones hop fix for the evening .

the smell of this brew is grassy with some minor inclusion of earth and peppery notes . a faint note of funky cheese blends with some vinous aspect of white grape skins . fairly decent across the board but on a day like this , it paled in comparison to some of the other geuze offerings sampled .  perfect creamy mouthfeel .
smell was amazing , coffee , toffee , bitter chocolate , sugar , fruit .  light carbonation , rich smooth mouthcoating sensation from the oatmeal .

s : the bouquet is quite vibrant , with grapefruit and pineapple jumping out of the glass .  mouthfeel was awesome . farily prickly carbonation with some slight drying on the finish due to the barrel aging .
the scent is sweet and hoppy . there is also a freshly milled pale malt scent that is very nice . i ca n't wait to drink this beer .  awesome mouthfeel .
i really like it .  great mouthfeel .
s- smells of dark caramel , roasted malt , charcoal , and a light smokiness . t- quite astringent .  m : one of the fullest and creamiest dipas i 've ever had .

a great smelling though ultimately dull witbier .  m-medium carbonation with a great creamy finish d-hmm i actually like this a lot ... .i 'm very confused by the other peoples ' reviews ... the taste is n't too complex but its otherwise a great drink .
smells great . taste . a decent iipa .  mouthfeel is superb . great level of spice , perfect carbonation , medium body .
s- it almost smells like a hoppier bock with plum and some chocolaty malt aromas .  a nice chewy , creamy malt backbone makes each sip a pleasure .

aroma is of banana , the spiciness of clove , and actually some pineapple . taste is not as good as the smell . it 's a bit earthy , and far less of a phenolic presence than most hefeweizens i 've had .  unbelievably smooth in mouthfeel - bittersweet chocolate and bitter roasted notes played effortlessly on your tongue .

there are references to ginger , spice , pumpkin and fresh wet hops . packaging says best before march 2012 . the beer is very cloudy and the color is along the lines of pumpkin pie .  first sip reveals a smooth silky textured beer with a fairly thick body and gentle rolling carbonation . there is a sticky sweet residue on my lips after each sip and the boozy warmth lingers as well . the booze factor makes this a sipper and it is a little sweet and boozy to drink a full bomber .

heavily hopped with three different american hop varieties , the hop aroma and flavor are citrus-like and pungent . very strong hop aroma - primarily cascade hops , so this e.s.b . 's aroma reminds me of a dry-hopped pale ale in the pacific northwest style . overall , a satisfying ale - not exactly true to its style , but very good nonetheless .  great mouthfeel .

& raspberry , great if weird scents going on here ... t : raspberry , plums , figs , & strawberry jam verging om pop tart filling , very weird , plus leafy hops up front .  mouthfeel was full and rich . this is a very good beer , and quite a unique one .
very good smell . t : roasted sweet caramel & malts .  the mouthfeel is perfect . it is full bodied with low carbonation , and oh so smooth .

: - ) s- nose is wonderful . if you 've had sam adams ' triple bock , it smells just like that .  m : thin to medium viscosity , simultaneously wet and creamy on the palate developing into a sublime smoothness , with moderate carbonation that keeps the texture from becoming heavy or lifeless .
the aroma was wonderful with a sweet hoppy smell .  mouthfeel is damn near perfect for an o'fest , i think . impeccable balance .

the aroma continues to provoke the senses with a luscious , mouthwatering perfume . its flavor had a tough time catching up to its exceptional aroma , but still came through with a graceful sequence of sweet malts modestly checked with a light hop scheme .  some of the best damn mouthfeel you will ever get in a beer too .

the aroma seems to transcend the dopplebock style with a delightful boozy elixier : notes of dark rum , brandy , sherry and the like . currants , produce , fresh grass , and a slight hint of citrusy hops provide a great balance to the smell . this is not a beer for the faint of palate . i 'm not exactly sure how i feel about samichlaus ... one one hand , it 's an exceptionally complex , well-crafted beer that probably deserves its own style .  the mouthfeel is velvety and thick .

22oz bomber into pint glass a nearly white head disappeared quickly , no lacing , hazy golden orange amber gives a nice appearance 3.5 s a really good apricot scent dominates its aroma you pour your glass 4.5 t apricot takes the lead on the flavor but there are sweet bread and grains now also .  feel : low carbonation , medium body that is extremely smooth for so low abv , very nice drying finish .
aroma is rich : sweet chocolate , vanilla , with strong whiskey notes . overall a decent beer , but somewhat a let down .  excellent in the mouth .

it was a pretty dark brown with a sweet hops and spices scent . it was n't very bitter at all .  body is n't the first thing you notice , but once the distraction of the sour wears off , you realize this brew is very smooth , neither tacky nor sticky , nor drying . carbonation can be swirled up , and compliments the feel of the sour in your cheeks quite well . all in all , a crazy departure from the normal dfh offerings and dang fine weissen .
really nice looking brew .  deliciously smooth . coating the entire mouth with a lasting finish .

smells great , like a sweet belgian with lots of yeast and fruit and candy . taste was unbelievably tart and dry , especially after it smelled so sweet and dubbel-ish . lots of smokey coffeey and mineral water .  m= smooth and crisp . feels resinous as well which is great for an ipa . d= super drinkable .

i was afraid since this beer emphasized bacon , that it would be like an overly smoked beer that gave a nitrate like amora , but this one is balanced nicely . road tar , malted barley , honey ham , rubber , and charred hickory . absolutely awesome . t- the taste is light and pleasant .  the finish lingers for a while , almost spicy with a slight alcohol burn m - pretty ideal for this style i thought .

big , bold aromatic amarillo hops billowing out . pour is gold , with no head , as it seems to have lost carbonation in transit , unfortunately . very drinkable and i can see this being fantastic properly carbonated . great ipa .  mouthfeel is smooth and creamy , with a lighter body , almost cask like .
the best part of this beer was the nice grassy hop aroma ( dry hopped with fuggles ) .  m- full bodied and creamy . very smooth and silky in the mouth . full bodied but not heavy .

below average head retention , but the aroma more than makes up for a lackluster appearance as it brims with bold espresso and sweet chocolate notes . one of the best-smelling coffee beers i 've had recently , and the malt backbone is nothing to scoff at , either . overall , brewhouse coffee stout is amazingly aromatic , but could use a few tweaks here and there with regards to the appearance and mouthfeel .  mouthfeel is amazing on this one .

overall the aroma is very nice . first sip , small tingly carbonation and average body . flavor is much less complex and rich than the nose advertised. , some toffee and fruit followed by a very clean yet somewhat empty finish .  mouthfeel is medium bodied and smooth . an excellent feel .

rich and sweet malt , dark alcohol-soaked fruits , brandied caramel , vanilla , and alcohol fill the nose . nice and rich with dark fruits filling the mouth , the alcohol is prominently placed . there is a dry , hop-derived bitter undertone .  silky , creamy , and perfectly textured , this mouthfeel ca n't be beat .

incredibly fresh hop aroma . absolutely unbelievable . must try these galaxy hops for my homebrew soon .  mouthfeel is incredibly smooth and creamy - almost reminded me of a nearly flat ginger ale , with more depth/body .
the smell is probably the best part of this beer . sweet and herbal with a touch of honey , hazelnut , citrus of some kind . the finish is very dry . pretty cool beer .  m - smooth as silk .

this beer smell awesome ! ! ! as i drink it , the problem is , what flavors match up with these aromas ? the beer has a great london/english fruity estery taste with christmas ale type flavors of nutmeg and cinimmon . i wish i had more than one of these to review beacuse its a really complex ale that i would like to clone . a very drinkable ale with a great nutty spicey fruity finish .  body is full but not heavy and has a great creamy smoothness . almost feels like an oatmeal stout .

black as the deepest parts of the ocean with some overcast fluffy 1 inch mocha colored head that fades at a good pace .  this is so creamy and not too carbonated , its just enough to get both senses of substantial and refreshing . quite thick , not so much as syrup but a few steps under . one please , fills the stomach nicely , not too harsh on the throat or stomach . it has a nice balance between warmth and coolness in the stomach .

just great . dark berries with a light mouthfeel . it lacks a bit more flavor that i like in stouts but it 's still really excellent with the smell being the best part .  this beer is on the lighter side of medium-bodied beers and boasts an exceptionally pleasant mouthfeel . carbonation is perfectly balanced , i could n't imagine any improvement here .

smells quite spicy , with cloves and cinnamon and orange peel coming through the hefty alcohol and sweet malt . excellent . a sip reveals a creamy , yeasty , sweet beer , very different from your normal eisbock .  body is full but not cloying . exceptional silky velvet mouthfeel that is full-bodied yet providing a smooth viscosity .
s : love this big roasted malt aroma coming off of this . very nutty and caramel .  m : creamy and delicious . everything is dead on here .

s : as soon as i popped this one , i loved the smell of it . i was hoping after the great smell , it would have a taste i loved , but unfortunately not a taste that suits me .  excellent for it 's style .

a-pours a cloudy orange ... i 'm docking points because pilsner 's should have good clarity ... also excessive head ... s-outstanding aroma ... spicy , floral and somewhat fruity ... very inviting and the type of beer you could sit and smell all day long . but i found it an exciting , and tasting brew ... .one of the best smelling beers i have ever experienced .  smooth grit with comfort .
s - oh my , one of the most delicious aromas i 've ever experienced . d - fantastic stout .  the mouthfeel was very very thick and creamy and not as thin as say a sierra nevada .

definitely a woodsy component going on , and i 'm thinking rosemary bark or dried thyme . not much funk , really , but the acid backbone is there making for a quite enjoyable drink on its own . phenomenal .  amazingly smooth going down ; full bodied with light carbonation .

poured into a chimay goblet . the aroma is potent and pleasant : there is a strong , sour yeast smell plus a significant evergreen , pineapple sharpness complimented by some bready tones and honey-like malts .  nice touch of bitterness lingers as i contemplate the rich , full mouth feel . nice beer , much more approachable than the expedition .
very visually appealing .  mouthfeel : on the heavy side of the medium-bodied scale and creamy smooth .
s - nice aroma . some sweet vanilla and oak notes are punctuated by earthy and herbal hop .  m- full , smooth mouthfeel .

on tap at kuhnhenn winter , solstice night two . a big nose of spices .  moutfeel : probably the best part of this beer is the mouthfeel . thick and sugary , with a ton of creaminess to start . a crisp , drying effect then takes over your throat and palate upon swallowing . then you are left with an alcohol bite that is both satisfying and warming .

the nose is pretty interesting in this one , with a complex aroma profile of orange citrus , funk , light clove and some honey .  s : smells like sweet malt , spices that i ca n't pick out , some red/dark fruits , vanilla t : tastes just like the smell with more vanilla and even bourbon but in a mellow way , like a fruity , sweet , light bourbon..some alcohol flavor too m : very full bodied , almost to the point of creamy d : highly drinkable for the flavor but less so for the alcohol kick

tons of citrus and tropical fruit . big orange , tangerine , and pineapple . light grapefruit and pine . the one complaint i have is that when served at 45 degrees , this was very boozy . once this warms , the booze really comes out which kind of overpowers every hops flavor rather than blend . too boozy , kills all drinkability for me .  very nice feel in the mouth -- rich , thick , tingling bubbles , kind of evaporates on the tongue . medium-heavy body , quite a bit of honey , i get this apple quality .

location cellar 70 serving 22oz the scent of this piva is spot on and really is inviting . i have n't had any other coffee stouts , so i am by far means an expert .  mouthfeel is full and rich , easy to sip and enjoy . sweetness hinders the drinkability a bit , one bottle at a time is enough for me .

the aroma is fantastic , sweet , sour , chocolate malt all blending to a wonderful bouquet . taste is a bit too spicy , but otherwise very pleasantly complex . mouthfeel is dry and acrid , not as smooth as some others .  mouthfeel is perfect - smooth and velvety without being clingy or cloying .

the smell was so pungent i could smell it a foot and a half away , which was great . this beer was a great pleasure both to see and smell . taste : immediate bitterness that is the mainstay throughout the beer . perhaps , the appearance and smell had me too excited , but i was somehat dissappointed in the taste .  thick and creamy . everything i look for in an imperial stout . light carbonation .

amazing smell ; right in line with what i expect from stone .  the mouthfeel was phenomenal . to have a cask conditioned beer is such a treat , and i 'm glad my neighborhood bar always has one beer on cask .

tons of chocolate malt , coffee , anise , plums , raisons a fruit blender of aromas . it really needed more hops to balance this bad boy out .  m : the feel is excellent with fine carbonation lending a creaminess that is top-tier and a clean scrubbing finish with the right balance of crispness and aftertaste . d : an fine tripel with classic light fruit flavors mixed artfully with pepper and spice and a top-notch mouthfeel compose a very good brew .
the nose was very rich and interesting , but the taste fell short .  very nice rich and creamy full body on this one , super smooth on the palate .

impressive looking ale..bright clear golden yellow , with a rich , thick , creamy head and literally walls of lacing .  m : very soft carbonation and easy on the palate as a good session beer should be .

this has one of the best aromas of an ipa that i 've ever had . sticky , piney , resiny aroma . i find this to be a very drinkable ipa .  m : so good i ca n't get enough . nice thickness with light carbonation and a good oily texture make this a delightful treat for my mouth .

the aroma is phenominal . funky , yeasty , wet wood , barn yard , and sour lemons and oranges .  in addition , there are hop oils , caramel , some sweetness and perhaps molasses along with a medium body that is oh so smooth and coats the mouth well . delicious and well balanced .

very strong perfume , somewhere between musky cologne and rose water they use in middle-eastern desserts . very dynamic and evolutive aroma , good stuff indeed ! taste : lively , robust carbonation - another shocker for me , considering 13 % abv and a swig-top bottle - but it pushed the fruit flavor really hard , a pleasant sour raspberry then mingled with a round , caramel toffee malt richness .  bear republic really , really nailed the mouthfeel on this one .
wonderful aroma . really brilliantly done . moderate in strength , but fascinating . t : wonderful apricot fruit esters perfectly complement the wheat foundation .  the feel is very silky .
dipas aroma 's are awesomely hard to describe .  i really this the mouthfeel is perfect on this beer .

poured ~4c into a perfect pint glass . nice white head that is laying there forever and leaves nice lacing .  really wonderful . the mouthfeel is the most impressive and outstanding attribute of this beer .
great aroma , sweet malt , banana , spice , wheat note . medium feel , too cloyingly sweet for me  mouthfeel : perfect mouthfeel .

the aroma , however , is a-one , outstanding , and really well captured in the wineglass : nice , fresh pumpkin accompanied by strong notes of cinnamon , nutmeg , clove , maybe some ginger ... wow , this is the smell i look for in my pumpkin ales - imo they nailed it . that said , i feel the flavor takes a step back ; maybe the nose raised expectations too high ... still very nice , with the pumpkin and spices pulling through , but perhaps not as robustly as the nose had led me to believe ; there 's also a not entirely pleasant though subtle bitterness to it , as well as a bit a boozy bite to the finish .  mouthfeel is thick with smooth and creamy carbonation .
smell - smells absolutely delicious ! ! lots of fruit/wheat and some toasty nuts ... yumm , 5 for sure .  smooth and creamy , very soft carbonation . booze is extremely well hidden .

the ale smelled of flowers , honey and orange peel . this would be an outstanding lawnmower beer .  medium bodied but carbonation is bright and exciting , reminiscent of deschutes ' black butte porter , very refreshing . ca n't say enough about how great the mouthfeel deschutes puts out on some of their beers , red chair fits that bill .

smell : the smell is excellent . the bourbon comes through in the form of vanilla and a touch of oakiness . it is exceptionally tasty and smells fantastic , but i am having a very hard time getting over the mouthfeel .  the mouthfeel is dead-on creamy .
s : very nice smell here with wood tones in the nose and some great hop/malt balance .  m : thick and rich , with a nice amount of fine , late-developing carbonation . perfect for such a big beer .

the overall aroma is pretty sweet smelling and i enjoy just the smell of it . did i mention this smells really good ? taste - scotch flavor with a malty flavor to it . overall - it 's a beer that smells better than it tastes .  it 's definitely thick , but it does n't feel anywhere near as syrupy as it looks . o : this beer has a great appearance and mouthfeel .
smell is great . coffee beans and some roasted aromas , a touch of chocolate .  m - medium bodied really smooth with perfect carbonation .
smell - the smell was an enchanting citrus odor between grapefruit and lemon meshed with faint aromatic pine hops and a hint of grain underneath .  extremely satisfying in this regard .
smell is excellent and unique . predominate smell i get is apricot .  full bodied , heavy on the palate and full of flavor . i love it .
awesome smell , couldnt wait to drink it !  mouthfeel is big full and smooth very rich and easy drinking with a really satisfing warming in the gut .
that 's a good thing in my book . overall a fantastic aipa .  this has been sitting in the cellar for about a year and i am convinced it has the absolute perfect mouthfeel .

this stuff smells great . a very unique sweet plummy/buttery smell . tastes good , too . does n't taste like 9 % at all .  m : the mouthfeel is delightful . fairly thick for an ipa , almost creamy with mild carbonation .
aroma : sublime ! super sweet , rich dark ripe fruits coupled with notes of chocolate . an all organic ale , not the best dubbel , but respectable .  perfect carbonation .

holy hops . i like me some hops . huge hops and not much else to smell ... maybe a touch of some orange peel or citrus something . i was blasted immediately with the hops from the first taste and on . overall i liked it ... i would n't complain if i drank it again .  ( m ) mouthfeel is perfect for this beer .
aroma is wonderful . incredibly intense malt tones and a nice sweetness detected .  mf - perfect ! soft carb .

s : nose is pleasantly funky , mild barnyard with notes of hay and grass .  just take a sip and get lost in the nearly overpowering flavor explosion and the creamy tingly mouthfeel of this wondrous scottish ale .

aroma of tart dried apricots , fresh apricots , canned apricots ... uhh , pretty much just apricots . quite a great smell actually , as i like apricots ( this is why i ordered an apricot ale ) . decent apricot ale , maybe a shade better than the apricot wheats i have tasted off the shelves , but not the game changer i was hoping for .  great mouth feel on this one . no hops or bitterness present at first , but bitter in the finish .

t - while the aroma is astounding , the taste does not do the aroma justice . it 's one of my top 5 ipa 's , i 'd say , but compared to the outstanding aroma , the taste is considerably less in amplitude .  mouthfeel is perfect , my ideal belgian .

a - typical brown color that comes with this type of beer ; little to no head retention s - wonderful aroma ; slight caramel and hops ; this is what a brown ale should smell like !  the mouthfeel is amazing , thick and solid with a lingering savory finish .

the smell is pleasing . tons of sweet banana and light belgian candied sugars . a nice belgian yeast is present in the smell , with nice sweet lemon scents . a nice beer overall , but not as clean as i would have liked to see .  silky silky smooth on the mouth , it makes it feel as light bodied but if you take the time to get a feel it 's almost medium . just fantastic . o- this is deffinitely a good saison , the mouthfeel is the highlight .

s- great smell like a realy fruity white wine , dark raspberries , some of the cereal grains come through , no hop aroma . it doesn ; t over power though .  feel is really nice as well , lightly creamy and buttery with super calming smoothness and a bit of chewyness with a slightly bread dough drying in the finish .
this was hard to decide on , the smell was really intriguing , but taste more mediocre .  finishes fruitty & spicy mf : huge & well balanced this was bit ponderous , but tasty .
big chocolate smell . sweet malts and molasses lend to a chocolate bar wrapper aroma .  m - the mouthfeel is fantastic . medium and a little creamy with just the right amount of carbonation .

wow , one of the best smelling old ales i 've ever smelled . as it warms up so many different smells come out , yet it stays balanced . i thought this beer smelled amazing and was very complex and balanced . while the taste was a step down and a tiny disappointment after the smell , it was still very good . i thought it also had an amazing mouthfeel and while definitely a sipper , the abv is well hidden .  m : light and refreshing with a perfect amount of carbonation .
roasty , some coffee and chocolate . decadent .  mouthfeel : fantastic . rich without being syrupy . carbonation is just right .

s : wonderful fruity belgian goodness . caramel malty dubbel is a smell warms me up even on a hot evening . allagash has some of the nicest smelling belgians that come to mind .  dark malts , some chocolate , medium to full bodied and very smooth from start to finish .
two fingers of thick billowing collapse into a thin cap that left sticky lacing on my glass .  mouthfeel is fine and not heavy .

smell is on the sweet side but hoppy as well , sweet bubblegum scent , weed , juicy citrus and a malt punch , great scent . taste is enjoyable , alot of different things balancing sweet and hoppy in that order with the above mentioned scents going into the taste without the weed .  mouthfeel was real good .

a beautiful looking beer with at least a two-finger head that lasts for a while before fading to a nice cap that remains to the end .  very rich flavor of dark malts and smoke , with hints of coffee and chocolate as well . the finish is almost all smoke , much too intense for my liking . ive used this many times in making caribou pot roasts in the crockpot . they even have a recipe on their website , which is delicious . i was informed that this beer has won more medals at the great american beer festival than any other beer , quite an accomplishment .
s : pumpkin pie baby ! very nice . t : pumpkin spice , clove , nutmeg and caramel from the malts .  m : smooth and medium bodied .

the appearance is amazing . it pours really really dark brown , safe to say black . it leaves a thick lacing around the glass that is very very intimidating .  it is bubbly on the tongue and does leave you dry . it 's smooth , but just kind of basic . it 's a very approachable stout .

s - nice ! grapefruit aroma with some hints of pine fill my nose . very attractive flowery hops , with some bready biscuity malt hidden along the way . nice co2 .  it is quite nice on the mouthfeel , almost enough to disguise the heavy-handed corn influence .

aroma : lovely , substantial fruit aroma without overpowering the malt of the beer .  mouthfeel was good and very drinkable ; however , it was slightly bitter ... something i was n't expecting this to have considering the malts .

the initial smell is awesome -- somewhat of a bubble gum and lemon mix . a strong taste of fruity malt/yeast and a very dry aftertaste , the strong feel of hops comes on towards the finish of this one .  the drink is carbonated a little more than average as well . mf- very crisp beer with little or no after taste . one of the smoother beers around .
s : raisins and dark fruits with a mild white wine aroma .  mouthfeel is fine . medium bodied with the right amount of carbonation .
really interesting .  mouthfeel is medium to full . there 's a nice level of carbonation .
appearance : pours a clear , brilliant amber body with a creamy ivory-colored head . gooey latticework of lacing .  mouthfeel : crisp and refreshing .

an isabelline crown persists and leaves luxurious cascades of sandy lacing - those bubbles that stick rest atop viscous legs suggesting snow dusted mountain peaks . aroma is highly potent - it hits you from the moment the seal is popped . brown sugar , high quality aged sherry , vanilla , coconut , dense brown bread , faint clove ... the list goes on . the flavor profile closely follows the aromatics , but everything is present in a lesser degree . lots of flavors come and go - abbreviated tastes of bread crusts , licorice , and dried tropical fruit . the finish is quite nutty and hints at leather as well . almost like an armagnac it is a beer well suited to contemplation . the oak notes contribute a great deal without becoming overwhelming ( brandy barrel angel 's share i 'm lookin ' at you ) . definitely worth seeking out and sticking in the cellar ...  it as a quite full mouthfeel similar to a very sweet red wine , almost syrupy . it gives a good warming feeling .

pours from 21 oz bottle to pint glass , a deep , dark , caramel-color with a straw colored two-finger head that seems to grow with time rather than dissipate . frothy lace definitely persists .  mouthfeel is nice , actually - light bodied , spritzy carbonation .

aroma is dark , malty , and seductive . roasty sweet malts , golden raisins , dried fruit , scorched caramel , and bittersweet dry cocoa are rounded out by musty yeast notes similar to damp concrete .  the mouthfeel is good ; slightly thick and very smooth . however , it is a little bubble and will sting the recesses of your mouth .

smell is dark fruit , roasted malts , vanilla , oak , and a touch of coffee/chocolate .  taste is a very light malt sweetness upfront with a moderately bitter finish of good length and crispness . a pretty uncomplicated beer , good for the style , a good lawnmower beer .

a solid five fingers tall , the head falls slowly , leaving behind a cragy , mountainous blanket over top of the glass with massive amounts of lacing . best looking head i 've ever seen .  body is on the full side of medium . moderate carbonation .

pretty hop-forward , but the taste does n't quite live up the incredible nose . the citrusy-pine aroma is somewhat over-powered by a faintly peppery and slightly acidic bite . not bad , but the nose really had me expecting something special .  highly carbonated .
very natural and fresh apple . not a big fan of the coriander .  mouthfeel : the bottle conditioning makes for a very smooth ride .
the aroma is a fascinating combination of sweetness , oatmeal , wheat , and roasted coffee grinds .  light and creamy mouth feel with obviously knocked down carbonation .
a dark orange color beer that is very cloudy with a long lasting bubbly head . quite a citrus filled aroma with some cinnamon mixed in and some ginger .  good carbonation .
pours clear , bright amber with a tenacious head ... got ta love those hop oils .  mouthfeel is very light and well carbonated .
nose offers delightful citrus - sharp grapefruit juice , apricot , and a pleasant wet lawn grassy component .  m - low carbonation , tiny bubbles , overall feels pretty good .
s : lots of bacterial funk , acid , and dark fruit , very fragrant and pungent .  mouthfeel is medium , clean with a bitter hop aftertaste .
smell was the only thing i enjoyed . rich espresso , chocolate undertones . nose was ok .  good , solid creamy feel with enough dryness to get you through .

a - deep cherry red with a pretty pink head that left a really nice lacing .  if there is , then this ska brew is a prime example ... this is the second time i tasted a bottle of this brew . this is an extremely clean tasting brew which is a great quality i enjoy , but where are the hops ? the malt and ( not overwhelming ) bitterness serve as great supporting backbones to what should be a wonderful hoppy aroma and flavor . as it stands , this brew is severely lacking in hop flavor/aroma and comes across as a brew which should be named `` delicate '' rather than `` decadent '' imperial ipa .

right after i removed the cap i got this instant burst of fruitiness on the nose . then when i began to pour it , the aroma segued into a toasted bready , creamy , yeasty , and neutral hopped balance . i was sold before i even tasted it . fortunately the taste was just as endearing with a bold body and a sharp bitterness nut-like quality concluding with a pleasant dry hop finale . this beer really hit all the pressure points in a good way and is highly recommended .  medium bodied and smooth .
a : bright straw body with an enormous rocky head of great retention .  nice mouthfeel .

big foamy head , a mix of burnt malt and thick coconut in the aroma & # 8230 ; very aromatic . nice clash of burnt malt that strays to slightly to the acidic side and the mild sweetness of the toasted coconut . very interesting and yet another beer i wish i had with dessert though this would have been better with the sweet potato pie .  mouthfeel is sticky and sweet with a nice roundness and full character .

rarely , have i encountered an iipa with a nose as complex as this . it 's earthy , fruity , funky , dank . wow . dripping with pine and citrus oils . behind the woodsiness and sweetness a delicate floral aroma gently emerges ... seriously could smell this and be happy . thick , oily dark orange pour with a sustained white , frothy head . shit this is good . thick and mouth coating body never becomes oily or cloying . dripping and oozing with oily and resinous hops throughout but still manages to show a wonderful balance . thanks a ton brian !  m : about the same consistency as the boston lager .

decent lacing left behind . s - wow , great aroma here . immediately there is a lot of pineapple and coconut aroma making it clear that this has been barrel aged . lots of stuff going on here .  mouthfeel : medium-plus body . medium carbonation . some oily viscosity to the mouthfeel .

huge head , very lasting w/big bubbles & good lacing .  as is the case in many of the wilder beers out there it 's not as wacky on the palate as it is on the nose . even for a lover of brett and funk this is n't a highly drinkable beer . if the goal was just to see how far they could crank up the volume on the brett funk then they succeeded but if they were looking to brew something that tasted great i 'll have to say they fell a little short .
one of the most refreshing smelling beers i have ever sampled .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied with a velvety texture , and appropriately low carbonation .
the nose is deep , thick , prodigious coffee and some raisiny dark chocolate notes , and roasted dark sweet grains .  mouthfeel : light bodied beer . moderate carbonation .

another great beer from denmark , this little country is no slouch in craft beer world.poured into an imperial nonic a near jet black except from some chocolate brown highlights when held to the light , a large blooming lighter mocha colored head atop.to me the aromas couldnt get any better , a fantastic display of chocolate and resiny hop , maybe the best aroma of any stout i have come across , if you like the hops no matter the style its spot on.the mouthfeel is a little sharp and not as full on as i would have liked.bitter chocolate , dark fruit , and a healthy dose of resiny hop make for a well rounded flavor profile , if that mouthfeel was just a little more smooth ! a really good beer that is close to being great , love the hop play going on .  the mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation .
great clarity , very active , amber color , with a finger of bubbly off white head that fades gradually .  fairly thick body .
smelled great ! t : was a bit disappointed by the taste .  light body with good carbonation .
upfront the smell has alot of oak and toffee . no alchohol .  very smooth without being too full bodied .

the head recedes smells great , rummy , oak-y , sugar cane , caramel , coconut , spicy , very layered and complex nose . there 's a little hop bitterness in the taste but all else is overpowered by the rum and oak taste .  taste is thin and adjuncty . mouthfeel is good , thick and creamy .

poured this 12 ounce gem into a british pint glass and really enjoyed this smooth stout jet black appearance with 2 fingers of foamy tan colored head and retention ; this brew looks perfect , and staring at that glass rekindles an image of a british pub aroma of a sweet , biscuitty , and dark chocolate notes rich , full bodied , toasty malt , balanced with some hops which accentuate the side of my tongue , and a finish with a bit of zing that lingers on the palate .  m- very little carbonation . very full syrupy body .

unusual and quite nice . taste : herbs dominate ; white pepper , belgian yeast , and a very bitter , grassy finish .  for a big mouthfeel , this simply does n't have a flavor to match . very nice mouthfeel , good bite up front , a bit of carbonation in middle that emphasises the rye flavors , and a crisp finish that is actual slightly ruined by the lingers smoked flavor .
its dark amber color and white head give way to perfect lacing as i drink down this wonderful libation .  there 's moderate carbonation to it as well .
great color , substantial head on pour . beautiful appearance .  boiled pasta water finish . good carbonation . twinge of acid is perfect .
smell is of fresh hop , so fresh.just layers of vegetal , cirtusy hops with a slight hint of pine and pale malt .  creamy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation .

aroma is seriously biscuity and toffee maltish . good . taste is lightly malty , very faintly sweet , with a distinct mineral edge .  it has a very soft mouthfeel , a little like soda to be honest and you can barely notice the alcohol .

big fluffy two finger head that wafts the hop aromas well , tons of lace and excellent carbonation . color is a kind of murky dark amber . smells great . i love it , the quintessential california hop heaven . tons of grapefruit cascade , melon , guava , apples , cherries- all with a subtle fresh-cut woodsy pine backbone and soothing aroma of fresh mountain air .  mouthfeel is medium with good level of carbonation .
appearance : deep , dark , and black . decent lacing left on my snifter .  m : nice and thick d : not something ill try again .

smell is great , very complex . ripe fruits , some yeast , a tiny bit of roasty malt and a bit of alcohol .  dark brown/amber body . it is a very smooth and a sweet sipper . some hops , caramel , candy sugar and oak . not much bourbon . i was way excited to try this and actually find it to be rather average .

s sweet and complex on the nose . honey , orange zest , and chinese 5-spice . touch of clean alcohol and fresh bread . light malt character on the backend coddles a soft alcohol note . the finish carries a rolling bitterness , and the malt that balanced the ending alcohol note slowly fades to give way to a brighter boozyness .  medium mouhfeel with some carbonation . smooth and buttery feel . pretty dry finish .

the beer was served in a traditional belgium chalice and the color alone really made me stop and admire this beer . it was a light ruby red , very clear and was topped with a creamy pink head .  feels very creamy but that does n't make the beer more drinkable to me .

aroma exhibited a very nice floral hop bouquet . light and sweet with a hint of spiciness . this beer smells excellent and is not overpowered by the hops .  mouthfeel : light-bodied but not watery . it had a nice feel to it .

5.0 s : wow ! this is n't the strongest smelling dipa i 've had ( it 's up there ) , but it is the most harmonious mixture of citrus i 've ever experienced . pineapple and mango are the most intense , followed by orange , tangerine , and grapefruit . 3.5 t : the taste is a bit disappointing after the nose . 3.0 m : lighter medium body , but it strangely lays heavy on the tongue . 3.5 d : pretty good , but one of the reason i really like dipas are for the awesome creamy mouthfeels .  there 's also just a hint of citrus from the orange peel ( or orange oil extract ) the smooth mouthfeel and moderate body is not unlike that of a german hefeweizen .
