aroma is simply heavenly , with strong molasses overtone and some burnt hints .  this is my first review and hope it looks well , even if not my favorite beer . leaves a malt taste on the roof and tongue . this is the first scottish ale i 've tried . for comparison , i love dark ales , like ommegang abbey belgium ale and founders breakfast stout . bottle serving .
really great nose !  maybe i could not taste the `` rare '' but this really sucked compared to the 2008 classic gueuze which is a fantastic gueuze .

same good looks as the others . bronze topped with a healthy dollop of buttercreme . while mildly interesting as a laboratory on ahtanum , it 's clear that this hop wo n't headline any solo tours .  m - great carbonation , finishes well .

the aroma is both unique and memorable , with a cornucopia of fruitiness : pineapple , mango , strawberry , and starfruit . the hops taste grassy and resinous , but the highlight is the tropical fruits derived from the yeast ... excellent stuff , even though it 's not the most cohesive-tasting flavor profile . a crafty anniversary beer..complex , tasty , and original . kudos , real ale .  m - medium body and low carbonation .

lovely hue , a truly good bright ruby red , with a collapsing , but pleasantly silky head of yellow white . it 's a really lovely looking american red ale , absolutely what you want from the style .  mouthfeel is crisp , the whole drink is refreshing due to the good carbonation .

s : big yeast smell right up front . the yeast and hops work really well together . excellent nose . t : wow . d : very nice beer . still excellent beer all around .  pleasantly carbonated on the palate , with a dry finish .

sugary sweet hoppy aroma . floral and fruity hop presence with strong peachy gummy candy elements and a sweet malt backing .  being of fan of bocks , i was fully prepared to love this ubiquitous doppelbock . it was kind of sweet and malty , smelled great , felt nice going down -- quite satisfying . there was a slightly funky smell to it , and an even funkier taste . i thought that was more common in highly hopped beers . at $ 10 for the four pack , i hate to try it again for fear of wasting my hard-earned beer money .

the aroma kick is amazing , a strong citrus , fresh piney hop nose . overall , highly drinkable , in the west coast pliny type tradition .  m- moderate/high carbonation , medium body , lager clean . crisp enough leaving a refreshing feel .
appearance : this one pours a very dark mohogany with an incredible red hue . great head rentention very frothy .  medium-full body and medium carbonation with good smoothness .

aroma was ridiculously appealing - sweet malt , caramel , maple , vanilla , oak , some dark fruit , and alcohol . wow . d - this was a sipper , but drinkability benefited from the fact that it tasted so damn good .  very creamy and full . very dry .

smell : the best part of this beer in my opinion . extremely complex ! i smell the chocolate and coffee but i am also overwhelmed by the super sweet heavenly smell of vanilla . taste : i was so happy that the taste was so refined , understated , elegant and smooth . drinkability : love it love it .  mouthfeel is about right for style , perhaps a touch undercarbed , but all else is acceptable , though it showcases a flavor profile best left behind the curtain .

smells good too , obvious floral hops and substantial bready slightly sweet malt , both of which hit at the same time . this review is probably going to come out higher than it should due to the deceptively good appearance and smell .  - well carbonated , dries the mouth a bit . nice smooth body , probably this beers highlight is the mouthfeel .

beautiful beer at 6.8 % abv certainly packs a punch , a - perfect for the style , a big fluffy head fell away at moderate pace , lacing well , pours a hazy orange s - a highlight for me , big amarillo hop aroma , citrus , fruity no negatives in the aroma dept . t - a little bit less than a std dipa bitterness but still kicked liked a wild goat , beautiful flavours , crystal or other malts coming through m - well controlled and certainly right for me .  mouthfeel is light with a good spike of carbonation .
really loved the nose .  very light body , and highly carbonated and fuzzy .

a brilliant tan head rose quickly to three-fingers and lowered very slowly leaving brilliantly thick patchy lace on the glass .  it was somewhat thick with some carbonation , and had a hot aftertaste .

a true imperial ipa , copious amount of pine and grapefruit . truly a beer geek 's beer ... my wife hated this beer . this is a well-made beer , and i certainly enjoy haivng one every now and then , but more a treat than a beer staple .  a - opaque black color with a small head that disappears quickly s - rich chocolate-like aroma , mild yeast esters , some smokiness , no hop perceived t - roasted malt flavor dominates , some yeasty esters and mild hop flavors take a secondary role , very gentle mild hop finish with some lingering smokiness m - smooth creamy medium body with moderately low carbonation d - this is a decent enough oatmeal stout . the head and retention is disappointing , but the smell , taste and mouthfeel are acceptable .

jet black in color with a huge , coffee colored head on top . just a clasic looking stout if there ever was one .  the mouthfeel is thick and oily with a mild burn going down . have a bottle of this is all i can handle , which is good because the full bottle would have me a little too buzzed .

a very nice set of smells on this one .  light-medium caramel malt sweetness up front , continued in the middle with a hint of earthy hop bitterness , finishing with a more of the same . medium mouthfeel .

s - love the smell . citrus ( grapefruit , orange ) with enough hop smell to it . t - pretty good tasting but not remarkable . smooth , fruity . however , an easy and nice tasting ipa to knock back a few of on the weekend .  i 'm not sure what a `` baltic '' porter is supposed to taste like ; but this one is quite different from most porters i 've had . sweet molasses aroma that is greater than any chocolate or mocha that might be found . a strong level of metal present also . sweet , almost like brandy . reminds me far more of a double bock than a porter . i can not detect any hops at all . too sweet for me , making it more one-dimensional without any complexity .

s : this is an amazing smell . chocolate , malt , cream , milk , caramel , coffee and vanilla can all be found . nice . m : silky smooth .  it 's still fairly sturdy though , and carbonation is low but solid .

incredibly pungent and tropical aroma . the distinct nelson hops really shine here . one of the best aromas i 've ever experienced from any dipa . an absolutely wonderful dipa . honestly , i never expected a dipa this good to come from karl strauss -- count me in as very pleasantly surprised .  m : thick , chewy..medium carb .

a - clear ruby amber color with a wonderfully thick head that is well retained in a lacing s - noble-type ( kent goldings ? ) hop aroma , mild but most prominent ; faint malt with a trace of yeasty esters t - very well balanced malt and hop flavor , some caramel noticed but not strong , not much of a finish to it except some hop bitterness as the very end m - light body , moderate carbonation d - this is a highly drinkable beer .  good mouthfeel for this light body but the hops balance the feel .
tall , nearly white head with good retention and great lacing .  mouthfeel : good carbonation , nice medium body .
appearance : very dark , as the name would suggest ... but some brown tinge . quite a nice head , with moderate retention and nice lace .  could be a bit less carbonated .

it reminds me a bit of some barley whines . quite complex . taste : sweet apple , honey , strong grain , plenty of oak in there , dark fruits and alcohol .  m - full bodied and chewy with a moderately dry finish with some alcohol noticeable .
this beer pours exceptionally well for a three finger thick cranium in a light tan color .  mouthfeel was nice smooth and easy to drink as far as body goes .

wonderful tropical fruit and floral aroma that from my experiences is ever present . the centennial hops are very distinctive as they come out in the aroma and flavor .  m : crisp and clean , moderate levels of carbonation and warmth . medium body .
amazingly complex . taste follows nose and begins with dark malts and honey sweetness .  mouthfeel was nice and thick ; you know you 're drinking a dipa .

aroma is of hops , sugar and vanilla . this beer is mostly sweet and overly oaky with an almost cloying finish that has very little hop bitterness .  m - surprising carbonation fight with a medium bodied beer .
burnished cherry color , fairly translucent , with a good 2 cm of vanilla colored head resting atop .  mouthfeel was good , with plenty of carbonation and a nice smoothness to it .

aroma is very fruit dominated , and not by any single one . peach , lemon , starfruit , lime , mango ... it 's an intoxicating tropical melange . some contrasting oak and fresh yogurt notes are there too , lending some harmonizing 'wild ' elements without getting too funky . flavor is moderately puckering , tart and verging on lemony sour . hop elements are present though indistinct in the mix , lending some possible leafy orange tea notes , and residual bitterness .  a little sticky and a very bitter aftertaste .
s- lots and lots of chocolate here . roasted malts as well .  smells of raisins , a hint of semi-sweet choc ? mouthfeel is nice , thick , syrupy & smooth ... the way i want a barleywine .
smell : smells like a banana laffy taffy . also get some pumpkin spice aroma in there too .  mouthfeel - medium bodied and smooth with a good carbonation level .

a - perfectly clear , fresh honey golden color . s - wow . piney citrus . loads of hop aroma . with the nose , i expected a haymaker of hop bitterness , but it was actually fairly subtle to me . m - medium-bodied , nice feel .  pleasantly effervescent mouthfeel .
pours a clear deep red-brown with a big white head .  mouthfeel is pretty good , goes well with the style of light and highly carbonated .
first pour yielded about 6 fingers of creamy/frothy hybrid head with ( unfortunately really good retention and lots of lacing .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and carbonation is moderate .

flower essence , hop oil , a touch of malt balances out the smell nicely . taste and mouthfeel- much of the same that is in the smell is evident in the taste as well .  the carbonation and mouthfeel were appropriate for this style .
s : whoah ! strikes me as a red racer jr. in the aroma dept . : caramel malt , citrus/tropical/piney hops .  thick and smooth mouthfeel .

pours a oil dark black with a big brown head .  m & d - this beer is great on its own , too light and carbonated and malty for me , but suits a nice dinner perfectly , goes well with food and that was its intention so i must review it within its intentions and the style , for which it is very good
the bottle popped furiously , and poured with a full head and glowing color .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated , and nice and creamy . feels good on the tongue .
'' the appearance was awesome . huge head all the way down the glass .  this beer has noticeable viscosity and a big thick feel . minimal carbonation .

big on the aromatics ! perceptible alcohol is offset by a great earthy wood character . perfect for the style . flavor brings on even more fruity ( apples mostly ) malt and alcohol sweetness but it 's held in check by the equally healthy dose of hopping .  crisp , clean mouthfeel with flavors of dry , pale malt . at first , i found myself wanting more flavor , a la boston lager , but the mouthfeel and resulting drinkability really brought things back up for me in the end .

appearance : black as the abyssal depths topped by a hearty dark brown head that 's thick , frothy and slightly rocky . it sticks around for quite some time before settling down to a smallish layer of foam and then finally a ring of bubbles .  m : pretty creamy and lightly carbonated . easy to swallow a mouthful .
the yeast notes are exquisite . not very earthy , mostly ripe fruit with a bit of funky complexity .  m - lighter side of heavy , pretty smooth .
the chocolate yeti has perfect color in both the body of the beer and the frothy dark brown head .  m : medium in both body and carbonation .

this beer smells incredible . a strong aroma of hops and malts immediately made itself known as soon as the bottle was cracked . excellent lacing .  light mouthfeel with a good amount of carbonation when you drink it .
s- very wonderful aroma here . very nice hop smells come from this .  m : light-bodied , crisp , very clean , refreshing .

pours an opaque orange gold with a massive , fluffy four finger head . gorgeous , a pour and a swirl can barely keep it in the glass . lots of visible , whitish sediment swirls around under the head . tiny champagne bubbles collect on the outside under the rim , sliding shimmering down the glass into a frothy lace after a tilt .  thick body is very good . it 's just passable for now .

appearance - pours dark enough to block out all light . a big bubbled mocha head springs up and i have to quell the pour a bit to calm things down . it caps off and forms a nice creamy cover with large spacious bubbles of foam below it .  mouthfeel : bitter . nice carbonation .
bottle poured into a pint glass appearance- beautiful ! one inch light tan head that slowly disappears .  i felt that the mouthfeel was the best part of this brew .

the scent on this beer is very sweet . tons of grapefruit and orange come through very strongly . also get a lot of alcohol in the nose . upon first sip , i get so much thrown at me at once . the hops are a bit overwhelming , as well as the booziness .  mouthfeel is good , soft and tingly .
appearance : pours a beautiful hazy dark amber color with a finger of foamy off white head that leaves a little bit of lacing and good retention .  mouthfeel - nice body , pretty crisp .

awesome hop aroma of german noble hops . smells like tettnanger to me ... pleasant , dry and crisp character . decent hop bitterness and flavor .  it 's very creamy and goes down easy . i 'm really disappointed with this .

poured a dark golden orange to light amber in the glass ... yes , almost the color of the jewel amber . lots of beautiful bubbles in the pour reminding me of a guinness that end up creating a full 2 finger craggy beige head that melts to sticky lace .  mouthfeel was smooth , light , though i do n't know i 'd go as far as crisp .

floral pine caramel . t : at 99 ibu and 6 % i was expecting a hop bomb that was crazy unbalanced but the scottish golden grain holds up against the hops . real bitter and dry mouth with a little astringent flavor d : besides my mouth being super dry and bitter its a great session beer . one of the best ipas ive had considering the flavor of the beer .  i like the thick , syrupy mouthfeel as it 's quite comforting but the taste gets old fast and just is n't complex .
i have to say that the smell of this is fantastic . t : wow , the taste is a bit of surprise .  medium bodied ; good amount of carbonation .

a vigorous pour produced several fingers of foamy white head that eventually dissipated to about two fingers . lots of sticky lacing .  mouthfeel was really good for a light beer . liked the carbonation , and felt richer than it tasted .

smell : the wonderful aroma starts with the smell of concord grapes . holy hell , this liquid smells amazing . its like a huge fruit salad mixed with brandy and raisins ! taste : so does it taste as good as it smells ? well , the taste is of plums , raisins , and maybe prunes .  the body and carbonation levels are appropriate .

the brothers consistently nail aroma . bubblegum and tart cherry with moderate roasted qualities and a faint hint of wheat twang .  the mouthfeel is very nice , it 's very carbonated which works with the ginger presence , and the mouthfeel is at about a medium thickness .

smell is immensely yeasty with hints of clove , orange , and vanilla . decent nose if you ask me .  mouthfeel is heavier than i 'd anticipate . i wish i liked the flavor of this because its heaviness is spot on .

pours a murky borwn with some red hue with absolutely no head to speak of here but was expected , great aromas of cocoa some sugar cookie dough and orange with some noticable nuttieness.a real sipping brew here and fruity to the hilt big orange flavors along with some sour cherry and i have to say it does have this vodka and cranberry flavor to it the first i have ever experienced that in a beer , as the beer warms a real nutty presence come out as well.a nice before bed beer very enjoyable and exremely complex .  mouthfeel : light/medium with a tart , crisp finish drinkability : i really do n't crave another of these ; this certainly would n't be a lawnmower beer for me conclusion : just kind of unsorted ( also kind of an odd bitterness on the finish ) ... i tried this a year or two ago and was n't a huge fan ... now that i 'm reviewing it ... i 'm still not .
s : this beer smells incredible . huge vanilla aroma that is mixed with a huge coffee aroma .  mouthfeel : full-bodied with a strong , expressive carbonation .

smell is boatloads of grapefruit , orange rind , and lemon ; really fantastic in the aroma department . taste is brisk , with a light but flavorful hop attack , refreshing wheat tartness , and perfect carbonation .  the body was definitely heavy on this one . heavy for a dipa especially of this size .

a big frothy tan foam sits atop the brown liquid . reddish hues appear when held to the light , along some clarity . very nice .  mouthfeel is of alcohol . the brew itself is medium-heavy bodied , with a very clean finish . this beer is clean as far as mouth feel goes , but is not as forgiving to the throat on the way down .
i must say from my experience , dark horse makes some great looking beers . this one pours a beautiful light hazy brown , which turns a hazy burnt orange in the light .  good carbonation .
s - sweet fruit and malt smell with some alcohol .  the mouthfeel is about right for a stout , a bit thick with low carbonation .

very good . t - starts out quite fruity , sweet and tart with heavy notes of strawberries .  the mouthfeel is the most appealing part of this brew , unfortunately i just ca n't escape the sour flavour .
terrific chocolate and coffee notes with some fruity hints as well .  mouthfeel is light body , medium carbonation . fairly nice .

incredibly clean , with absolutely no imperfections in the malting or hops . extremely delicate . the flavor is incredibly clean .  golden in color , slight haze ( nothing wrong with that ) , definite aromas of honey sweetness . lingering sweetness in the palate with a slight funk . interesting beer and something that one might only need to consume once .
smells very sweet , of caramel and spice and a definite alcohol presence on the nose . i love it . one of the best smelling beers i 've put my nose to .  velvety . good amount of carbonation .

a : pours like a typical ipa , great clarity , orange color , foamy white head , sticky lacing , and good head retention s : before opening this bottle , i was saying to myself `` please be fresh , please be fresh '' and almost immediately after cracking the top of , my nose was met by the unmistakable fresh hop profile of hop stoopid . big aromatic tropical profile with notes of mango , orange and honey . some earthy malts sit beneath the bright hop profile . the flavors do n't all see to be coming together like i would like as there is some caramel character that throws me off a little mf : medium body , high carbonation , a tad sharp d : this is a great value for a dipa that packs quite the punch in the hop department . the highlight of this beer is the aroma . the taste is great , but does n't deliver as good of balance as some of my other favorite dipas .  mouthfeel is nice and thick and well carbonated . the best part of the beer .

a - black with a huge coffee colored head s - smells delicious - very sweet , chocolate malts . the most balanced smell to a stout i have had the pleasure of knowing .  the mouth is thick and malty . as far as drinkability , i have to say that i would be really happy to have one of these if i was alive 4000 years ago but for now i 'm going to have to go for something else .
a wonderfully thick head sits on top of an incredibly amber colored beer . my favorite look easily .  m : medium-light body ; moderate carbonation ; smooth and clean mouthfeel .
the aroma is deliciously hoppy with some citrus notes .  meidum bodied and relatively smooth .

awesome . the taste is again huge with cherry flavor without sweetness , cherry pits , a decent amount of sourness , with a good lactic tartness on the finish .  mouthfeel is light and refreshing making the beer overall a decent session beer .

rich , sweet aroma of dark fruits , powdery chocolate , and fortified red wine . easy drinking , pleasant and nicely fragrant .  smooth with a creamy but dry finish . i walked away thinking that the `` smoked vanilla , coffee , and birch '' was meant to be flavor descriptors rather than actual ingrediants . all of these elemtns were way too weak to be appreciated for what other beers can do with them . call it a single , nix the mention of the adjuncts , and this beer would be alright .

very nice . the taste is quite good , mostly dominated by malts .  really nice body all around ... overall - i would really enjoy this beer if it were n't for the bubblegum flavor , it 's really off putting and not very pleasant .

excessive packaging ... appearance : pours a thick , gloupy black and then cascades out an amazing amount of dark tan head that haves great retention and is very creamy looking .  mouthfeel is fairly creamy , with a lighter , dry body .

dark-brown/mahogany color with a full creamy tan head and good carbonation which leaves sheets of lace .  mouthfeel- medium mouthfeel ( for the style ) . carbonation level was perfect for bringing out the bittering hops .

s : earthy hops , lots of caramel , toffee , and vanilla . smell was nice , taste was pretty comforting , but i still think an oak aged ipa is weird .  m & d : very good , sits well and fairly easy to drink once you get the first one down
this is beautiful , and refined . man , the nose really had me going , but the taste did n't follow through .  m - oily , medium body with a fantastic amount of carbonation .

overall the beer looks and smells fantastic . it falls way short on flavor and drinkibilty .  the feel was pleasantly smooth , but was unimpressed with the drinkability as seemed to reform a head with every drink .

aroma , port , sherry . it 's sweet but very inviting . sherry quality very present in the taste .  the flavor that by far took the lead was chocolate ! there 's an overpowering ( and for me , disappointing ) chocolate aftertaste in this beer . mouthfeel- smooth , no complaints here . drinkability- well , the bottle looks cool as you drink from it !

it smells like a a big pile of hops . there are also some alcohol esters and actually a decent aroma of biscuit-like malt . t : hops dominate .  taste : slick and creamy mouth feel with a sharp biting carbonation , malt sweetness almost goes over the top .

bottle- color of dark orange , with a decent off white head - nose of fresh hops , pine , mint , resin , cannabis , and slight malts taste of fresh hops , slight mint , resin , cannabis , and slight malts - body is smooth , but too watery , and with low to medium carbonation aftertaste of some metallic , hops , and resin  mouthfeel is medium-light bodied , a nice creaminess to the carbonation .

wow , the smell is the absolute best part of this brew - strong on the citrus . when first tasting dreadnaught , i picked up more piney hop taste than the smell indicates . the more i drank , however , the citrus hop flavor came through . i paid $ 8.99 for this bomber and it was worth it ( although pricey for an everyday beer ) .  m : creamy and nice . decent carbonation keeps it from sticking to you .
it lasts forever and settles to a nice pillow . usually old ales have no head at all . i 'm amazed this looks so good .  feel is good - light , crisp , medium bodied .

tremendous head and a deep , dark brown body . the lowly brown ale usually isnt going to win beauty contests , but this is about as good as one will look .  has a nice medium to full body with light carbonation .

i love the appearence of this beer , the deep dark color and the nice tan foamy head make for an inviting glass .  but it does n't make me puke ( and it tastes better than bmc by a sconch ) mouthfeel is nice . kinda creamy mixed with crisp .

the smell is sweet and malty . sugar cookie , icing , cotton candy , candy corn , it is predominantly sugar , but it is many different shades of sweet . it is a smell you seldom come across in beer , and it is great . the flavor is big and bold .  m : medium body and very good amount of carbonation in my opinion .
the appearance is a perfect amber .  mouthfeel is light bodied with good carbonation .
deep amber 2 finger head .  full bodied with a smoothy , creamy mouthfeel .
this brew poured to a nice to an amber color with a very impressive head ! it is a very nice looking brew .  m : a nice , medium body .

typical of the wheat and carapils . s - pineapple , mango , apricot , piney hops balance with the carapils aroma . all in all , good balance . m - smooth medium body with soft carbonation . d - well , i ca n't really detect any alcohol , it drinks really fast , and it 's delicious .  m- really good carbonation , low abv and the nearly great sweet/tart balance make it actually react quite nicely with the mouth .
full concentric rings of lace and very good retention are a highlight .  mouthfeel is medium , carbonation average-high with some pleasant warming feel .
a- pours about as dark as u can get without being called black . two fingers of a tan head that has pretty good retention . tons of lacing left . a very looking beer .  m - good . a little sticky .

s- large amount of aromatics here ! strongly grapefruit in character , citrus of oranges and lemons behind that , notebook paper , and minute hops profile . t- the grapefruit is a tease . i prefer to smell it to be honest , but that wo n't last forever . the hops become distracting towards the middle , but it is no where near the annoyance of a hop bomb .  mouthfeel : nice feeling on the tongue and also a good consistencty .

it has a gold cloudy body with a beautiful head and just the right amount of carbonation from an aesthetic point of view . it is a simply picture perfect beer .  the mouthfeel is fine . it is a low/medium bodied beer with good carbonation .
this looks like cough syrup . smells of citrusy hops , hops , and more hops .  m - good mouth feel . somewhat unique in feel .

aroma smells a lot like centennial and amarillo hops - a touch of tangerine and bubble gum mixed in with the grapefruit and pine . i love it . flavor is fairly sweet up front , with good piney notes , and a strong grapefruit bitterness in the finish . as it is , it 's still really good .  mouthfeel is spot on for the style , light and crisp and a bit dry .

a- pours a pitch black hue with brown and amber highlights , small tan/brown head that is mostly sustaining , fair amount of lacing throughout s- fruity scents dominated by raisins and dark fruit ( as advertised on the label ) , i am also getting tones of apple , peach , belgian candy , sweet caramel/toffee malts , and a modest alcohol presence t- initial taste is raisins , raisins , and more raisins ( almost cloyingly sweet ) , followed by a variety of fruits and spices , yeasty/bready/sweet malts , a little bit of chocolate and belgian candy , finishes with sweet malts , a touch of bittering hops and warming alcohol presence m- medium/full bodied with good carbonation , nice slick texture that coats the tongue in sweetness d- 9 % abv is well-masked , but this definitely a sipping beer to be enjoyed over time ( much like a port or desert wine ) .  m - pretty good .
s - the aroma initially reminded me of kentucky monk ( a very fine compliment ) . nice stuff .  the mouth is smooth and light .

pours a semi-cloudy , orange/brown color with a thick creamy head , that showcases some great retention and lacing .  m : medium-bodied with low and sightly creamy carbonation . there is a slight sticky feel and syrupy feel .
pours beautifully , flat opaque black with a thick chocolate milk-colored head that dissipated but not too quickly .  decent carbonation , neither too intrusive nor too laid back .
bottle : poured a medium amber color ale with super big foamy head with great retention and good lacing .  crisp , good body overall .

s : cranberries , some grapes and apples . good hop character . very complex and well done aroma . t : finish is slightly bitter but nothing overpowering , with a warm alcohol character that becomes a little cloying .  smooth in the mouth with nice , crisp carbonation . nice feel , but flavor is not there .

above average head retention & lacing s : lemony with white pepper & orange peel t : follows the nose , also some breadyness & candi sugar , apple peels & general spiceyness up front . finishes with apple peel , lemony & herbal hops & a lovely spiceyness & just a bit of grapefruit at the apex mf : medium bodied , lively carbonation , very nice balance superb drinkabilty i could stay on this all night !  m- decent carbonation , light and airy .
it has a very deep black color and tan head that make it beautiful to pour .  the mouthfeel is very smooth , with fine/sharp bubbles .
a : lovely dark red-brown , nearly opaque , with an antique-white froth that 's thin but resilient .  mouthfeel is quite decent .

the aroma is quite nice - banana , bubblegum , wheat , chocolate , coffee , and maybe some citric hops .  hoping it 's one of those better in a bottle beers i 'm returning to give it another try . so far so good . maybe , and i 'm stretching , some neutral hop spice . this beer makes me try too hard . these hops should be hops should be ashamed of themselves . good malt base to support hops , were they present . bottle is equally bland as on tap .

stalagtites of drippy lace . fantastic barrel aroma , soaked in bourbon and sun-dried , retaining it 's oaky complexity . mouthfeel is smooth and rich , alcohol really only detracts from the taste slightly .  m : medium body and moderate carbonation .

i do not really know who hiroyuki fujiwara is , except that he is an illustrator , makes these limited editions out of hitachino , and everyone seems to think he is the coolest guy . yellow opaque pure white head .  mouthfeel is smooth , for sure , with mellowed out carbonation and a surprising absence of slickness , considering the alcohol .

smells slightly woody followed by ripe fruit , but relatively lean . this beer has a great aroma , and a few promising notes , but overall disappoints .  decently carbonated mouthfeel , and medium-bodied .
the appearance is outstanding ! s : expresso like smell with subtle malty aroma .  full bodied , moderate carbonation .

great nose of banana , passionfruit , cloves and green apples .  surprisingly , the sediment was n't hard and i did n't feel a corporeal presence in my mouth . coopers best extra stout was nice on the palate ; softly carbonated and creamy . to tell you the truth , i was a bit disappointed .
outstanding imo . a : normal , yellowish/orange .  the mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation .

quite nice overall . taste : bit of a letdown here ; there are mild caramel and nutty flavors , but not much depth ... there 's a bit of biscuit on the finish and it 's kind of acidic , almost tart actually , and some mildly fruity flavor that i ca n't quite place and is mildly annoying .  m : very fizzy , light on body , about right for the style .

appearance : pours a clear orange color with a big 3 '' head that lasts quite a while .  orange , darkish color , looks a lot like the two previous hop project beers i had . the flavor also left a lot to be desired . the last hop project beers i had were both quite intriguing and sadly this was just boring as far as the hops were concerned . oh , well , hopefully i get to try more of this crazy series .

a great effort from smutty ; this bp pours a saturated opaque espresso brown , leaving a rich dark bronzed brown head . very well bittered and rounded in the mouth with sweet roasted malts , carob and tongue tingling acids .  m - good mouthfeel . a little heavier thanks to the lack of filtration .
the smell- almost like pumpkin pie . could smell pumpkin and the right amount of spice aroma .  this is a medium bodied , well carbonated beer .
smell- unbelievable aroma ! overall- has a great aroma but falls short with the taste .  mouthfeel is full with tiny carbonation and a faint alcohol burn as you swallow .

pitch black with a full dark amber head that settles to very thick sticky lacing .  the mouthfeel is slightly creamy and very enjoyable . this drinks nicely . there is a lot going for this though , the mouthfeel in particular .
m- thick and oily , slick and refreshing . d- very tart and complex flavor combination of hops .  mouthfeel is pretty good .
this one is really impressive out of bottle , with a deep , opaque brown-to-black color topped by a huge , fizzy beige head that settles to a persistent ring .  medium mouthfeel .

the smell was exceptional and exciting , with a remarkable variety of spicy tones that are too complex to describe . with great anticipation , i tried the first sip , which was heavenly . and then it happened ... a nasty aftertaste that i could n't quite place but did n't like .  this brew reminds me very much of delirium , and is still a taste that i can not seem to thoroughly enjoy . very malty , and the alcohol is quite present with some mild chocolate and serious bitterness . very strong warming effect as well , which is enjoyable and will be one of the few things that helps me finish this brew off . as far as my beer palate is concerned , this type of ale is one of the few obstacles i have left to conquer .
very good aroma ! taste : smooth and malty but not too much . a bit of a let down after a very nice aroma .  m- good mouthfeel , just the right carbonation .

the aroma is very kinetic - spice , yeast , banana and hops abound . medium-bodied , with a flavor reminiscent of both a belgian and a strong hefe . citrus , spice , hops and bananas all vie for attention . i liked this one substancially more than the 03.03.03 , but i think it would improve a bit with more age .  mouthfeel - some good body , oily smoothness per the style . carbonation is moderate .
the aroma is sensational . sweet , fruity , yeasty .  long , earthy , dry finish . interesting , somewhat unusual brew .

absolutely wonderful ! t : unfortunately , does n't quite live up to the aroma .  i 'm thinking of a breakfast bed . the beer was thick and the foam was velvety . the drinkitbility was okay for its thickness . however , the taste was terrible . a quick slam of semi-sweet citrus that is too heavy on the lemon . the beer ends with an unbalanced bitterness for more than half of the drink .
somewhere there is a aroma i ca n't describe , but it is very familiar . marvelous aroma , but it ca n't keep that promise .  m - effervescent with a full body and a very yeasty finish .

s : strong piny medicinal hop kick , very strong and spicy floral aromas with a bit of grapefruit rind mixed in , there is also a lightly detectable sweet and grainy maltiness hiding in the wings here as well , very fresh smelling . t/mf : this is were i was a bit disappointed after such a nice nose . d : very nice and fresh and strong hop aroma but that is where the goodness ends for me . still there are worse ipas out there than this one .  m- mouthfeel is nice . medium body with a good amount of carbonation .
poured a very nice deep copper with fantastic head and nice lacing .  mouth feel is completely crisp , refreshing , and clean .

while really good , not as good as aroma . overall : really good . would have liked the flavor to measure up to the aroma but you still ca n't go wrong with this one .  body is right- light , lively carbonation , not cloying or excessively dry .

i look at these two next to each other and woder if i have not walked into a paint shop and someone mixed my color swatch perfectly ... the aroma is fantastic . it has all the elments of a wonderful malt bomb , and just enough hop remnants to keep it interesting .  the mouth feel was very nice however i really struggled to drink the whole bottle .
very nice aroma ! very nice beer .  body was medium , and the liquid was fairly smooth overall . 3.03 rdev -19.5 % look : 3.5 | smell : 3 | taste : 3 | feel : 4 | overall : 2.5 1366

s- i love the smell , the faint raspberry aroma is delicious . t- the taste is okay , weak raspberry flavor give way to a bland wheat taste .  soft prickly carbonation does cleans the pallet , of this light to medium body beer with moderate astringency and warming alcohol .

smell is extremely fruity and surprisingly sour , extremely complex and enjoyable . aromas of apple juice , dark fruits , and a little olive .  mouthfeel is pretty good , it has a nice full body , and a good finish .

the smell is aggressive , and with high standard , quite classic . a vanilla character from the oak treatment adds nicely to the vibrant sweet malty caramel butterscotch toffee brown sugar molasses notes . really nice ! ! the flavor is quite nice as it reflects the nose yet has a surprisingly black licorice thing going on , especially in the really enjoyable aftertaste .  good carbonation .

the foam was wheat in color , bubbly , thick , smooth and left a ring around the glass til the end . the color was a dark burgandy/all most black with an orange red highlight in the light .  honestly as this has warmed it has become slightly undrinkable due to the sweetness m - medium bodied with a a good amount of carbonation . a slightly sticky mouthfeel as well .

pours a bright hazy copper chestnut color with a medium creamy off white head that retains fairly well and laces the glass .  taste/mouthfeel : mostly hops . heavily malted finish . drinkability : a bit heavy and not quite as good as other european lagers . overall : probably the best gateway to this style .

a : poured perfectly . nice pinkish , beige head with a good retention and very good lacing for this style .  the aroma contained notes of malt , hops and a discernable alcohol content of medium strength . it had a stong alcohol flavor that was very over powering the other flavors . it was smooth yet burned as it went down . truely a devilish brew !

well i poured this into a pint glass and it has a good head , a pink hue and good watermelon aroma . this is very easy to drink !  the mouthfeel is the pinnacle of this brew . full-bodied with a dry crisp feel .

smell : ridiculously aromatic , spicy/floral hops , as well a very fruity malt profile ( plums , berries , peaches ) .  a bitter spicy bite from the hops hit first . the light body and good crispness contrast the flavor pretty well .

whatever , it sounds good . it pours a very deep brown color , just a hint of blood red at the bottom , with a small , short-lived beige head .  mouthfeel - it does have a pleasant rich/buttery mouthfeel .

drank on-tap at miracle of science bar & grill , cambridge , ma poured a gorgeous , crystal clear , dark orangey-amber with a clingy , off white , one-finger head that lasted the duration of the beer .  this beer tastes like sheep shit . this may appeal to some people , but it 's definitely a very unusual belgian ale . i enjoyed drinking half of this beer for the experience . it 's so pungent i laughed out loud . it 's always fun to be exposed to a radically different flavor profile than you 're used to .

pours out to a lightly hazy light orange-amber ( not bottle conditioned ) , forming a tall & whipped off-white head with very good retention and lacing .  the mouthfeel is pretty good its not watery at all like you get with some lagers .
the smell is wonderful . tannin , grapes , apples , apple peels , raisins , caramel , touch of cocoa , and a hint of alcohol .  mouthfeel is good - medium-bodied , good carbonation , smooth .

a : dark amber-orange color , good carbonation . very good sized white head with great head retention . maintained ateast 1/4 '' head throughout .  m - the brew is wet at the lips but finishes quite dry . impressive . ~ unfortunately i 'm going to struggle finishing this because of the flavor .
very nice scent , potent citrus and floral hops .  nice crisp carbonation to keep it refreshing .

smell is impressive . it practically filled the room as soon as i popped the crack . super floral hoppy , it just smells beautiful . taste is more muted and one sided , but still tasty . overall , quite good beer .  mf : smooth and wet . complements the flavours of the body .
smell is very hoppy , very floral .  m - full bodied , medium carbonation , really smooth . seems appropriate .
poured a illowing ornage with a big white head and excellent carbonation . thick pour and cloudy .  m - good carbonation and a nice balance .

nose : this thing has everything : an early combination of chocolate , caramel , and nuts presents a whole pecan pie on a silver platter . all this is followed by some dark chocolate covered cherries and fruitcake aroma . it has a sweet plastic lasting flavor that warns off any hops . has a bit of a smoky swallow which is nice , but does n't mellow the bubble gum . this one is getting thrown behind bars for 3-5 - then we 'll see if it 's more under control .  lovely thick aromas of blackstrap molasses , dark bitter chocolate , strong coffee and deep roasted malts ... awesome aromas to this one ... lazy and flat tasting ... strange bitter almost sour taste present ... . not much in common with the aromas ... thick oily mouthfeel is great but i ca n't get by the taste of this one ... drain poured this one ... maybe a bad bottle but as is , a big disappointment ...

poured from the bottle into a nonic glass a- pours a dark orange amber color with a two finger frothy , slightly fluffy head that leaves some sticky , patching lacing , and high streaming carbonation s- a strong bouquet citrus , pine , and floral hop aroma t- balance of piney and citrus hops , caramel malt backbone , pretty strong woodiness , hits you with hops on the front and finishes with a strong piney hop finish , leaves a bitter aftertaste m- pretty smooth drinking , finishes a little watery o- a good ipa that packs a lot of bitterness and is very aromatic .  mouthfeel : good .
a : excellent dark red color . very bright and enticing .  2.5 t & m : mouthfeel is fairly viscous and silky .

reddish copper in color , impressive head with incredible retention and massive lacing down the sides of my pub glass .  after smelling , i picked up on a semi-complex mix of belgium candy , malts , cherries and alcohol . it sat heavy on me and did not taste refreshing to me . i enjoyed this beer and can tell there was definitely quality & craftsmanship involved in it 's making ; but it 's not the best tripel i have ever had .

smell : awesome . juicy citrus hop hit the nose hard . taste : does n't quite live up to the smell , but still very good . the hops are more herbal with some citrus in there as well . still very good and really glad to have tried this .  the mouthfeel was full and sweet .

thickset molasses colored pour , settles opaque and black with a tall cocoa brown head thats fluffy yet crumbly after a vigorous pour , takes forever to work its way down to one super thick maze of a skim on top and oodles of ink blobby lacing sticks all over the glass . beautiful !  the mouthfeel is decently crisp while not out-of-control with carbonation .

aroma is incredibly full and delicious . very very nice aroma . the flavor is just as incredible as the aroma . cherries , both sweet and sour are here in abundance , as well as a bit of graininess , and almost a thin flaky pastry flavor .  the aftertaste lingers nicely , and the mouthfeel is firm . full bodied and smooth , but lacking an extra punch .

fruity nose ( orange and berry ) hides wisps of wheat and hops . different is good here .  reminds me of a lager ... mouthfeel is nice and crisp which aids drinkability . everything about this tells me this is a lager . it 's a good thirst-quencher .

12 oz bottle poured into an '08 osa pint appearance- pours a deep brown with a large dense tan head , sticks around forever . incredible head retention and lacing .  the carbonation is considerable , quickening the mouth , and the hops are noticeable , but not significant .

smells and tastes of molasses , raisins , brown sugar and bourbon soaked oak barrels . very pungent and boozy in the nose and finish as well .  m : full body with mild carbonation ; slightly clinging .
this has a nice hop smell right out of the bottle . with smells of carmel , malts , and a sweet smell .  big body , low carbonation .

a - deep gold color s- amazing , citrus , grapefruit , & bubblegum aromas t- bitter hops ( grapefruit-like ) with fruity undertones . m - dry to the finish o- i was impressed that brewers were able to capture strong complexity for such a bitter , hoppy brew . overall i felt that the bitterness was way overpowering , leaving my mouth dried out .  mouthfeel is round and full , thick and sticky .

big flowery hops dominate the aroma , but it 's not a hop wallop , and it has a bit of sugary/caramel sweetness backing it up . the more i smell the more i like . has a kind of dessert-y lure to it . decent stuff , but it did n't deliver what the looks and smell promised .  m - thick , syrupy , smooth , a bit refreshing .

smell : by far the most enjoyable aspect of this beer . the smell is incredibly complex with a strong prune backbone and hints of everything from lemon to chocolate . i like smelling it more than drinking it .  m-fairly dry . medium high carbonation .

pours a dark brown black with a medium cream light brown head that slowly goes to a thin film that laces the glass .  quickly hops dominate and overwhelm with a slightly unpleasant linger . smooth with a light bite . it 's not too bad until the hop bitterness overwhelms and turns this into just another hoppy ipa . all the other flavors disappear without anything to redeem it beside bitterness and a nice feel .
a : an outstanding looking beer . dark plum color with a pinch of tannish head and amazing coating lacing . stunning .  the mouthfeel is nicely carbonated and almost creamy .
d - the smell is excellent , the rest is mediocre .  m : good mouthfeel , its crisp , refreshing , light bodied with moderately high carbonation .

the beer pours a nice orange color , and an aggressive pour yields an initially massive off white head , that fades to a one finger height before lingering . an impressive amount of lacing in generated , almost enough to garner a 5 .  mouthfeel is good bordering on to thick .
this beer is absolutely stunning in appearance .  mouthfeel is good , slightly thick .
a : light straw yellow . plenty of carbonation , bone white head with medium to heavy lacing .  mouthfeel is decent medium bodied and goes down smooth .

plenty of citrus fruits and pine , along with some other fruitiness ( maybe strawberry and mango ) make this an alluring smelling gem . the tastebuds are greeted with the expected large dose of hop bitterness , but balanced nicely by a little bit of sweet malts .  we 're okay though , as next time we get a samuel adams winter sampler pack , i 'll give her my cranberry , and i 'll have her boston lager . it 's not a bad beer , it 's just not to my liking . i ca n't even really say why . a bit sweeter than i 'd like , and just nothing that stands out and says `` i 'm great '' .

brett poured a beautiful slightly hazed golden-orange color producing a massive white head of assorted bubble sizes which was a bit hard to tame .  the feel was light , clean and crisp . damn , and after smelling this hefe , it had so much promise .

a - pours jet black with a towering tan head , which stubbornly refuses to drop for several minutes . when it finally falls to a rocky couple of inches large clumps of lacing are left behind .  m : thick creamy mouthfeel .
this brew pours into the glass with a black body topped by a thick creamy , light brown head with a good amount of lacing left behind .  it had a smooth mouthfeel with a little carbonation .

poured into a fluted glass around 6c a : copper and crystal clear , with a nice 2 finger tan head that lasts a long time and laces nicely .  body is pleasantly creamy , almost akin to that of an esb or pub ale .
chocolate head over a pitch black pit , some sweet lacing ... some mild anise and roasted malts tingle the nose , also a hint of acetone in there .  ) mouthfeel : in one word , thick .

aroma is very intriguing . predominantly grapefruit , but there 's a real presence of orange fragrance in the vein of an orange-scented candle from one of those ( apologies for the terminology here ) `` girlie '' stores . very interesting . light citrus flavor upfront .  you do n't get much of the sweet malts you get from the aroma so it really confuses the senses and does n't make for an enjoyable experience mouthfeel is heavy and it sticks to your mouth for minutes .
very interesting . smells sweet but different .  m- very smooth . medium carbonation fills the mouth a little . d- good .

the nose is incredible as it is with many of de dolle beers . big floral esters , mint , lemon , sweet malts and subtle but detectable hops . amazing brew , perfect for summertime , actually this is drinkable anytime ... beware of the burps !  first off , i can tell that this one is slightly skunked , but i ca n't really blame the brewer for this one as i am also able to pull out some nice mellow caramel malts and a touch of biscuity-bready goodness as well . nice mellow malts , not too sweet , but the hops come through for a bit too much bite from what i look for and love about english pales . the hops come on a little too strong and linger too long , not really allowing me the chance to savour the mellow malts as much as i would like . there is a slight sweetness about it that reminds me of fresh apples although not the biting green apple off taste . this is different , and nice , but not my first choice for an english pale .
smoked gouda cheese , which is one of my favorite cheeses , some peet smokiness , a bit of earthiness , and a little sourness .  the mouthfeel is good - smooth with a right amount of carbonation .
very nice aroma , light alcohol , citrus/pine hops , dried fruit , caramel , doughy .  m : very nicely carbonated for this type of beer .
perfect looking beer .  '' the mouthfeel is good . its quite smooth and slightly creamy .

a : my usual down-the-middle stout pour results in a near-overflow of creamy , frothy , light-brown foam above a midnight-black body . solid retention and some light , fine lacing .  body and mouthfeel is more or less where it should be for the style , with a heavy weight and restrained carbonation .
this one starts off with a huge citrus aroma . this is led by a strong grapefruit aroma and some fresh earthy hops .  m : very viscous , pretty smooth .

appearance- pours a mildly murky mix of gold , hay , and amber.very mildbubbling , but a great foamy head and good lacing.looks like an ipa , with some belgian flair . mouthfeel- astringent , slightly warming , and very cleansing . a nice belgian interpretation of an ipa .  very thick and coating , with very little carbonation .

s : intoxicating mixture of sour fruit ( both peach , of course , and , oddly , raspberries ) and green aromatic wood - like sawdust from a live tree in springtime . unique and incredible . t : starts out with peach , then gets truly sour and funky ( with some great sappy sawdust coming through ) and finishes with some sweeter fruit and vanilla . great . m : fairly light-bodied with abundant soft carbonation . perfect for the style .  medium bodied with lively fine carbonation .

s- 100 % hoppy nose . d- decent drinkability . very bitter . wanted more balance .  the mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy and not too heavy . the drinkablity is pretty low , not from the booze , but extreme bitterness , which overwhelms the decent , but not exceptional malt .

smells of pine , oak , citrus , caramel , very sweet smelling ... tons of things going on . not bitter at all , just very very very sweet . its definitely a sipper .  char davies , the artist in 1998 , made a fully interactive immersive visual/aural virtual artwork called ephemere , which furthers the work begun in osmose started in 1995 and displayed in the national gallery of canada in ottawa on june 26 , 1998. who cares ? this beer is almost close to a champaign ( and i would think that the yeast probably is champaign ) . also there is bitterness , which is nice to know that at least there are some hops to the so called beer . it is not advisable to use apples with fermenting , as the yeast creates funky flavors from apples , but this is much better than expected . although i would not want to drink this beer on a regular bases , thus low score on drinkability , i think it has a great taste like a grandsmith apples i use to eat as a kid .

the aroma is jam packed full of rich bourbon right up front . hints of chocolate and licorice in the background with dark fruits . the pallet has a nice chocolate flavor to it with some vanilla notes . overall a nice treat here .  m- medium in body and good carbonation .

the smell is as excepted sweet and more sweet . hints of flowers and something a bit citrusy . wow ! the taste is sooo much bigger than the smell and really does n't do it justice .  m- a good body to it . good weight and smooth carbonation . there is a strange foamy texture in the finish though .

smell : funky dog , tart , lemon , peach . mouthfeel : medium body and medium-high carbonation overall : nice to try , but unbalanced .  very tame malt , very little hops , and weak alcohol that 's more like aftershave . definitely not over-carbonated , the texture fits the style . actually the best element of this beer .
this beers saving grace is a fantastic odor .  the body is somewhere between medium and full , with a creamy mouthfeel .

the smell is quite pungent . i can smell the glass from a foot away ! sweet caramel malts are picked up in the nose , but are nothing in comparision to the huge hops assault . it is very hop foward ( understatement ) . this is easily one of the most unique and bitter beers i have ever had . the hops oils make it quite slippery and oily going down .  m : good , not too thin or thick .

excited to try this one ... a : looks perfect . deep murky copper color with a thick 1 inch white head that fades decently .  served in a pint glass mug a : pours a clear bronze color with about an inch of thick head s : a smell provides a nice rye scent with a very sweet undertone contributed by the honey addition t : very nice smooth tasting beer , has a slight hint of honey and perhaps a slight rye note but other than that there isnt much to comment on , smooth and slightly sweet but thats about it m : very smooth in the mouth with a slight bite on the tongue as it is drank d : high level of drinkability , very subdued taste that is great for a hot summer day but leaves the drinking looking for more otherwise .

light tan head for a second , poor retention and lacing ... the aroma is sweet with lots of nice sweet bourbon on the front . its a really nice smooth bourbon , makes you really want to drink it ... the taste really lets me down sadly .  m-creamy and good mouthfeel d-did n't finish my 1/5 share of the bomber .

lots of sour funk upon popping the cork . great sour funkiness with sour apples and pears . also get some very floral notes as well .  pretty much just a tingly water . very smooth and somewhat refreshing beer .

a : black on top , fades to reddish/brown at the bottom when held up to the light . nice lacing . a real gem .  at least its silky smooth and the alcohol is well hidden . this beer , in my opinion , is the weakest of their stout series .
two fingers of frothy light yellow head with great retention and lacing . truly exceptional .  mouthfeel is creamy and crisp .

a - two fingers of off-white head slowly fade on top of a gorgeous translucent amber beer with bubbles rising steadily through it s - smell is a juicy blend of citrus and apricot , grapefruit is most prominent but plenty of orange zest comes through , apricot is muted and there 's a little bit of mint and pine in there too , do n't get too much aroma from the malts , a touch of toffee maybe t - flavor is far too muted considering that the beer is so appealing to the eyes and the nose , a touch of sweetness , a lot of hop bitterness , some grapefruit and orange , some apricot , but so subdued m - nice tongue coating from the hops but the carbonation is a little prickly , not as smooth as it could be o - not a bad ipa , not a great ipa .  aside from the taste , mouthfeel is actually pleasant on the palate . good medium body and carbonation is about right on the tongue .
appearance - nice dark brown with a thick tan head that hugged the glass .  medium bodied with a creamy carbonation level .

s - heavy red wine , oak characteristics and obviously a brett brew t - follows the smell , close your eyes and you might be deceived that you are n't drinking a beer almost .  the milk sugar cuts through and makes it a bit artificial and like one of those creme savers candies . creamy on the palate with sugary milkiness with some of the same strawberry flavor and other general fruitiness , a touch of tartness in the finish . weirdness in the finish ... not medicinal but has a certain harshness and fake tasting combining with the artificial fruity sweetness like many of the shorts beers , nice to try , but i did n't have any desire to finish the 12oz .

it had an excellent , crisp citrus kind of scent to it . very sweet , very unique . i did n't love it , but appreciated how different it was .  the best part of this one is the mouthfeel ; to my surprise , it is rather thick , at least for a beer of this style .
a - pour pitch black with a tall brown head .  mouthfeel was good and thick , but was n't enough to save this beer from being a disappointment .

aroma is tremendous . dark , rich , malty sugars . drinkability is horrid , just alcohol and thickness . cloying . i hope to get to review a better bottle at some point , as i can tell the flavors are there , but this bottle was not something i enjoyed .  m : medium bodied with moderate carbonation .

not dominating like some ipa 's , there are also crisp malt notes . the blend is just about perfect . this is one inviting beer !  mouthfeel - good feel , not too thick , kind of creamy , decent carbonation .
the most delicate looking head i 've ever seen , pillowy and white , thick and longlasting . beautiful .  firm mouthfeel , big and solid . very imperial .

the smell is outstanding . you can really smell the hops from across the room , but not overly strong , they smell great . the taste is very good , but you can unfortunately taste the alcohol at the end of each sip , it lessens more and more during the session as the beer warms up a bit .  m : mouth feel is pretty good .

the appearance is an exceptional golden hue with a slight red tone . a very minimal white head is apparent with smile delicate lacing along the side of the glass .  medium full bodied , somewhat creamy .

smell : sweet fruit like berries , pear , and some citrus orange . strong spiciness not sure what kind of spices , maybe coriander . a bit musty , but in a good way , as it warms up it starts to smell like bread dough . overall : pretty good drinkability , the appearance is really disappointing , but the ( more important ) smell and taste are great !  m : the body is medium to full with a fairly high carbonation . this is actually one of the best things about this beer .
a : traditional motor oil black , very viscous looking . really cool dark brown head , darker than most . this goes away quickly leaving a very thin sheet of lace .  m : good mouthfeel .

a perfect pour into an oversized wine glass with rich deep amber body a tightly formed thick white head , i could not find any reason to not give a perfect score.tropical fruity hops in the nose with a little boozy and caramel sweetness , overripe mango and pineapple on the palate with again some sweetish booze , the malt base is quite dry underneath the hops and sweet booze.a nice dipa , one of the best pours for me ... ever .  m/d : light and smooth feel on the mouth , drinkable but not something i will ever get again .
the aromas is astonishing , this is the most coffee like of any coffee beers that i 've tasted . excellent .  m- medium viscosity with a well integrated carbonation .

convict hill oatmeal stout pours a solid black with ample dark brown head .  mouthfeel is light and also a little creamy ; effervescence nicely balances out the mouthfeel . a little too bitter and astringent for my palate ; however , i have to confess that ipas are not my style of choice .

750ml bottle into duvel tulip a : golden/almost straw color with 3 '' thick , white whipped-cream like foam s : mango ! tropical fruit . smell of a very `` sticky '' and sweet fruit . once the foam dissipated , i can smell some `` yogurty '' belgian yeast . t : low-medium , maltiness with some husky ( tannin ) character upfront . noticed a very clean belgian yeast flavor after my palate got used to the beer . d : highly drinkable .  m - very light , nicely carbonated and goes down quite smooth .
on cask at the guildford arms in edinburgh poured a golden yellow , with a white creamy head and excellent lacing .  m- the body is full . the carbonation is at a nice subdued level .

smell : the smell really is impressive . heavy heavy coffee . good malt to support , but great coffee aromas . taste : feels like i 'm enjoying a nice cup of coffee fresh out of the percolator after waking up in a tent .  body is medium and carbonation is mild .
smells of coffee and also some sweet chocolate .  m - medium bodied with good carbonation .
looks very lively . this looks amazing and out of control .  quite thick and creamy , though a little fizzy .
the pour is absolutely beautiful on this one .  m : fizzy carbonation that smooths out a little into the sip and works well with the body of the beer .

poured into my pint glass the beer is dark chocolate brown bordering on black . the dark mocha head bursts to full three fingers and flirts with going over the top edge of my glass . after a brief rest the head fades leaving a small cap and no lace .  syrupu sweetness , not cloying , with hop dryness in the blend . this is what imperial pilsner is supposed to be ? what happened to the pilsner part ?

frickin ' a beautiful . deep and black , medium head of nice and tight dark tan bubbles . no effort required to get it and even going vigorously on the pour it seems like there 's not a crazy amount of head . beautiful .  good carbonation .
the aroma on this beer is a little bit of a lot of different tones , with nothing over-powering , really nice . taste is decent .  full bodied and a bit oily in texture .

the smell was slightly chocolate . 2007 bottle 02/23/2008 beautiful smell like gourmet chocolates , an amazing improvement over the last year . this beer is a really good example of a cellar-worthy beer . 2006 vintage 01/10/09 smells malty grains , some chocolate , tastes good and probably ca n't get much better .  the mouth feel was thick and creamy ( a high gravity ) overall not a `` session beer '' but one to enjoy and move on .

summer : clear gold in color with a huge , meringue like white head that really hangs around for a while . winter : dark copper pour with a big , lasting , frothy , off-white head and good lacing .  m - light-medium body with plenty of carbonation .
the smell is a heavenly mix of chocolate and raspberrries and malty goodness .  a relatively full body and a sharp effervescence up front .

4.5 s : smells delicious ! smells like a smoked pig wrapped in bacon . the smoke covers it up like it covers up everything else . very nice . 4.0 m : heavier medium body .  mouthfeel is solid - fairly light , appropriate carbonation .

sampled @ strong ale fest san diego the beer pours the color of onyx with the head creamy light chocolate brown and portly in size with the resultant lace a fine curtain to conceal the glass .  appropriately light in body without being too thin .

the smell is divine with fruits and spice and honey , and a little malt . although not a belgian champion it 's still a fine tripel .  ) and is a deep rich molasses s : once again , may have been too cold for phenols to waft up t : slightly sweet really tasty m : nice and cold d : pour me another

appearance : black like the back ground on this page smell : chocolate , coffee , malts and cookies taste : not as heavy as u think it would be taste like it smells butit is not a strong taste mouth : thin and creamy no carbanation drink : dont really like it that much i usualy only have one or two of these when i go out to eat .  the dominate taste is sort of watery . i was worried because the head but the carbonation is excellent .
draft at teresa 's in wayne , pa pours a very dark brown with foamy tan head that forms a lacing that lasts throught the whole glass .  m -- thick , slick d -- very one dimesional brew .
s - smell is terrific and pops way more than a lot of nitro beers i 've had .  m - crisp and decent carbonation .

a= a hazy orangish amber color with an enourmous off white creamy head with amazing lacing and retention . really nice looking s= fruity for sure .  m : probably the best thing this beer has to offer . very smooth , with just a little bit of unwanted bitterness and carbonation .

a - pours a deep mahogany color with an inch of fluffy golden head . so far great .  m/s carbonation is fine , alcohol is n't really noticeable `` thanks '' to the bitterness overall i really do n't like this beer , but i guess it has more to do with me and this style than the beert itself .
as the foam subsides it applies some good lacing to the glass .  mouthfeel is good .

s : smell is great . bourbon , vanilla , and coffee . t : tastes of bourbon , vanilla , and coffee with hints of toffee and roasted malts . d : this is very drinkable , especially for the abv .  mouthfeel : medium bodied beer . very short aftertaste with his beer .

s : smell is the best part of this beer in my opinion . strong scent of hops . reminds me of some other good intoxicating herbs . i really love this hoppy goodness !  m : dry and crisp but smooth as butter .

this beer has an amazing champagne look . it has a crystal clear brass body with damn near perfect white head and lace .  on first sip you get hit with a strong citrus hop attack . from the aroma to the taste , there is just something that does n't sit well with me . it leaves an unpleasant bitter aftertaste . i love ipas and hops galore . my only guess is that the bitter citrus flavor is what threw this beer off for me .

330ml bottle poured into tulip dec9 2010 a super hazy golden orange with tiny suspended particles being move around by a shitload of bubbles . a gentle pour leaves a massive 3 finger head that forms a dome over the top of the glass and just sits there for a while ever so slowly falling to a thick film with a island in the middle that looks like a little brain s a little yeast and pineapple with some other fruits i ca n't quite place and some booze t what i smell but with a little more booze , some cereals and a nice little blast of hops .  m - a fairly heavy mouthfeel with all the sweetness .

light brown head is over an inch high on the pour , looking billowy soft like a cloud . head retention is good as it eventually recedes down to a 1/8 thick cap but sticks to that throughout the glass . nice clumps of lacing stick here and there adorning the glass .  it had a medium bodied with good carbonation .

black as night , half finger of light brown head with great retention . very good lacing on the glass .  ) mouthfeel is just nicely carbonated and light and the only reason the drinkability is n't higher on my ratings is because after a few 40 's your out of the game for a while .

a : moderate pour yields 1.25 fingers dense tan head with superb retention . a beauty .  the mouthfeel is it 's only saving grace . it 's a light bodied beer and is very drinkable , although i know this will be my last one .

a : pours black with milk chocolate colored head . major milk-stout lacing and on a violent pour you can definitely end up with 3+ finger head .  most everything else about this beer was great , looked good , good mouthfeel , but the taste .

seriously thick three-finger head when poured , creamy of-white color , full mixture of bubbles large and small . cloudy amber red color , lightening into a coppery orange around the rims .  m : dark beers always feel good in the mouth . this one isnt super smooth , but the feel is good .

makes a great presentation with three fingers of light tan head that sticks around for a good bit .  ) the body is a hefty medium , bordering on the truly heavy , with a light moderate carbonation and a fairly chewy feel . harsh .

beautiful aroma of ringwood butter , earth , spice , and slight limey citrus . great . the flavor begins amazingly - smooth earthy complex caramel with fruits and spice and medium body .  the feel is between medium and full for the style and enjoyably so . moderate carbonation nails the feel .

pours a thick , dense black with not so much as brown on the edges and a deep , thick tan head that rises above the lip of my snifter . this is as good of looking a stout as you will ever see . the head slowly recedes into a nice cream capping the beer leaving some nice lacing .  m - nice average mouthfeel .

a : a straight pour fills the glass perfectly with a clear medium orange-amber body and three fingers of frothy white head that just barely peek over the rim . good retention and light , sticky lace . a little lighter in color than i might like for the style , but otherwise a magnificent-looking beer .  starts off clean and finishes with metallic hops m : silky smooth , good carbonation d : why ?

on tap tonight at fountainhead in chicago ... poured into a tulip ... pours dark brown with nice dark ruby red highlights , good clarity . capped with three fingers of cool whip-esque white head that leaves a bit of lacing ... sweet and sour cherries dominate the nose with bits of oak and vanilla .  i believe the bottle i got was 8.75 percent.. looked pretty good for a esl , smell and taste reminded me very much of great western extra gold.. very malty with a nice solventy sweet-like alcohol burn ... carbonated perfectly , making it halfway drinkable , still hangover juice as far as imports go.. cheers !

s : this beer smells great . a very nice balance of booze with piney/citrusey hops . was slightly underwhelmed by the flavor after experiencing such tantalizing aroma smelling the beer . it is still a hearty and satisfying , flavorful brew .  adequate carbonation .
this smelled like the kitchen while my mom bakes banana bread .  the body of this beer suits the style with the usual level of north coast drinkability and feel to it . definitely the best feature .

looks like a great beer . a golden/amber colour with a foamy , thick off-white head that sticks to the side of the glass .  mouthfeel -pretty good . foamy , not spritzy . nice and full , for a lager .

say what you will about guinness ; yes , i know they 're a bunch of gimmick happy corporate whores , but one thing is undeniable ... there is no other beer on the planet , that looks , smells , or tastes , like a guinness on tap . the cascading effect is awesome . for the first third of the glass it leaves a solid wall of lace all the way around without a break in it . held to the light it 's surprisingly clear and reveals a fiery red hue .  m - i find with sub-par beers such as this one , the mouthfeel usually gives them their only good qualities . good amount of carbonation and goes down smooth .

smell is very strong , like a clove-orange christmas pomander . really spicey and orange-peely , with coriander , grass and soap . if this thing tastes as good as it smells , i 'm gon na love it . the taste is dominated by the clove , soap and cookie-dough malt . it tastes good , but not as good or as complex as it smells . alcohol is notable from the warm burn in the aftertaste . all around , a very interesting beer .  m : medium bodied , good amount of carbonation .

stunning ruby red/black beauty with superb head retention .  glass : new belgium globe aging notes : one year at ~60f in the dark bang for the buck ( oz* % / $ ) : 22*6.2/10 = 13.64 a : orange , white lacey head , slightly cloudy from yeast s : horse-y farmhouse brett with hints of orange t : brett dominates ( horse-stable hay , a little dung almost ) , notes of orange m : silky , coating , lingering , pleasant o : worth drinking , a little one-dimensional with the brett .
pours out a bronzed hazed cloudy yellow color with two fingers of fluffy creamy white head .  the mouthfeel is good , but obviously does not improve the flavor !

s- unbelievably citrusy : cumquat , calamondin , grapefruit , orange peal , pine , honey t- the aroma really grabs the attention here , but the flavor and slight bitterness still comes through : grapefruit , honey , cumquat m- peppery yet smooth with a bit of acid from the hops . o- fantastic ipa .  very nice feel .

nose is very complex , sweet stone fruits ( nectarines , peaches , and plums ) , a bit of the the pit of the stone fruit , woody , and sour funk . however , the taste was very disappointing , with a distinct stone fruit puree like taste dominating any sourness perceived in the nose . decent medium bodied beer with light carbonation , but the taste really disappointed .  m - light to medium carbonation with medium carbonation .

the nose really is redolent of pepe du chat , gooseberry , bright herbal citrus with a nice minerality with a touch of dry malt - very sauvignon blancesque .  flavor is malty and sweet , and on the finish , bubble gum ! mouthfeel is firm , and drinkability is high .

a - pours 2 fingers of thick tan head that has great retention and leaves a little bit of clinging lace .  let me first say that the brugse tripel used to be one of my favorite beers . nowdays its called brugge tripel and the taste changed slowly ... but a lot of small steps make a big one and today this beer is nothing what it used to be . smell of spices and a little hops , not fresh at all and a dull taste make it just a drinkable beer but nothing great like it had in the past .
very promising . and then : the taste is a bit disappointing after that great smell . good , but not exceptional .  m - crisp and refreshing o - overall pretty meh .

the beer is an oil black , with no foreseeable brown hue when held to the light . the head is impressive , huge , sea-foam that stays around for a long , long time .  m : light body with good carbonation .
s : strong and good balance of malt/hops in the nose . sweet and bitter , but not bittersweet .  it is very finely carbonated , giving a tickle on the tongue .
a tawny amber gem in the glass , champagne bubbles like fireworks , and an incredible mountainous head .  carbonation is right on par .

smell is strong and at first of piney , grassy , spicey hops with some citrus not all that different from an ipa . some caramellly and toffee smelling malt and a bit of booze hits the nose as well to differentiate it . taste at first is boozy . it is supported by the hops , but they are n't nearly as dominant as in the aroma . plenty of malt sweetness is there , but some fruit flavors appear as well . overall a very good beer , but it falls a bit below the expectations set by the aroma .  feels right in body , but the taste is just off .

a : pale clear amber , it poured with a big cream head with lacing that slowly died .  m : light-bodied on the palate , with a slightly creamy texture and average-to-lively carbonation . d : i just do n't think it tastes like a real lambic .

light brown pour with red highlight and a voluminous foamy light tan head . good retention and some nice lacing , though the size of the head on pouring does make me concerned that this has carbonation issues ( thankfully it does n't ) .  - 3.0/5.0 feel - coats the mouth well , with a bit of pepperly aftertaste .

a- this one pouts out a pretty dark brown colored body with ruby red highlights that can be seen when it is held up to a light . a rather large head of khaki colored bubbles forms on top and sticks around for a while .  mouthfeel : nicely carbonated and good level of thickness - probably the best part of this beer .
clean and very good .  m : felt good going down had a nice thick feel to it .

drank in a american pint glass from a 12oz bottle . appearance - golden brown with a foamy white head .  good mouthfeel , crisp , medium body , good carbonation which is refreshing for a warm weather beer .
a : my antonia pours a lovely straw/amber hue and is marked by a monstrous head of the consistency of whipped egg whites . definitely appealing ... .  it had a really good mouthfeel .

lovely , bright cherry red color ... head is large at first , simmers down quickly ... aroma : mmmmm ... .complex ! quite a rich and invigorating aroma , i postpone consumption to prolong my time drinking it deep into the nose ... really nice !  mouthfeel is light to medium and has a soft feel .

the smell was everything you would expect from a beer as hoppy as this . the smell of hop oil was big .  the body is on the full side , though not quite as much as most stouts ( i suppose increased attenuation should have been expected with the switch in yeast strain ) , and has a solidly low key carbonation .

poured the 22 oz bottle smells amazing , looks great , with good carbination the flavor let me down , the initial impression was stellar but followed by a light bodied lingering hop flavor that doesnt seem to justify the body style of the beer .  m : well carbonated and thick , fairly heavy . fits the style .

smell is kind of `` down on the farm '' and very deep and enjoyable : aromas of good bread , malt , wool , leather and coffee , subdued but complex and rich .  m - medium bodied with some soft carbonation .
aroma : hoppy , hoppy , hoppy . awesome !  this one is crisp and carbonation is at a good level . body is n't as light as i had expected ; this one 's medium-bodied .

this had a wonderful nose of tropical fruits , sugars , and malts , with a little herbal hop bitterness thrown into the mix as well . the taste was more of the same , fruity , sweet and delicious . this did have a medicinal , somewhat metallic , after taste though that kind of reminded me of orval .  m- medium bodied with a decent carbonation level .
appearance : orange/amber body with a nice two finger head .  mouthfeel is nice and full and slippery without any carbonation .
