a : pitch-black , a thick , frothy tan head very slowly settles , on top of lively carbonation . looking very good indeed .  however , extremely thin for a beer , and not very carbonated either .
what a shame ... pours a pretty golden-amber color topped by a huge , thick , creamy white head .  mouthfeel is thin .
a : this beer has the darkest head i have seen . i would describe the head as dirt brown .  it is a bit bland , the mouthfeel is way too watery .
exceptional appearance .  mouthfeel is also watery with not much body and no carbonation but essentially pretty drinkable due to the fact that is just resembles colored water .

a quick swirl brings nice crimson flashes to the glass , quite amazing ... the aroma flows to my nostrils from feet away .  the body is thin and watery ; one hardly notices the beer until it is gone .

pours a ruby brown with a creamy beige head . excellent lacing and retention .  lack of carbonation , and this beer 's thin , watery mouthfeel combine to make a less-than-awesome drinking experience .
reduces to a thin covering quickly with a handful of bubble trails enhancing the look of a beautiful fall season color .  mouthfeel is overyly fizzy and thin .
dissipation takes it 's time but leaves fantastic lacings .  m - no staying power .

very pleasant aroma t- a slight fruitiness with a hint of caramel . slight hoppiness , intially good , but after taste left something to be desired m- slightly heavy , definately not light .  3.0 m too thin for my taste and my experience with better scottish ales ( like oskar blues ) .
a - pretty , near black pour with quite a sold 1+ inch head that stays around for awhile .  m - too thin , light body , fizzy carbonation . the mouthfeel on this beer is no good .

looks like a magazine beer ad . beautiful clear , light , orange-amber color .  too much alcohol , comes of chemically ... the taste is slightly better than the aroma , but the mouthfeel is way over-carbonated and distracting and really detracts .
maredsous 8 on tap in a tulip glass . black cherry color with a nice creamy head . excellent lacing , thick on the glass .  thin watery feel .

pours a beautiful dark brown , nearly black , with a tan head of about one finger .  `` simple '' is the best word i can use to describe the taste , but it does deliver with scorched malts with a touch of lactose . my biggest complaint with this beer is the mouthfeel- it 's way too watery .

bottle poured into my terrapin brewery glass a - this has a beautiful color . it pours a golden honey color with a white head that leaves residue as you drink .  caramel , coffee and cocoa are there , but overall balance is towards the dry and bitter mouthfeel - 2.0 lightly carbonated , bordering on flat and a little watery .
nice head retention , decent lacing . reminds me more of a weak amber than a euro dark lager .  mouthfeel was slightly thick and flat .
s- smells of coffee , hint of chocolate , a little sweet . enticing .  watery mouthfeel .
12oz bottle - 2006 edition pours a clear mahogany brown with rich ruby highlights .  the mouthfeel is very watered down like an american pale ale but i thought the pumpkin taste was enjoyable .
i 'm gon na call this one black with a three inch cocoa head .  has a malty aroma , enticing , maybe some wheat too ? fizzy palate , mallty taste , fruity , not very lingering . thirst-quenching .

its pale golden body is saturated with torrents of lacing , and topped off with a meringue-like head of admirable retention . o : i do n't understand how people pay an extra $ 3/6pk for this garbage over bud ; it 's essentially the same stuff .  this beer reminds me greatly of sol , corona , and modelo . i would n't be surprised if all mexican beer came from the same place ... dirty t-shirts squeezed out into a horse trough and then 'pasteurized ' by the horse before making its way into the bottle , but hey what do i know about cervezas .
the beer looks really good with a thick brown creamy head , tons of lacing , and a very nice head that lasts and lasts .  the mouthfeel is medium bodied and very watery .

12 oz bottle , unreadable stamping on cap , poured into a flute . a : poured a nice tan one fingered head . blackness with dark red shading on its edges , great lacing appears .  a : hazy dark yellow , very nice head , carb ok s : sweet , wet , doughy aroma t : hard to place this as a pale lager ; a pale something , yes ; tinny , rather hoppy for a lager , but not enough to do the tongue any favors ; mid-sweet m : flat , watery overall , not a terrible beer , but it is rather strange .
a : black pour with a nice light brown head .  m : i was disappointed in the mouth feel . the light mouth feel really hurt for me .

inky black but holds a hinting of deep brown tone when up to very bright light . fair amounts of thickly webbed lacing sticks across the surface . still looks like one damn good porter . damn i hate when this happens to a good looking beer . not all the approachable beyond its beautiful glass of black .  the carbonation seems artificial , which really brings down the quality of this lager to something like a henry weinhards ( goes for a good taste , but it all seems somewhat fake ) . without the strong carbonation this would have been a common sight in my fridge , but as it is sieraa nevada summerfest will only make occassional appearences .

a special cask tapped last night at the j. clyde . s : an absolute explosion of floral and citrus hop aromas -- it smelled dipa-esque . a rich crackery malt backbone is evident , as well . a solid offering , and if gpbc decided to make the aroma of this beer into a car air freshener , i 'd be all over that .  the mouthfeel is way to under carbonated and watery for the style .

a : dark cloudy copper body with two fingers of off white head . good retention and lacing .  i feel like i have now experienced the true port/lost abbey experience , this is the first one i 've had that is flat ... a : pours dark brown with caramel highlights , zero head even after stiff pour , some clarity s : nose is predominantly oak and vanilla , some char quality in there , stout base takes a back seat t : vanilla and bourbon again dominate , some ashy character in there along with light notes of leather and tobacco , a bit of of boozieness on the finish mf : low carbonation is an understatement , medium body o : good flavors here , the lack of carbonation takes away from the quality a bit , for the premium price tag , i would expect carbonation .
a very nice brew that started with an absolutely great black color with an outstanding head and lacing .  mouthfeel : way too carbonated .

the aroma is pretty nice . nutty and roasted and cocoa and bittersweet .  head falls into the liquid way too quickly and seems to look more like bubble bath suds that the typical beautiful belgian head . certainly is the high point of the beer . alcohol comes a little too strong on the palate and seems to take over the other flavors . flat on the tonque . outrageously overpriced and overrated .

this pours a hazy reddish orange with a 2 finger head of foam . it looks fabulous in my nb goblet .  thin and watery for a dark beer . little carbonation . needless to say , i was disapointed in this beer .

pours a sparkling orange tinged gold , topped with a huge four finger pillowy white head , constant streams of carbonation bubbles , leaves thick puffy webs of lacing .  mouthfeel : a bit on the fizzy side - really scrubs the tongue .

great retention and great lacing .  coppery colored amber with a sudsy froth top that subsides to a foam slick , no lacing , body is very thin and under-carbonated . perhaps as an effect of my bottle not being quite as fresh as it ought to be , i am detecting absolutely none of the fruity notes commonly perceived by other ba members ... .and this really hurts my overall impression quite a bit .
with that said ... nice look . chestnut brown , reddish tones . good , soft , dense head .  body is thin and flat .

bottled on : ( should be on the bottom right hand side of the bottle but its just dots ) purchased through lakeview liquors , chicago , illinois price - $ 9.99/bomber appearance : pours pitch black with a creamy mocha colored head . with each swirl of the snifter another layer of froth reveals itself . looks tastey .  mouthfeel on both is not much , just clear water with a bit of beer bubbles .
a- pours a deep brown with a big two and a half finger mocha head .  the palate is thin .

a : pours a deep , hazy plum body that resides beneath a three-finger head of creamy pinkish-tan foam ; good retention and tons of lace . probably the best-looking barleywine i 've seen . beautiful .  m : taste was below average for me , but the mouthfeel is even worse . super thin . light carbonation and no body make this almost watery .
light copper with a thick , mousse-like , sticky-as-hell head .  limp bodied and watery , with no real aftertaste .
'' in the glass , beer is a dark mahoghany color , very attractive .  mouthfeel : very very thin .

pours very dark brown with a large very foamy light brown head that leaves tons of drippy lacing and holds a nice rocky island and cap .  carbonation appears low . beer is thin and boring , not much there at all . mild sweetness very water like . bummer .

s : banana bread , spice & smoke .  the taste is similar , just a little sweeter , with more wateriness and less hops . i could n't get over how watery this beer tasted and felt . maybe i 'm rating it a little low because of that , but it has a lot of strikes against it : watery , bland , and definitely not a bargain .

it poured amber in color with a creamy-brown 3+finger head that lasted quite a while . it left gobs of sticky lacing all over my glass .  has a bit of a sweet maltiness and maple flavor does come out more as it warms m : very thin feel for a porter and leaves an odd buttery coating d : nothing really appauling , and nothing overpowering so it is drinkable , but i probably wo n't get another

anyways , into the erdinger glass ... a - really impressed with this head .  hard to slam the beer that got my through college but ... . the twelfth tasted like the first . not really whatt i consider beer anymore but my in-law says it is more of a beer than budweiser ? could there be a reason you can by `` cooler-packs '' in multiples of 6 !

label is shrink wrapped on the can , not printed . bright and glowing copper orange color . plenty of foam , visible trails of rising carbonation . a substantial head that laces well , with a skim that never breaks on the surface .  the mouthfeel is medium-light bodied with a watery texture , and a little too much carbonation .

into a pint glass , poured a cloudy orange/amber with one finger of white , good retention , and great lacing .  taste is malty to start , but very thin . the body leaves one wanting more . dry finish with an almost soda-like feel . despite the lack of body , this beer is rather drinkable .

a- pours a deep oily black with a three finger tall foamy brown head that has incredible retention ( after 5 minutes there 's still a finger worth left ) .  m. thin with no carbonation at all . d. i thought the flavors were interesting , but this beer was much too thin and flat for my taste .
a - scotch / almond color . beautiful head with great lace .  m : light carbonation with a very light watery body .

22oz bomber app : this beer is a beautiful ruby -- the reddest beer i 've seen . perfect clarity . minimal head , but nice lace .  m : this feels fairly thin ; the flavors fall quickly off the tongue , resulting in a watery finish .

great retention , and lace as one might expect from a northwest ipa .  the taste is cloyingly sweet , viscous , the aromas transfer , and turn very bready on the finish , the middle has cherries candies , almost medicinal the mouth feel is vaguely reminiscent of cough syrup , but watered down . there is no bitterness and even less carbonation .

poured into an imperial pint glass , formed a 3/4 '' light brown head over the clear garnet brew . head lasts nicely , with ample foamy lacing .  m - one of the first things that i noticed was how thin this beer was . unfortunately , this definitely felt watered down .
pours a beautiful hazy light orange with a frothy white head that leaves droopy horizontal strips of lacing down the sides .  almost no body present .

this pours a very deep brown with some dark ruby highlights at the edges , with a two finger offwhite head that subsides and leaves chunky lace on the way down .  mouthfeel was quite thin and highly over carbonated .

pours an opaque darkness with a huge stiff dark brown head that decomposes like an ice cream sundae , massive 3d lacing present .  the mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and just way too thin and watery for an oatmeal stout .
the color is a beautiful ruby red , almost purple in the light .  watery and flat in my mouth .

this beer looks wonderful . a beautiful mahogany red , cloudy and rich topped with two and a half fingers of rich foam . the beer leaves textbook rings down the glass as you drink it ( rather quickly ) .  the beer was entirely too light bodied for a stout , this really was one of the most disappointing elements of the beer .
sterling scarlet brown under a large canopy of tan .  mouthfeel is thin and watery .

appearance this oatmeal stout was almost black with a monster head that just blew up on contact with the glass . it was dark tan and left some good lacing .  beer is black in color , with very little light showing through when held up to the ceiling s- after some swirls , gives off a boozy sweet aroma with notes of wood t- well , it has a very good flavor starting out malty sweet with dark fruits , then gets an added booziness a with notes of wood m- has a full body but there 's pretty much no carbonation d- its a shame , if this had at least a hint more carbonation , it would have been a pretty stellar beer because the flavor is there .
bottle courtesy of kegbear : poured a bright golden yellow color ale with a pure white large foamy head with great retention and perfect lacing .  not thick at all , but lacking carbonation .

frothy tan head .  but it seemed way too flat and thin . the favor is there , but the body is not . unless you have a pathological obsession with oatmeal stouts , look elsewhere for your beer drinking needs
appearance : very good . the beer pours with a pillowy white head and produces above-average lacing . the colour is an appealing orange-amber .  taste is very light and mouthfeel is weak .
a - dark ruby with tan head . gorgeous lacing .  mouthfeel - watery .

made a great appearance , poured a classic beer golden with a very large creamy foamy white head with a lot of sticking .  m - watery . too thin , especially for a beer so strong , and meant to be malt-forward .

marzen-fest 2010 continues with a 12 oz into a pint a - pours a very clear , almost perfectly brown color . head formation is strong , frothy , egg shell white .  unfortunately it takes on flat , syrupy , and warm qualities from the cask . it needs more carbonation to lift it .
a : bright red with an even keel of carbonation rising to fluffy beige head . gorgeous head does n't waver for a moment .  mouthfeel is very flat .

purchased 22oz bomber from martignetti's appearance = really good looking hazy , light amber . looks refreshing and crisp .  m - maybe i 've had too many rises recently , but this is thin , very very thin .

the pheasant pours a light , pale gold colour with a whopping four finger head !  a - medium to dark amber ; almost no head , but what little bubbling there was at the edge of the glass managed to leave a slight bit of lacing s - there was nearly no aroma , and what was there was nothing distinctive t - good malt/hop balance with pleasantly surprising bitter finish m - far too thin and too little carbonation in this sample ; a bit of a sticky finish d - though it will not be mistaken for a world-class brew , this one is easy to suck down since it is thin and flavorful ; without the sticky finish , it would score a half-tick higher

like nocturnum , my favorite of the delirium family , this beer has nice white fluffy head . the beer pours orange/gold , and the head lasted through the entire glass .  mouthfeel is flat but this is the only disappointment .

this seasonal beer is complex but not quite as well rounded as say the great lakes christmas ale . after finishing my first glass i realized the head had laced all the way down from the top to the bottom and remained throughout , really quite beautiful .  smells and tastes bland and grain like . almost stale . it is a good beer to party with if all your doin is playin beer pong or circle .

* a : wow . it 's a beautiful , deep mahogany with lots of creamy head . a beer of this style could not look any better .  mouthfeel is somwhat thin for a baltic porter , with more carbonation then i 'd like .
hazy/cloudy straw yellow coloe . great lacing .  m - very thin and watery with flat carbonation .

a : pours a transparent golden body with great streams of bubble under a large white head that stayed composed after exceeding the rim of the glass . the frothy head becomes very rocky as it dissipates .  m - syrupy , mouth coating body with an obnoxious amount of carbonation . carbonation is prickly and really too much as i feel like i ca n't taste everything because of it . it does get better the more you let it warm and let the carbonation die down .

a : a clear and deep golden-coloured liquid , with a nice-looking white head that leaves a nice ring of retention . beautiful .  the mouthfeel is very thin and highly carbonated , very reminiscent of your typical macro lager .

served in a pilsner glass a : pours a deep mahogany color that looks thick . pours with very thick white head and leaves considerable lacing s : very sweet smelling brew possibly of cherries .  mouthfeel : medium-bodied . it took much diligence to see my way to the end of this beer , and , were it not for the runaway carbonation , it could 've been far better . one to revisit , provided they clear up the carbonation issue .
great retention and great lacing .  almost watery .

has a deep amber colored body with great clarity . leaves very thick lacing behind .  the flavor was both too light and 'way too bitter for a pils . it was watery and lacking in aroma . not much foam - what there was disappeared quickly . the word i 'd use to describe this beer is `` insubstantial . ''
pale golden-amber , brilliantly clear and bright , this is a beautiful beer . two fingers of head settles down to a thin disc that retains very well .  m - light and fizzy , thin bodied .

this beer poured a cloudy deep gold that bordered on light amber . it 's pure white head was thick and rich , solid lacing adorned the glass .  mouthfeel : this beer is almost watery yet with a hint to tannins that leave my mouth dry and scratchy . the beer had a watery texture in my mouth and the flavors were not in balance with the nose . while it did have a light mouthfeel and i am used to drinking hoppy dry beers , this beer would have had an easy drinkabilty yet with its unbalanced flavors i had very little desire to do so .
pours a bright orange color , slightly carbonated , with a thick pillowy off-white head .  it lacks a big full mouthfeel , and is actually very watery and disappointing .

great sustain and massive lacing . as good as it gets .  mouth : enters the mouth with very light carbonation that flattens as it goes back . overall , it 's not a bad brew , it 's got a great hop flavor but not enough depth or balance , and the weak mouthfeel ruins the experience .
this beer looks perfect . pretty gold color , with a nice big fluffy head .  mouthfeel is weak and watery .
great foamy white head .  mouthfeel - very light and dry .
pours out to a very milky pale golden , forming a rocky white head with superior retention and very nice lacing .  body is way too thick , sweet , and syrupy .

a careful pour into a tulip glass evokes a billowing , explosive cloud of soft white foam , decorated by a tiny glowing golden body alive with bubbles . the head is continually fed by a steady stream of bubbles , and holds at over two fingers throughout the drink , lacing the glass in a fashion not unlike shaving cream .  but i felt i owed it to myself to see if smaller carbonation meant bigger taste .

a : pours a light golden with a couple fingers of dense white head that reduced very slowly into a thick frothy head . beautiful rings/sheets of lacing left with every sip .  carbonation is way too strong .

pours a dark black color with no light being able to penetrate in the glass , large tan head that fades slowly to leave some patchy lacing on the glass .  mouthfeel is thin for a ris , almost watery .

aroma is of espresso , burnt grains , bittersweet chocolate , vanilla , and black walnut . taste is thin , burnt , vanilla and french roast coffee ... there is nothing more .  taste : largely dry ; bland notes of roast upfront and throughout ; slightly sour with a mildly bitter finish ; hints of chocolate ; somewhat light bodied ; thin mouthfeel .

excellent , excellent , excellent bottle condition , hazy , champagne head pour .  i 'm going to have to go against the gimmick and with the style here , the mouthfeel just is n't there . i 'm not impressed at all , it 's like a half flat beer that you 've left on your desk whilst reviewing a beer and forgotten about it only to come back to it 30 mins later . the shining point of this beer is it 's drinkability .

nice maple , nice cognac pipe tobacco aroma going on as well as some nice syrup smell . great . t- initially , some nice matliness , caramel/maple , then some dry hops .  mouthfeel/ drinkability : the carbonation isnt stinging and seems appropriate . the body of the beer seems far too thin .

poured out of the bottle into my samuel smith 's pint glass a jet black in color with a nice 2 finger tannish-brown head that settled to about one finger after a few minutes .  a nice chocolatey finish that lingers for a while on the palate is the best part about this beer . m : poor .

a : golden , almost apricot in appearance with about a 2 inch head and tons of carbonation . s : i detected victory 's hop profile a mile away ! yeasty , with citrus notes .  nose : it 's aroma is a little bit malty , a little bit citrusy flavor : the taste has some lemon/citrus notes w/ some hints of maltiness , but the big thing that you notice is how fizzy this beer is . it 's far too fizzy for me .

pours a clear orange , chunks , one of the coolest looking heads ever , kind of a reverse cascading tan , head goes fast , some lace .  mouthfeel is kind of thin and not very pleasant as the carbonation dies down and leaves a sort of flat cola sensation , without the stickiness .

fine bubbles rise vigorously to create a large , long-lived fluffy white head atop a bright goldenrod colored body .  d-a little rough on the palate with the huge carbonation and extremely grainy feel .
a really nice looking pour .  mouthfeel is boring and watery .

appearance - black with no light passing through . good tan head on top . looks like a very nice stout or porter . nice amount of head but with even less lacing then their other beers .  on first taste the mouthfeel seems a little thin . all in all tasty , but quite thin and seriously lacking in body .
the aroma is very good , with some slightly tart chocolate-covered cherries and lots of caramel malts and toffee as well .  watery mouthfeel in terms of a stout .
the appearance is a deep coffee color , heading almost to burgundy . the light tan head is large and resistant , preventing me from quickly getting into it .  medium body . nearly flat .

a - wow , the gentlest of pours brings forth a beautiful ( slightly clouded due to my misjudgment ) light orange brew with the most ridiculous pillowy head i have ever seen , four fingers to start , sticks around for what seems like forever , and leaves great lacing s - pear and apple , along with a little cut grass , lemon zest , lots of yeast , clove and pepper t - smooth maltiness , slightly tart , with a lot of green apple , a little fresh hay , some yeasty goodness .  m - the body is vanishingly thin and i feel the carbonation is too high for an english porter .

poured into a 16 oz becher , a near opaque dark brown with a huge rocky head and plenty of sticking foam , truly gorgeous , then it the wheels come loose from the cart .  mouthfeel is overly fizzy , making an already light beer even fluffier . overall , this is an interesting beer that could be very refreshing if less carbonated .

i wish short 's would start putting dates on their bottles ... appearance is black , slight reddish/dark purplish hue that shines through the edge of the glass . dark tan and creamy head with purple hues .  neither was the taste - a bit bitter , no real aftertaste , with a weak , watery mouth feel .
pours a dark brown with nice ruby highlights and a very frothy cappuccino head that lasts and leaves abundant lacing .  not the worst tasting beer ever , but very thin and watery .
this beer is a very dark brown with a dense , light tan head that provides excellent lacing .  mouthfeel was thin like water , very little body .
big chocolate smell , hint of coffee .  m- spritzy , carbonation fills your mouth swelling your cheeks slightly . rough , bubbly and thin .
12 oz can poured into pint glass a : pours opaque black , with about 1 & 1/2 finger head ... nice & tan . good head retention very nice lacing .  2/5 m : thin and watery with medium carbonation .

took a trip down to colorado springs last week , mainly to visit this brewery . aromas of passion fruit , grapefruit and tangerine . medium bodied , and not at all bitter , with flavors of oak , booze and sweet malt .  good for a lager , but way too much carbonation really throwing this beer off .
a - looking pretty good , especially after being poured from a room temperature shelf in almost clear glass .  thin body looked nice in the glass , but was over carbonated . kind of a watery finish .

pours a beautifully brown color with an uber thick bubbly head that dissipates very slowly leaving excellent lacing on the glass .  was excited to see this one.. but again newcastle has let me down again ... on the bottle it says `` blood red ale '' .. it pours a reddish-brown color.. smells a little funky ... way too carbonated for my liking .

a : dark brown and reds blend into an opaque liquid topped by 4 fingers of off white head that paints the glass all the way until the end . a beautiful beer .  really fizzy ( like coca-cola fizzy ) on the tongue , with a metallic finish , not really what i was hoping for , dissapointing .
